original: / rnam shes bya min zhes bya ba ni shes bya rnam pa lnga la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lngas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: mtshon min zhes bya ba 'di rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa'am /

original: rig bya min zhes bya ba ni rang byung gi ye shes skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rnam pa thams cad mngon par rtogs pas rig pa med pa'i tshul gyis rig par bya ba'o //

translated: “Incapable of being known” means that because all phenomena are directly realized in every way without error in a single moment of naturally occurring timeless awareness, they are to be known in the manner of their being unknowable.

original: skye 'jig med cing zhes bya ba ni skye ba ni 'byung ba yin la ;
analyzed: skye 'jig med cing zhes bya ba ni skye ba ni 'byung ba yin la ;
translated: “Without origination or destruction” means that origination is occurrence and

translated: “Not an object of conceptualization” means that it is not conceptualized as an object of perception, an object of grasping, a self-entity, an other-entity, or an entity.

analyzed: mtshan ma med cing zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhan don bsgrub phyir brtul zhugs kyis //

analyzed: byang chub chen por blos byas rnams //

analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsir gzung ba'i phyir //

analyzed: zhes smras te / gzhan don bsgrub phyir zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhan dag gi don bya ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: brtul zhugs kyis zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis brtul zhugs drag po blangs pas so //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po'i phyir /
translated: Because the Lord, for the sake of the Great Vehicle,🔽taught the extensive meaning of the inexhaustible letters of nectar.

original: de nyid bdud rtsi'i yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / don shin tu rgya chen po bka' stsal pa de'i rjes su @42b slob dpon gyis kyang de dbu ma'i bstan bcos su rgya cher bstan gyi /
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi'i yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / don shin tu rgya chen po bka' stsal pa de'i rjes su @42b slob dpon gyis kyang de dbu ma'i bstan bcos su rgya cher bstan gyi /

analyzed: bstan bcos mtha' dag gi don gyi sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa dang 'dra bar blos yang dag mthong ba na /

original: spyi sdom byed pa ni /
analyzed: spyi sdom byed pa ni /
translated: one should summarize the general meaning.🔽Not forsaking the thought of awakening,

original: byang chub sems ni mi gtong dang // thub pa'i brtul zhugs yang dag brten //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni mi gtong dang // thub pa'i brtul zhugs yang dag brten //
translated: and properly relying on the Muni's discipline,

original: de nyid shes pa tshol ba ni //🔽don kun sgrub pa'i spyod pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa tshol ba ni // don kun sgrub pa'i spyod pa yin //
translated: Seeking to know reality,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the practice of accomplishing all goals.

original: byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa rnams kyis dang por byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa rnams kyis dang por byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: Those who have made the aspiration for great enlightenment should first of all never be separated from keeping enlightenment in mind.

original: de nas phyi rol ba'i thub pa'i chos dang mthun par theg pa chen po las gsungs pa'i thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol ba'i thub pa'i chos dang mthun par theg pa chen po las gsungs pa'i thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par brten par bya'o //
translated: Then, in accordance with the Dharma of the Muni, they should correctly undertake the Muni’s observances as taught in the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i 'og tu phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med pas gzhung lugs thams cad rnam par brtags nas rigs pa dang lung dang mi 'gal ba'i de nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ste ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med pas gzhung lugs thams cad rnam par brtags nas rigs pa dang lung dang mi 'gal ba'i de nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ste ;
translated: After that, without a mind that falls into partiality, they should examine all the scriptures and strive to understand reality that is not contradicted by reasoning and scripture.

original: de ltar spyod pa gsum po de dag ni rang dang gzhan gyi don thams cad sgrub pa'i spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa gsum po de dag ni rang dang gzhan gyi don thams cad sgrub pa'i spyod pa yin te /
translated: These three practices are the practices that accomplish all one’s own and others’ goals.

original: bstan bcos 'di la mdor bstan pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di la mdor bstan pa ni de yin no //
translated: This is the brief presentation in this treatise.

original: de la re zhig byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba je brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba je brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the non-abandonment of the thought of awakening will be explained.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: What is called the thought of awakening?

original: byams pa dang ni snying rje dang // shes pa chen pos brgyan pa yi //
analyzed: byams pa dang ni snying rje dang // shes pa chen pos brgyan pa yi //
translated: and with the great wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas sa bon byang chub sems //🔽de phyir mkhas pas de mi btang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa bon byang chub sems // de phyir mkhas pas de mi btang //
translated: The seed of Buddhahood is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the wise one should not abandon it.

original: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sgrol ba dang / mngon par byang chub par bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad bsgral ba dang / sgrol ba dang / mngon par byang chub par bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Great love is the four productions of the thought of enlightenment, which are: to liberate all sentient beings, to liberate, to fully awaken, and to pass beyond sorrow.

original: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba dang / ngan 'gro las yongs su bskyab pa dang / theg pa dman pa las bslang ba dang / yang dag pa'i lam du dgod pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba dang / ngan 'gro las yongs su bskyab pa dang / theg pa dman pa las bslang ba dang / yang dag pa'i lam du dgod pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: Great compassion is the four productions of the thought of enlightenment, which are: to work for the welfare of all sentient beings, to protect from the miserable existences, to lift up from the lower vehicles, and to establish in the true path.

original: / shes pa chen po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / shes pa chen po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The great wisdom is twofold:

original: thabs kyi shes pa dang / shes rab kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pa dang / shes rab kyi shes pa'o //
translated: the wisdom of means and the wisdom of insight.

original: de la thabs kyi shes pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skyed cing /
analyzed: de la thabs kyi shes pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skyed cing /
translated: The knowledge of means is the generation of all roots of virtue endowed with the complete purity of the three spheres,🔽and the dedication of them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /🔽bla na med @43a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing / bla na med @43a * //
translated: shared in common with all sentient beings,

original: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa dang / tshogs gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa dang / tshogs gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: as well as the confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, and so forth, and the completion of the three collections.

original: shes rab kyi shes pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / yongs su ma grub pas so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa skad cig gcig dang ldan pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi shes pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / yongs su ma grub pas so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa skad cig gcig dang ldan pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of wisdom is the generation of the knowledge of the nature of discernment endowed with a single moment, by means of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, the absence of signs, the absence of conditioning, non-arising, the absence of entities, and non-establishment.

original: de dag gis brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa bon na ni byang chub kyi sems yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa bon na ni byang chub kyi sems yin te /
translated: The seed of the Buddha stage adorned with those perfections is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the complete knowledge of all things in all modes.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub kyi phyir sems pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub kyi phyir sems pa'o //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the intention for enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir de sangs rgyas kyi sa bon yin pa de'i phyir mkhas pa sems can la blta bas bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa dang mos brgya chen po de mi gtang bar bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de sangs rgyas kyi sa bon yin pa de'i phyir mkhas pa sems can la blta bas bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mos pa dang mos brgya chen po de mi gtang bar bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Since that is the seed of the Buddha stage, the wise one should not give up that intention, that superior intention, that faith, that great faith, in looking at sentient beings.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya bar rigs she na /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya bar rigs she na /
translated: What is the proper thing to do by generating the Thought of Enlightenment?🔽Therefore: The wise one, with great courage,

original: de'i phyir / blo ldan snying stobs che ba dang // gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod cing //
analyzed: de'i phyir / blo ldan snying stobs che ba dang // gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod cing //
translated: cannot bear the suffering of others,🔽and having begun right effort,

original: yang dag brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang // mthu dang ldan zhing mkhas pas ni //🔽shes rab snang ba med pa yi //
analyzed: yang dag brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang // mthu dang ldan zhing mkhas pas ni // shes rab snang ba med pa yi //
translated: with power and skill,

original: 'jig rten kun la blta byas nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la blta byas nas //
translated: having looked at the whole world🔽without the light of wisdom,

original: 'khor ba mi gtsang sa 'og nas //🔽bdag nyid rgal bas bsgral bar rigs //
analyzed: 'khor ba mi gtsang sa 'og nas // bdag nyid rgal bas bsgral bar rigs //
translated: From the filth of cyclic existence,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is fitting that I, having crossed over, should liberate others.

original: blo dang ldan pa chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab dri ma med pa dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs che bar bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi phyed cing brtan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab dri ma med pa dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs che bar bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi phyed cing brtan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The wise one, endowed with stainless wisdom, the characteristic of which is the thorough differentiation of all phenomena, and endowed with a mind of great courage, which is firm and not divided by all the demons and afflictions,

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa sems can thams cad bdag nyid dang 'dra bar khas blangs nas de dag sdug bsngal bas bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / yang dag par brtson 'grus brtsams pa dge ba'i chos kyi spyod pa ngag la brtson 'grus brtan pa brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa sems can thams cad bdag nyid dang 'dra bar khas blangs nas de dag sdug bsngal bas bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / yang dag par brtson 'grus brtsams pa dge ba'i chos kyi spyod pa ngag la brtson 'grus brtan pa brtsams pa dang /
translated: and who cannot bear the suffering of others, having accepted all sentient beings as the same as himself, and who is suffering because they are suffering, and who is correctly engaged in the practice of virtue, who is engaged in the practice of the speech of stable effort,🔽and who is endowed with the power of the roots of virtue, which is the cause of the arising of the power of the mind of enlightenment,

original: mthu dang ldan pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa dang / mkhas pa shes nyen can gyi ni shes rab kyi snang ba med pa blo'i gsal ba dang bral ba'i 'jig rten ma lus pa kun la blta ba yang dang @43b yang du brtag pa byas nas 'khor ba mi gtsang ba'i sa 'og nas /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa dang / mkhas pa shes nyen can gyi ni shes rab kyi snang ba med pa blo'i gsal ba dang bral ba'i 'jig rten ma lus pa kun la blta ba yang dang @43b yang du brtag pa byas nas 'khor ba mi gtsang ba'i sa 'og nas /
translated: The wise, who are powerful and able to accomplish the aims of themselves and others, should repeatedly examine and look upon the entire world, which is devoid of the light of wisdom and is bereft of the clarity of intelligence.🔽

original: bdag nyid rgal bas 'jig rten yang bsgral bar rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid rgal bas 'jig rten yang bsgral bar rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Powerful, able to accomplish the aims of self and other, and wise, having the light of wisdom, he should repeatedly look at the entire world, which is devoid of the light of intelligence, and, having investigated, should think, “I will cross over the impure earth of cyclic existence, and it is fitting that I should liberate the world as well.”

original: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba dang po bshad zin to //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba dang po bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the first chapter, “Generation of the Mind for the Liberation of All Sentient Beings,” is explained.

original: sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas //
translated: The second chapter, “Generation of the Mind for the Liberation of All Sentient Beings,” is explained.

original: gang zhig shes rab mtshon rnon gyis //
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab mtshon rnon gyis //
translated: He who, with the sharp weapon of wisdom,

original: 'ching ba kun bcad grol gyur pa //
analyzed: 'ching ba kun bcad grol gyur pa //
translated: has cut all bonds and become liberated,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid ldan pa yis //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid ldan pa yis //
translated: endowed with the nature of compassion,

original: gang phyir mgon med sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: gang phyir mgon med sdug bsngal ba //
translated: for the sake of those who are suffering and without a protector,

original: 'khor ba'i brtson ra mi bzad par //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i brtson ra mi bzad par //
translated: In the unbearable prison of cyclic existence,

original: 'dod chags la sogs sgrog gis bcings //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs sgrog gis bcings //
translated: bound by the fetters of passion and so on,

original: bag med pa yi chang 'thungs nas //
analyzed: bag med pa yi chang 'thungs nas //
translated: having drunk the wine of heedlessness,🔽and fallen asleep in the sleep of delusion,

original: gti mug gnyid kyis log pa dang // rnam par rtog pa'i chom rkun gyis //
analyzed: gti mug gnyid kyis log pa dang // rnam par rtog pa'i chom rkun gyis //
translated: the thief of discursive thought🔽steals the entire collection of virtue.

original: dge tshogs ma lus rkus pa dag / gal te grol bar mi byed na //
analyzed: dge tshogs ma lus rkus pa dag / gal te grol bar mi byed na //
translated: If you do not liberate them,

original: mthu ldan mthu ni ci la phan //
analyzed: mthu ldan mthu ni ci la phan //
translated: what use is the power of the powerful?

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang zhig shes rab kyi mtshon nyon mongs pa ma lus pa gcod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ral gri shin tu rnon pos srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba'i 'ching ba kun ma lus par bcad cing bdag nyid grol bar gyur ba snying rje'i bdag nyid dang ldan pas gzhan
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab kyi mtshon nyon mongs pa ma lus pa gcod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ral gri shin tu rnon pos srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba'i 'ching ba kun ma lus par bcad cing bdag nyid grol bar gyur ba snying rje'i bdag nyid dang ldan pas gzhan
translated: Those who, with the sword of wisdom, the very sharp weapon that cuts all the afflictions without exception, cut all the fetters of the bonds of existence without exception, and having liberated themselves,

original: dag kyang grol bar byed pa de ni mthu dang ldan pa'i mthu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dag kyang grol bar byed pa de ni mthu dang ldan pa'i mthu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: with compassion liberate others, they have the power of the powerful.

original: byams pa'i skabs su snying rje'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pa ni byams pa dang snying rje gnyis zung du 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir mi rung ba med do //
analyzed: byams pa'i skabs su snying rje'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pa ni byams pa dang snying rje gnyis zung du 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir mi rung ba med do //
translated: The phrase “endowed with the nature of compassion” is mentioned in the context of loving-kindness because loving-kindness and compassion occur in conjunction with one another.

original: mgon med ces bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa mgon med pa'i chos bcu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgon med ces bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa mgon med pa'i chos bcu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Without a protector” means that they are devoid of the ten qualities of a protector, such as faith, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gdung ba dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gdung ba dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Suffering” means that they are subject to the torments of suffering, such as death, transmigration, and the seeking for a new birth.

original: 'khor ba'i btson ra mi bzad par zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'ching ba'i gnas 'jigs pa mang ba skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi dpyang thag ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed par ro ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i btson ra mi bzad par zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'ching ba'i gnas 'jigs pa mang ba skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi dpyang thag ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed par ro ;
translated: “The unbearable prison of cyclic existence” is a place of bondage to existence, which is characterized by a continuous series of births, old ages, and so on, that is not severed, and which is filled with many dangers.

original: /'dod chags la sogs sgrog gis bcings zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu sbyor ba dgu po lcags sgrog dang 'dra ba dag gis bcings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'dod chags la sogs sgrog gis bcings zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu sbyor ba dgu po lcags sgrog dang 'dra ba dag gis bcings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Bound by the fetters of desire and so on” means that they are bound by the nine fetters of desire and so on, which are like shackles.

original: bag med pa'i chang 'thungs nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba bag med @44a * //
analyzed: bag med pa'i chang 'thungs nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / le lo zhes bya ba bag med @44a * //
translated: “Having drunk the liquor of heedlessness” means that they have drunk the liquor of desire, hatred, ignorance, and laziness, which is like heedlessness.

original: pa chad dang 'dra ba bsten cing myos par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa chad dang 'dra ba bsten cing myos par gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having become intoxicated” means that they have become intoxicated by the liquor of heedlessness.

original: gti mug gnyid kyis log pa zhes bya ba ni me shes pa'i gnyid kyis shin tu rmya bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gnyid kyis log pa zhes bya ba ni me shes pa'i gnyid kyis shin tu rmya bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having fallen asleep in the sleep of ignorance” means that they have fallen asleep in the sleep of ignorance, which is like a deep sleep.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i chom rkun gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa chom rkun dang 'dra ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i chom rkun gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa chom rkun dang 'dra ba dag gis so //
translated: “By the thieves of discursive thought” means by the thieves of discursive thought, which are like thieves, such as desire, malice, and harmfulness.

original: dge tshogs ma lus rkus pa dag / ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi nor thams cad phrogs pa dag go //
analyzed: dge tshogs ma lus rkus pa dag / ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi nor thams cad phrogs pa dag go //
translated: “Having stolen all the accumulations of virtue” means that they have stolen all the wealth of the seven riches of the noble ones.

original: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa bshad zin to//
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa bshad zin to//
translated: The second chapter, called “The Generation of the Thought to Liberate All Sentient Beings,” is finished.

original: sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub par bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub par bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas //
translated: The third chapter, called “The Generation of the Thought to Enlighten All Sentient Beings,” is begun.

original: gang zhig lag pa'i mthus bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: gang zhig lag pa'i mthus bsgrubs pa //
translated: The pleasure that is produced by the effort of the hand,

original: 'dod pas bskyed pa'i bde chung yang //
analyzed: 'dod pas bskyed pa'i bde chung yang //
translated: The small pleasure that is produced by desire,

original: gcig pu gdu bar za byed pa //
analyzed: gcig pu gdu bar za byed pa //
translated: Which is enjoyed by one person alone,

original: de yang mkhas pas smad gyur na //
analyzed: de yang mkhas pas smad gyur na //
translated: Is despised by the wise.🔽The universal monarch, the lord of gods, and the universal donor,

original: 'khor los sgyur dang dbang po dang // tshongs pa la yang rab dkon pa //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur dang dbang po dang // tshongs pa la yang rab dkon pa //
translated: Are very rare,

original: sred pa rnam par gcod pa dang // thabs kyi sgo nas thun mong ba //
analyzed: sred pa rnam par gcod pa dang // thabs kyi sgo nas thun mong ba //
translated: The cutting off of craving, and the commonality by way of method,

original: len dang zad dang mthar thug dang // sdug la sogs pas mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: len dang zad dang mthar thug dang // sdug la sogs pas mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: The taking up, the exhaustion, the finality, and the change by the beautiful, etc.,

original: sdug bsngal ma lus zhi byed pa'i //🔽de nyid don rtogs bdud rtsi ci ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma lus zhi byed pa'i // de nyid don rtogs bdud rtsi ci ;
translated: The pacification of all suffering,🔽The nectar of the realization of reality.

original: / zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is that?

original: re zhig 'jig rten na gang zhig rang gi lag pa'i mthus bsgrubs pa 'dod pas bskyed pa'i bde ba cha shas chung ngu yang bdag gcig pus grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / mgron la gcugs pa dang / bstabs pa med par gdu zhing 'dod pas kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis za bar byed pa de yang mkhas pas smad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten na gang zhig rang gi lag pa'i mthus bsgrubs pa 'dod pas bskyed pa'i bde ba cha shas chung ngu yang bdag gcig pus grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / mgron la gcugs pa dang / bstabs pa med par gdu zhing 'dod pas kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyis za bar byed pa de yang mkhas pas smad par 'gyur te /
translated: For, in the first place, even a small amount of pleasure that is produced by one’s own hand and by the desire to enjoy it, is not shared with friends, relatives, guests, or loved ones, but is consumed by one’s own self with a mind that is completely wrapped up in desire.

original: ser snas kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser snas kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also despised by the wise, because it is a mind that is completely wrapped up in greed.

original: de yang de ltar 'gyur na gang zhig rang gis de nyid kyi don rtogs pas bdud rtsi rnyed nas sems can la mi ltos par bdag rang gcig pus rtogs par byed na de ji ltar smad par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de yang de ltar 'gyur na gang zhig rang gis de nyid kyi don rtogs pas bdud rtsi rnyed nas sems can la mi ltos par bdag rang gcig pus rtogs par byed na de ji ltar smad par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: If that is so, then what can be said about one who, having discovered the nectar of the Dharma by his own efforts, does not share it with others, but enjoys it by himself, without regard for other sentient beings?

original: de la 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba ni 'khor lo dang / nor bu dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / dmag dpon zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dang / gling bzhi'i dbang phyug dang /🔽yul la @44b longs spyod pa mi'i bde ba thams cad las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba ni 'khor lo dang / nor bu dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / blon po dang / btsun mo dang / dmag dpon zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dang / gling bzhi'i dbang phyug dang / yul la @44b longs spyod pa mi'i bde ba thams cad las lhag pa'o //
translated: The happiness of a universal monarch is to possess the seven precious things: the precious wheel, jewel, queen, minister, elephant, horse, and general; to be the lord of the four continents; and to have all the happiness of humans.

original: dbang po'i bde ba ni lha'i pho brang na lha mo lha'i rin po che dri ma med pa'i 'od kyis snang bar byas pa dang / dga' ba'i tshal la sogs pa'i longs spyod shin tu che ba'o //🔽tshangs pa'i bde ba ni stong la dbang bsgyur ba'i tshangs pa /
analyzed: dbang po'i bde ba ni lha'i pho brang na lha mo lha'i rin po che dri ma med pa'i 'od kyis snang bar byas pa dang / dga' ba'i tshal la sogs pa'i longs spyod shin tu che ba'o // tshangs pa'i bde ba ni stong la dbang bsgyur ba'i tshangs pa /
translated: The happiness of the sense faculties is to have the great enjoyments of the gods in the divine palaces, illuminated by the stainless light of the divine jewels, and the enjoyments of the pleasure groves and so forth.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba yul gyi bde ba thams cad las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba yul gyi bde ba thams cad las lhag pa'o //
translated: The happiness of Brahmā is to be Brahmā, the lord of a thousand worlds, who meditates on the four divine abodes and tastes the bliss of concentration, which is greater than all the happiness of the sense faculties.

original: de dag la yang de nyid kyi don rtogs pa bdud rtsi rab tu dkon te /
analyzed: de dag la yang de nyid kyi don rtogs pa bdud rtsi rab tu dkon te /
translated: But even for them, the nectar of realizing suchness is very rare.

original: gang gi phyir srid pa rnam par gcod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / thar pa la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa rnam par gcod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / thar pa la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the elimination of cyclic existence” means the abandonment of attachment to desire, existence, and liberation.

original: thabs kyi sgo nas thun mong ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dag ni gzhan rgyud la 'pho ba med kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byar rung ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi sgo nas thun mong ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dag ni gzhan rgyud la 'pho ba med kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byar rung ste /
translated: The phrase “in terms of method, it is common” means that merit and demerit do not transfer to another’s continuum, but the enjoyment of the result is suitable to be shared with all sentient beings.

original: mchod sbyin chen po'i don du nor dang 'bru'i tshogs bsags pa bzhin pas ji ltar zang zing gi sbyin pa chung yang tshe rabs gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur 'grub pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu sems can rnams la stobs shing smon
analyzed: mchod sbyin chen po'i don du nor dang 'bru'i tshogs bsags pa bzhin pas ji ltar zang zing gi sbyin pa chung yang tshe rabs gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur 'grub pa de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu sems can rnams la stobs shing smon
translated: Just as a small gift of material things can result in a hundred thousandfold karmic maturation in other lives, in the same way, a small root of virtue that is shared with sentient beings and dedicated to great enlightenment will result in a hundred thousandfold karmic maturation.

original: lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dus na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu grangs med pa dang tshad med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dus na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu grangs med pa dang tshad med par 'gyur te /
translated: And in the perfection of the path, the maturational result becomes immeasurable and unlimited at the time of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 'dir thabs ni sems can thams cad kyang bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir thabs ni sems can thams cad kyang bde bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the method is the thought “May all sentient beings be happy.”🔽It is not subject to taking up, ending, or finality,

original: len dang zad dang mthar thug dang // sdug la sogs pas mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: len dang zad dang mthar thug dang // sdug la sogs pas mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: and it is not subject to beauty, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la len pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la len pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: “Taking up” is birth.

original: zad pa ni dga' ba'o ;
analyzed: zad pa ni dga' ba'o ;
translated: “Ending” is pleasure.

original: / mthar thug pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: / mthar thug pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: “Finality” is death.

original: sdug la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang / 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gsum dang / de dag las byung ba mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sdug la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang / 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gsum dang / de dag las byung ba mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “Beauty, etc.” refers to the three kinds of suffering, i.e., the suffering of the formative forces, the suffering of change, and the suffering due to suffering, and to the sorrow, lamentation, pain, and depression that arise from them.

original: de dag thams cad kyis mi 'gyur ba ni sun ma phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis mi 'gyur ba ni sun ma phyin pa'o //
translated: “Not subject to” all of these means not subject to being corrupted by them.

original: sdug bsngal ma lus zhig byed pa'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma lus zhig byed pa'i //
translated: The elixir that removes all suffering

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //🔽de nyid don rtogs bdud rtsi ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo // de nyid don rtogs bdud rtsi ste //
translated: The suffering of birth, etc.🔽The elixir that realizes reality

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don rtogs pa nyid bdud rtsi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don rtogs pa nyid bdud rtsi ste /
translated: The realization of reality itself is the elixir,

original: 'chi 'pho med pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽byams @45a * //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir ro // byams @45a * //
translated: because it causes the attainment of the state of immortality.

original: pa chen po'i bshad pa /
analyzed: pa chen po'i bshad pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Great Compassion

original: sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub par bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gsum pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub par bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gsum pa bshad zin to //
translated: The generation of the Thought to bring about the full enlightenment of all sentient beings has been explained in the third chapter.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas //🔽gzhan yang sngon chad nyon mongs pa'i //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas // gzhan yang sngon chad nyon mongs pa'i //
translated: The generation of the Thought to bring about the complete Nirvana of all sentient beings is treated in the fourth chapter.🔽Moreover, in the past,

original: gdon gyis brlams pa bdag gis ni //
analyzed: gdon gyis brlams pa bdag gis ni //
translated: I, possessed by the demon of the defilements,

original: smas la 'gyur byed 'debs pa bzhin //🔽sdug bsngal nad pa gang sdug byas //
analyzed: smas la 'gyur byed 'debs pa bzhin // sdug bsngal nad pa gang sdug byas //
translated: like a madman,🔽have caused suffering to those who were suffering.

original: skye ba gzhan du gang dag gis //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du gang dag gis //
translated: In other lives,

original: byams dang bsnyen bkur phan pa byas //
analyzed: byams dang bsnyen bkur phan pa byas //
translated: You have shown me love, respect, and kindness.

original: de la lan du phan gdags pa //🔽mya ngan bzla bas gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: de la lan du phan gdags pa // mya ngan bzla bas gzhan ci yod //
translated: In return, I will help you.

original: ces bya ba smras te /🔽gzhan yang sngon chad 'das pa'i dus dag tu nyon mongs pa sems kyi rgyud la gnod pa byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i gdon gyis brlams par gyur pa bdag gis mtshon la sogs pas smas pa'i lus la 'gyur byed 'debs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te / gzhan yang sngon chad 'das pa'i dus dag tu nyon mongs pa sems kyi rgyud la gnod pa byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i gdon gyis brlams par gyur pa bdag gis mtshon la sogs pas smas pa'i lus la 'gyur byed 'debs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal
translated: What else is there to do but to console you?”🔽Moreover, in the past, when my mind was afflicted by the evil spirits of the afflictions such as attachment, I harmed others with weapons and so on, as if I were possessed by a demon.

original: nad pa gang dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nad kyis lus dang yid mi bde bar gyur pa dag la gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / btson du bzung ba la sogs pa gnod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal dag byas shing bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: nad pa gang dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nad kyis lus dang yid mi bde bar gyur pa dag la gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / btson du bzung ba la sogs pa gnod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal dag byas shing bskyed pa dang /
translated: I inflicted suffering on the sick, those who were afflicted by the disease of suffering such as birth and so on, and I caused them to experience physical and mental pain. I killed them, bound them, imprisoned them, and so on. I created and increased their suffering.

original: tshe rabs brjes pa'i skye ba gzhan du pha dang / ma dang ; bu dang grogs po dang / nye dur gyur pa khong dge ba shin tu phan pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa gang dag gis bdag la byams pa dang bsnyen bkur dang phan pa byas pa de dag la lan du phan gdags pa ni nying  mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba ma lus par bcad par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i
analyzed: tshe rabs brjes pa'i skye ba gzhan du pha dang / ma dang ; bu dang grogs po dang / nye dur gyur pa khong dge ba shin tu phan pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa gang dag gis bdag la byams pa dang bsnyen bkur dang phan pa byas pa de dag la lan du phan gdags pa ni nying  mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba ma lus par bcad par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i
translated: In other lives, in other rebirths, they have been my father, mother, son, friend, and relative. They are all dear to me, and they have helped me and wished me great benefit and happiness. What can I do for them in return? I will help them by leading them to the state of nirvana without remainder, the realm in which all the bonds of rebirth are completely severed.

original: dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba las gzhan ci yod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba las gzhan ci yod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What else can I do for them?

original: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba bzhi pa bshad zin to //
translated: This concludes exposition four of Great Love: The Generation of the Mind That Asks, “How Can I Free All Sentient Beings from Suffering?”

original: sems bskyed pa de dag ni don che ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de dag ni don che ste /
translated: These mind generations are of great import.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams kyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “The bodhisattva who wishes to benefit, help, and bring happiness to sentient beings, and to accomplish what is truly excellent and happiness, thinks as follows:

original: ji ltar bdag rgal nas sems can ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar bdag grol nas @45b sems can ma grol ba rnams dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag rgal nas sems can ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bya'o // ji ltar bdag grol nas @45b sems can ma grol ba rnams dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: ‘Just as I have crossed over, I will help sentient beings who have not crossed over.🔽Just as I have been liberated, I will liberate sentient beings who have not been liberated.

original: ji ltar bdag dbugs phyin nas sems can dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dbugs phyin nas sems can dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Just as I have found relief, I will bring relief to sentient beings who have not found relief.

original: ji ltar bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas /
translated: Just as I have attained complete nirvana,

original: sems can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o snyam ste ;
analyzed: sems can yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o snyam ste ;
translated: I will lead sentient beings who have not attained complete nirvana to complete nirvana.’

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam gyis tshad gzung ba dang / rgya mtsho chen po ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pas bcu zhing tshad gzung ba kho nar rung gi sems bskyed pa de dag gi bsod nams kyi tshad ni gzung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam gyis tshad gzung ba dang / rgya mtsho chen po ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pas bcu zhing tshad gzung ba kho nar rung gi sems bskyed pa de dag gi bsod nams kyi tshad ni gzung bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is possible to measure the trichiliocosm with the tip of a hair, and it is possible to measure the great ocean with a hundredth of the tip of a hair, but the extent of the merit of those arousings of mind cannot be measured.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis sems bskyed pa de dag mngon par bsgrubs nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
analyzed: gang gis sems bskyed pa de dag mngon par bsgrubs nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
translated: Having accomplished those arousings of mind, they rejoice in all the bodhisattvas’

original: ci nas kyang gnyis kyi 'du shes med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems ma yin pa dang / sems las gzhan ma yin pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas rnam par 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs
analyzed: ci nas kyang gnyis kyi 'du shes med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems ma yin pa dang / sems las gzhan ma yin pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems can de dag ni bdud kyi gnas rnam par 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs
translated: They dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, but they do not have the notion of two, they do not have the notion of not two, they do not have the notion of mind, they do not have the notion of not mind. Those sentient beings who dedicate in that way destroy the abode of Māra.”

original: pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: pa lta bu'o /
translated: And so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa nyon mongs pa'i cha shas ma lus par spangs pa rnams ni ji skad smras pa de dag rung gi / gang dag gis stobs bskyed pa ma lus pa de dag ni rang nyid srid pa dag dang /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa nyon mongs pa'i cha shas ma lus par spangs pa rnams ni ji skad smras pa de dag rung gi / gang dag gis stobs bskyed pa ma lus pa de dag ni rang nyid srid pa dag dang /
translated: “It is appropriate that those who have attained the perfection of their own aim, who have abandoned all parts of the afflictions, do what you say, but those who have not generated the power to do that are not able to do what you say.

original: srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gnod bzhin pa na ji ltar gzhan dag bsgral ba dang / dgrol ba dang / mngon par byang chub par bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba bzod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gnod bzhin pa na ji ltar gzhan dag bsgral ba dang / dgrol ba dang / mngon par byang chub par bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba bzod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one who is being harmed by the afflictions that are based on existence bear to liberate, liberate, fully awaken, and lead to nirvana those who are in the power of the afflictions?🔽In response to that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de'i lan du snying rje chen po sngon du btang nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i lan du snying rje chen po sngon du btang nas //
translated: The wise, whose minds are delighted by the joy

original: gzhan don byed las byung ba yi //🔽dga' bas sems dga' mkhas pa dag / ral gri rab tu 'bar 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan don byed las byung ba yi // dga' bas sems dga' mkhas pa dag / ral gri rab tu 'bar 'dra ba'i //
translated: that arises from benefiting others,

original: srid pa dag gis gnod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dag gis gnod mi 'gyur //
translated: are not harmed by existence,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /🔽sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa nyid la sogs pas 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pas mkhas pa dag ni ral gri rab tu 'bar ba dang 'dra ba'i srid pa 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba dag gis gnod @46a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te / sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa nyid la sogs pas 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pas mkhas pa dag ni ral gri rab tu 'bar ba dang 'dra ba'i srid pa 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba dag gis gnod @46a * //
translated: which is like a flaming sword.

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise, who benefit the world through generosity, kind words, beneficial actions, and practicing what one preaches, are not harmed by existence, which is like a flaming sword, that is, by the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni gzhan gyi don byed pa las byung ba'i dga' bas lus dang sems kyi rgyud dga' bar gyur cing byang chub kyang gzhan gyi don kho na'i phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa nye bar blang ba'i phyir las mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni gzhan gyi don byed pa las byung ba'i dga' bas lus dang sems kyi rgyud dga' bar gyur cing byang chub kyang gzhan gyi don kho na'i phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa nye bar blang ba'i phyir las mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang ;
translated: Because they are delighted by the delight that arises from benefiting others, and because they desire enlightenment only for the sake of benefiting others, and because they do not create karma to take up existence, and

original: srid pa'i srid pa dang bral ba'i phyir de dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i srid pa dang bral ba'i phyir de dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not harmed by existence, since they are free from the existence of existence.

original: snying rje chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba dang po bshad zin to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i bshad pa sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba dang po bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of great compassion, the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, which is the means of accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings, has been completed.

original: yang na 'di ltar gnod par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar gnod par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Or, it is not harmed in this way:

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa mi byed pas //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa mi byed pas //
translated: Because they do not commit immoral acts,

original: ngan 'gro'i sgo kun gcad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sgo kun gcad pa'i phyir //
translated: all the doors to the miserable realms are closed.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam lhag par spyod pas gnod pa med pa na gzhan dag kyang de dag nyid la sbyor bar byed pas ngan 'gro 'gro ba ngan pa'i sgo thams cad gcad pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i sgo glegs 'byed par byed cing
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam lhag par spyod pas gnod pa med pa na gzhan dag kyang de dag nyid la sbyor bar byed pas ngan 'gro 'gro ba ngan pa'i sgo thams cad gcad pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i sgo glegs 'byed par byed cing
translated: Since they themselves engage in the superior practice of the path of the ten virtues, they are without harm. Since they also cause others to engage in those very virtues, they close the door to the lower realms and open the door to the happy realms.

original: / sems can rnams lha dang mi'i 'gro ba dag la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sems can rnams lha dang mi'i 'gro ba dag la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And since they cause sentient beings to be born in the realms of gods and humans, they are the door openers to the happy realms.

original: des ni snying rje chen po'i bshad pa ngan 'gro las yongs su bskyab pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni snying rje chen po'i bshad pa ngan 'gro las yongs su bskyab pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: This explains the second generation of the mind of enlightenment, which is called “the generation of the mind of enlightenment that protects from the lower realms.”

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid lam log par zhugs pas gzhan dag yang dag pa'i lam la dgod pa ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid lam log par zhugs pas gzhan dag yang dag pa'i lam la dgod pa ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not possible for someone who has entered a wrong path to establish others in the correct path.

original: kye ma bdag kyang dge ba bcu po 'di dag la lhag par spyod cing gzhan dag kyang de dag nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: kye ma bdag kyang dge ba bcu po 'di dag la lhag par spyod cing gzhan dag kyang de dag nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o /
translated: I too should practice these ten virtues and should also establish others in them.

original: ji ltar srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is one not harmed by the afflictions that are based on cyclic existence?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir ; / stong nyid lta ba goms byas pas //🔽nyon mongs 'jug pa bcom phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ; / stong nyid lta ba goms byas pas // nyon mongs 'jug pa bcom phyir ro //
translated: By cultivating the view of emptiness,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the entry of the afflictions is destroyed.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po dang / zhig ba  dag la dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po dang / zhig ba  dag la dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that are causes and conditions, things that are different, and things that are destroyed are not observed.

original: gang la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Where would desire, hatred, and ignorance arise?

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mthu bcom pa'i srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mthu bcom pa'i srid pa la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus, the power of the afflictions is destroyed, and one is not harmed by the afflictions that are based on cyclic existence.

original: 'on 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams phal cher 'gro ba thams cad rnam par rgyu ba dang / de dag tu skyes pa yang snang na /
analyzed: 'on 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams phal cher 'gro ba thams cad rnam par rgyu ba dang / de dag tu skyes pa yang snang na /
translated: But it is seen that bodhisattvas generally move around in all the worlds and are born there.

original: ji ltar de'i cha @46b dang mthun pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i cha @46b dang mthun pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if bodhisattvas are reborn in the six destinies, how can they be harmed by the sufferings that correspond to those destinies?

original: de'i phyir / mkhas pa bsod nams byas pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mkhas pa bsod nams byas pa yis //
translated: The wise, through their merit,

original: 'gro drug skyed tshal dus ston ltar //🔽mthong ba srid pa'i btson ra yis //🔽skrag par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'gro drug skyed tshal dus ston ltar // mthong ba srid pa'i btson ra yis // skrag par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
translated: see the six destinies as a garden party.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They are not afraid of the prison of existence.🔽The wise, through their merit, see the six destinies as a garden party.

original: mkhas pa gzhan gyi don du smon lam btab pa bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yang dag par bsags pa dag gis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'i 'gro ba drug po dag me tog ku mu ta'i dus ston lta bur mthong ba na 'chi 'pho ba dang /
analyzed: mkhas pa gzhan gyi don du smon lam btab pa bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yang dag par bsags pa dag gis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'i 'gro ba drug po dag me tog ku mu ta'i dus ston lta bur mthong ba na 'chi 'pho ba dang /
translated: The wise, through their prayers of aspiration for the welfare of others, have accumulated an immeasurable collection of merit. When they see the six destinies of hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, gods, demigods, and humans, they are like people at a garden party.

original: yongs su tshol pa dang / nga rgyal dang / sdug bsngal dang / gcig la gcig za ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gnod pa'i tshe yang srid pa'i btson ra'i gnas kyi yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yongs su tshol pa dang / nga rgyal dang / sdug bsngal dang / gcig la gcig za ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis gnod pa'i tshe yang srid pa'i btson ra'i gnas kyi yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: They are harmed by the suffering of searching for food and clothing, the suffering of pride, the suffering of hunger and thirst, and so on, but they do not become disenchanted with the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'o na gal te de dag de ltar srid pa dag dang / de dag la brten pa'i skyon dag gis mi gos na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de dag de ltar srid pa dag dang / de dag la brten pa'i skyon dag gis mi gos na /
translated: If they are not defiled by cyclic existence and its faults in that way,

original: ji srid pa na gnas shing ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid pa na gnas shing ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro zhe na /
translated: for how long do they remain and why do they not attain nirvana?🔽Therefore, it says:

original: de'i phyir / skyon mthong phyir ni srid par min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / skyon mthong phyir ni srid par min //
translated: Not for the sake of existence, but for the sake of seeing faults.

original: brtse phyir mya ngan 'das mi gnas //
analyzed: brtse phyir mya ngan 'das mi gnas //
translated: Not for the sake of nirvana, but for the sake of compassion.

original: gzhan don bsgrub phyir brtul zhugs can //
analyzed: gzhan don bsgrub phyir brtul zhugs can //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the aims of others,

original: srid pa na yang gnas par byed //
analyzed: srid pa na yang gnas par byed //
translated: the one with diligence remains in existence.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: skyon dang nyes dmigs mang po mthong ba'i phyir srid par gnas 'cha' bar mi byed la /
analyzed: skyon dang nyes dmigs mang po mthong ba'i phyir srid par gnas 'cha' bar mi byed la /
translated: They do not remain in cyclic existence because they see its many faults and disadvantages.

original: sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang 'gro bar mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang 'gro bar mi byed de /
translated: Because they strive to protect the entire realm of sentient beings, they do not even go to the realm of nirvana.

original: gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir brtul zhugs blangs pa dag ni snying rje'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems kyis padma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi dri ma dag gis mi gos par srid pa na yang gnas par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir brtul zhugs blangs pa dag ni snying rje'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems kyis padma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi dri ma dag gis mi gos par srid pa na yang gnas par byed de /
translated: Those who have taken vows in order to accomplish the welfare of others, with a mind controlled by compassion, remain in cyclic existence like a lotus, unstained by the mud of the world.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang la 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma lus mngon mdzad pa //
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma lus mngon mdzad pa //
translated: The nature of all beings is fully manifest in you,

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid zhar la brnyes pa nyid lags shing //🔽gzhan don lhur mdzad khyod kyi yon tan dag la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid zhar la brnyes pa nyid lags shing // gzhan don lhur mdzad khyod kyi yon tan dag la ni //
translated: and you have attained the state of a tathagata.🔽How could anyone praise you, who are intent on the welfare of others,

original: bstod ra mkhan zhig bstod pas ji tsam bstod par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstod ra mkhan zhig bstod pas ji tsam bstod par 'gyur // zhes bya ba 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: and praise your qualities?

original: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: In samsara and in nirvana,

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi dmigs pa'i //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi dmigs pa'i //
translated: neither both nor neither is observed.

original: mkhas pa gar yang mi gnas shing //
analyzed: mkhas pa gar yang mi gnas shing //
translated: The wise do not abide anywhere.

original: srid pa @47a * //
analyzed: srid pa @47a * //
translated: Existence🔽

original: na yang gnas par byed //
analyzed: na yang gnas par byed //
translated: Even in cyclic existence, they abide.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa gnyis dang gnyis ma yin par mi dmigs pa'i mkhas pa dag ni gar yang mi gnas shing /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa gnyis dang gnyis ma yin par mi dmigs pa'i mkhas pa dag ni gar yang mi gnas shing /
translated: Because cyclic existence and nirvana are the same in nature, the wise do not observe either cyclic existence or liberation as either two or not two. They do not abide anywhere,

original: srid pa gsum na yang gnas par snang ste ;
analyzed: srid pa gsum na yang gnas par snang ste ;
translated: but they appear to abide in the three realms of cyclic existence.

original: des ni slob dpon gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni slob dpon gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This shows the nonabiding nirvana of bodhisattvas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la yongs su 'dris par shes pas dbang bsgyur ba khams gsum dang lhan cig gnas pa dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs🔽pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la yongs su 'dris par shes pas dbang bsgyur ba khams gsum dang lhan cig gnas pa dang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs🔽pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because bodhisattvas have thorough knowledge of all phenomena and have mastered them, it is not possible or reasonable for them to abide in the three realms and fall into nirvana.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhar la 'ongs pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhar la 'ongs pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: I will now discuss the attainment of nirvana, which is the perfect and complete fulfillment of one's own and others' goals.

original: byang lag rin chen bdun phyug cing //
analyzed: byang lag rin chen bdun phyug cing //
translated: The bodhisattvas, who are wealthy with the seven riches,

original: yon tan dpag med 'byung ba'i gnas //
analyzed: yon tan dpag med 'byung ba'i gnas //
translated: who are the source of immeasurable good qualities,

original: lha dang lha min phyag byas pa //
analyzed: lha dang lha min phyag byas pa //
translated: who are venerated by gods and demigods,

original: dam chos 'khor lo bskor brnyes shing //🔽mu tig 'phro 'dra'i grags pa dang // ston zla nya ba'i dri med pa'i //
analyzed: dam chos 'khor lo bskor brnyes shing // mu tig 'phro 'dra'i grags pa dang // ston zla nya ba'i dri med pa'i //
translated: attain the turning of the wheel of the sublime Dharma.🔽With speech that is like the light🔽of the spotless autumn moon

original: 'od zer lta bu'i gsung dag gis //
analyzed: 'od zer lta bu'i gsung dag gis //
translated: and is like a garland of pearls,

original: phyogs bcu dag ni rgyas mdzad la ;
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag ni rgyas mdzad la ;
translated: they spread it in the ten directions.

original: / dkon mchog gsum gdung gnas bya'i phyir //
analyzed: / dkon mchog gsum gdung gnas bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to perpetuate the lineage of the Three Jewels,

original: yon tan 'byung gnas dam pa'i sras //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas dam pa'i sras //
translated: the sons of the sublime source of good qualities

original: lha klu la sogs spyi gtsug gis //
analyzed: lha klu la sogs spyi gtsug gis //
translated: are placed on the crowns of the heads of gods, nagas, and so forth.

original: bstan pa mchod pa bzhag mdzad de //
analyzed: bstan pa mchod pa bzhag mdzad de //
translated: They are placed as the objects of worship of the teachings.

original: rang dang gzhan don mdzad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan don mdzad pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to benefit themselves and others,

original: de dag mya ngan 'das legs 'das //
analyzed: de dag mya ngan 'das legs 'das //
translated: they pass into excellent nirvana.

original: de las gzhan gang lus bcad chad //
analyzed: de las gzhan gang lus bcad chad //
translated: Those who remain after that are cut off.

original: de yang mya ngan 'das pa yin //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan 'das pa yin //
translated: They too enter nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba bdag ni dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che sna bdun gyis phyug cing ldan pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag ni dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms zhes bya ba byang chub kyi yan lag rin po che sna bdun gyis phyug cing ldan pa dang /
translated: The seven precious factors of awakening are mindfulness, the analysis of phenomena, diligence, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimity.

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'byung gnas dang / lha sum cu pa dang / lha min sbyin byed ma'i bus phyag byas shing mchod pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su @47b bskor ba nyid brnyes shing /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'byung gnas dang / lha sum cu pa dang / lha min sbyin byed ma'i bus phyag byas shing mchod pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su @47b bskor ba nyid brnyes shing /
translated: The Buddha is the source of immeasurable qualities and is the gateway to their arising. He is the one who was worshipped and venerated by the thirty gods and the demigod son of Dhatri, and who turned the wheel of the sacred Dharma, the four truths, three times and in twelve ways.

translated: displaying great miracles, giving predictions to bodhisattvas and establishing their parents in the result.

translated: They have attained nirvana in the best way because they have performed all their activities and have no other activities to perform and because they have completely uprooted all the defilement related and cognitive obscurations together with their habitual tendencies.

original: de dag las gzhan pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang dag phung po'i lus rgyun bcad pa tsam gyis yang 'byung ba'i srid pa zad cing chad pa de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang dag phung po'i lus rgyun bcad pa tsam gyis yang 'byung ba'i srid pa zad cing chad pa de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Other than those, the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who merely cut the continuum of the body of aggregates, exhaust the existence of rebirth and are terminated. They also are nirvāṇa.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spangs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam spangs pa'i phyir ro /

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chus rked gdung bzhin bskor ba'i mthas klas pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor 'di bskyang zhing bsrung bar 'dod pa'i sems kyang mi skye ba de bzhin du /

original: zil gyis mi non pa nyid dang / tshig btsun pa nyid dang / skye bo mang pos blta bar 'os pa nyid do //🔽dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar pa las /🔽byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: zil gyis mi non pa nyid dang / tshig btsun pa nyid dang / skye bo mang pos blta bar 'os pa nyid do // dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar pa las / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: 1. He is not overwhelmed by others. 2. He is respected by many people. 3. He is worthy of being looked at by many people.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /🔽bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, concerning the bodhisattva’s generation of the intention to become a buddha, from this Ornament of the Middle Way, a treatise that elucidates the presentation of the stages of the path to enlightenment.

original: da ni byang chub kyi sems shin tu yongs su ma btang ba'i thub pa'i brtul zhugs bla na med pa la yang dag par brten pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir le'u gnyis pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi sems shin tu yongs su ma btang ba'i thub pa'i brtul zhugs bla na med pa la yang dag par brten pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir le'u gnyis pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second chapter of this treatise, the Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way, is now begun in order to teach the unsurpassable bodhisattva conduct that is based on the bodhisattva’s intention that is not relinquished in any way.

original: de ltar 'gro la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro la phan pa'i phyir //
translated: In this way, for the sake of benefiting migrators,

original: byang chub chen por brtan blangs pa ;🔽tshul dang mthun pa'i lam nyid du //
analyzed: byang chub chen por brtan blangs pa ; tshul dang mthun pa'i lam nyid du //
translated: the bodhisattva takes up the firm intention to attain great enlightenment.🔽He is beautiful as he proceeds

original: rab tu zhugs pa rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: rab tu zhugs pa rnam par mdzes //
translated: along the path that is in accord with that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis srid pa gsum gyi 'gro ba nyid la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis srid pa gsum gyi 'gro ba nyid la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in the manner taught, for the sake of benefiting the very beings of the three worlds,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen por brtul zhugs mi phyed pa brtan pa yang dag par blangs pa /🔽rigs pa'i tshul dang mthun pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen por brtul zhugs mi phyed pa brtan pa yang dag par blangs pa / rigs pa'i tshul dang mthun pa /
translated: the firm, unbreakable vow of great, unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is taken up.🔽It is in accord with the principle of reasoning.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i lam nyid kyi rjes su rab tu zhugs pa ni rnam par mdzes so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i lam nyid kyi rjes su rab tu zhugs pa ni rnam par mdzes so //
translated: It is the path of the Sugatas.

original: lam de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that path?

original: de'i phyir / de ni byams pa gnod med dang // snying rje phan pa sgrub pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni byams pa gnod med dang // snying rje phan pa sgrub pa yis //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽That is the realization of the holy Dharma,

original: @50a * // dam chos rtogs pas ngoms med dang // chos sbyin pa la ser sna med //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: @50a * // dam chos rtogs pas ngoms med dang // chos sbyin pa la ser sna med //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
translated: and the absence of stinginess in giving the Dharma.

original: byang chub kyi sems ma btang ba de ni byams pa chen po'i sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gnod sems med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snying rje chen po gzhan sdug bsngal bas bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba'i ngo bo nyid la phan pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas theg pa chen po'i tshul mnyan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ma btang ba de ni byams pa chen po'i sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gnod sems med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snying rje chen po gzhan sdug bsngal bas bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba'i ngo bo nyid la phan pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas theg pa chen po'i tshul mnyan pa dang /
translated: Not giving up the mind of enlightenment is the nature of the great love that wishes to protect the entire realm of sentient beings, and it is the nature of the great compassion that is pained by the suffering of others.🔽Thus, one is never satisfied with realizing the sublime Dharma by listening to the way of the Great Vehicle,🔽by holding it,

original: gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / don kun chub par bya ba dang / bstan pa dag la brtson pa mi 'dor bas dam pa'i chos rtogs par bya bas ngoms pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / don kun chub par bya ba dang / bstan pa dag la brtson pa mi 'dor bas dam pa'i chos rtogs par bya bas ngoms pa med pa yin te /
translated: by understanding its meaning, and by striving in teaching it.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As said:

original: de nyid nyin par dang / mtshan mo chos 'dod pa dang / chos la dga' ba dang / chos la gzhol ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod de /
analyzed: de nyid nyin par dang / mtshan mo chos 'dod pa dang / chos la dga' ba dang / chos la gzhol ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod de /
translated: He is one who desires the Dharma, delights in the Dharma, is devoted to the Dharma, and practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po yang yongs su mi gtong ba de cung zad kyang med cing bla ma la bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba gang nye bar mi len pa de yang cung zad kyang med la nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal spangs shing nga rgyal med pa'i nye bar spyod pa nyid nye bar mi len pa de yang cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po yang yongs su mi gtong ba de cung zad kyang med cing bla ma la bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba gang nye bar mi len pa de yang cung zad kyang med la nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal spangs shing nga rgyal med pa'i nye bar spyod pa nyid nye bar mi len pa de yang cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They do not transgress the rules of training, nor do they transgress the rules of the world.

original: skye ba dang / na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus la 'da' ba med cing /
analyzed: skye ba dang / na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus la 'da' ba med cing /
translated: They do not transgress birth, age, caste, country, or time.

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms par chos rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms par chos rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: They are impartial toward all sentient beings and analyze the Dharma.

original: chos sbyin pa la ser sna med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa la ser sna med pa yang yin no //
translated: They are not stingy with the gift of the Dharma.🔽They are straightforward, have destroyed pride,🔽are mentally focused on reality,🔽are blind to the faults of others,

original: drang dang nga rgyal bcom pa dang // yid kyis de nyid blta ba dang // gzhan skyon rtog la long ba dang // rang skyon 'byung bas 'jigs pa yin //
analyzed: drang dang nga rgyal bcom pa dang // yid kyis de nyid blta ba dang // gzhan skyon rtog la long ba dang // rang skyon 'byung bas 'jigs pa yin //
translated: and are afraid of the arising of their own faults.

original: g-yo sgyu bral bas drang ba dang / khengs pa dang rang red dang bral bas nga rgyal bcom pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas yid kyis de nyid blta ba dang / gzhan gyi skyon chen po dag la yang blun zhing long ba ltar byed pas gzhan gyi skyon la rtog pa la long ba dang /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu bral bas drang ba dang / khengs pa dang rang red dang bral bas nga rgyal bcom pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas yid kyis de nyid blta ba dang / gzhan gyi skyon chen po dag la yang blun zhing long ba ltar byed pas gzhan gyi skyon la rtog pa la long ba dang /
translated: They are upright, free of deceit and hypocrisy. They have conquered pride, free of arrogance and self-satisfaction. They are blind to the faults of others, regarding the great faults of others as if they were blind and deaf.

original: bdag nyid kha na ma tho brtul tsam gyis kyang 'jigs par lta bas rang gi skyon 'byung bas 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kha na ma tho brtul tsam gyis kyang 'jigs par lta bas rang gi skyon 'byung bas 'jigs pa ste /
translated: They are afraid of their own faults, regarding even a minor fault as dangerous.

original: de lta bu de dag yid dang ldan pas rnam par mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag yid dang ldan pas rnam par mdzes pa yin no //
translated: These are the ways in which the wise are beautiful in their minds.

original: @50b rtsod dang 'jig rten 'du 'dzi dang // 'jig rten rgyang pa na rgyab kyis phyogs //🔽yon tan med la'ang yon tan gyi //
analyzed: @50b rtsod dang 'jig rten 'du 'dzi dang // 'jig rten rgyang pa na rgyab kyis phyogs // yon tan med la'ang yon tan gyi //
translated: They turn their backs on disputes, worldly distractions, and the philosophies of the non-Buddhists.

original: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus //
analyzed: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus //
translated: They are always respectful toward those who are not learned,🔽and they are always eager to learn from them.

original: rtsod pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung ba dang / rang gi phyogs bzhag pa'i sgo nas phyogs gnyis la brten pa'i tshig ngan par smra ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyod pa'i phyir rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung ba dang / rang gi phyogs bzhag pa'i sgo nas phyogs gnyis la brten pa'i tshig ngan par smra ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyod pa'i phyir rtsod pa'o //
translated: Quarrel is the use of harsh words based on the two sides, in order to refute the other side and to establish one's own side, as well as worldly fighting, exposing the faults of others, and regret.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'du 'dzi ni chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'khor ba 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang lhan cig 'grogs shing kun tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'du 'dzi ni chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'khor ba 'dod pa'i 'jig rten dang lhan cig 'grogs shing kun tu smra ba'o //
translated: Worldly chatter is the association with and conversation of worldly people who desire the non-Dharma, the non-purpose, the non-action, and samsara.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan ni yang dag pa nyid kyi lung dang bral ba'i gsang tshig sna tshogs la spobs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan ni yang dag pa nyid kyi lung dang bral ba'i gsang tshig sna tshogs la spobs pa'o //
translated: The Lokayata is the self-confidence in various secret doctrines devoid of the true scriptures.

original: de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni mi phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni mi phyogs pa'o //
translated: To turn one's back on those is to not face them.

original: yon tan med la'ang yon tan gyi //
analyzed: yon tan med la'ang yon tan gyi //
translated: Even in the absence of virtue,

original: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus pa ni skye bo yon tan ma lus pa med pa la yang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang ldan par mos shing 'di yang dus gzhan na yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes yon tan gyi
