analyzed: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus pa ni skye bo yon tan ma lus pa med pa la yang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang ldan par mos shing 'di yang dus gzhan na yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes yon tan gyi
translated: Always being respectful toward the arising of the stream of virtues is the attitude that all sentient beings possess the essence of the Tathagata, even though they are devoid of all virtues, and the thought that they will come to possess virtues at another time.

original: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus pa mi lhod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun rnams skye bar rtag tu gus pa mi lhod pa ste /
translated: Always being respectful toward the arising of the stream of virtues is not being lax.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag la chos ma 'dzin cig gang zag la tshod kyang ma 'dzin cig / dge slong dag nga'am 'dra bas gang zag la tshad gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gang zag gis gang zag la chos ma 'dzin cig gang zag la tshod kyang ma 'dzin cig / dge slong dag nga'am 'dra bas gang zag la tshad gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “Monks, do not judge a person by the person. Monks, I or someone like me should judge a person.”🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / snying rjes bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dag / skye bo'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / snying rjes bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dag / skye bo'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: The generosity produced by compassion

original: sdug bsngal chu bo kun zhi'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chu bo kun zhi'i phyir //
translated: is for the sake of drying up the river of suffering🔽of all the multitude of beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid 'dod pa bskyed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid 'dod pa bskyed //🔽ces bya ba la /
translated: It produces the desire for omniscience.

original: snying rjes bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dag ces bya ba ni lan dang 'bras bu la re ba med par snying rje nyid 'ba' zhig gis yang dag par bskyed pas gtong ba'i sems pa des chos dang / zang zing dang / dbang dang / don dang /
analyzed: snying rjes bskyed pa'i sbyin pa dag ces bya ba ni lan dang 'bras bu la re ba med par snying rje nyid 'ba' zhig gis yang dag par bskyed pas gtong ba'i sems pa des chos dang / zang zing dang / dbang dang / don dang /
translated: The generosity that is generated by compassion is the intention to give that is generated solely by compassion, without hope for return or result.🔽That intention to give causes one to give the seven types of things: Dharma, material things, power, meaning,

original: rigs pa dang / gnas dang / mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa bdun sbyin par byed pa'o //🔽skye bo'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rigs pa dang / gnas dang / mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa bdun sbyin par byed pa'o // skye bo'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: reason, place, and fearlessness.🔽In order to completely pacify

original: sdug bsngal chu bo kun zhi'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chu bo kun zhi'i phyir //
translated: the river of suffering of all beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du yongs su sngo bar byed ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du yongs su sngo bar byed ce na /
translated: For whose benefit does one dedicate?

original: 'jig rten sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod @51a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod @51a * //
translated: The world is born from eggs, born from wombs, born from heat and moisture,🔽and miraculously born.

original: gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa ma lus pa dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chu rgyun thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa ma lus pa dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi chu rgyun thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the streams of suffering of all sentient beings, without exception, are completely pacified, whether they are born from eggs, born from wombs, born from moisture, born spontaneously, have form, or are formless.

original: de'i phyir gang du yongs su sngo bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du yongs su sngo bar byed ce na /
translated: In what does one dedicate?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa bskyed ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa bskyed ces bya ba ste /
translated: In the generation of the desire for omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la 'dod pa yang dag par bskyed pas de nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la 'dod pa yang dag par bskyed pas de nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: One dedicates to that very omniscience by generating the desire for buddhahood.

original: 'dir 'di skad ces rgol te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad ces rgol te /
translated: Here, someone objects:

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed na ji ltar des 'bras bu la re ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed na ji ltar des 'bras bu la re ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: If one gives a gift with the desire for omniscience, how can one be without hope for a result?

original: zang zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa dag gi 'bras bu gzugs dang chos kyi sku dag kyang snang ngo //
analyzed: zang zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa dag gi 'bras bu gzugs dang chos kyi sku dag kyang snang ngo //
translated: The results of the giving of material things and of the Dharma appear as the form body and the Dharma body.

original: rang gi rgyud kho na la 'bras bu snang bas ji ltar skye bo mtha' dag gi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kho na la 'bras bu snang bas ji ltar skye bo mtha' dag gi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba yin te /
translated: Since the result appears only in one’s own continuum, how can the suffering of all beings be pacified?

original: snying rjes sdug bsngal ba rnams la gtong bar byed pa /
analyzed: snying rjes sdug bsngal ba rnams la gtong bar byed pa /
translated: One might say, “Compassion causes suffering for those who give to the suffering.”

original: zhing 'dam par mi byed pa la de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhing 'dam par mi byed pa la de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One might say, “If one does not select the field, how can the perfections be completed?”

original: bshad pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa'i thabs kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid spong bar byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa'i thabs kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid spong bar byed do //
translated: All of that is a method for attaining omniscience, but it rejects the states of śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: zang zing dang chos kyi 'bras bu gzugs dang chos kyi sku dag kyang gzhan don kho na yin te ;
analyzed: zang zing dang chos kyi 'bras bu gzugs dang chos kyi sku dag kyang gzhan don kho na yin te ;
translated: The results of material things and the Dharma, the form body and the truth body, are also only for the benefit of others.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu ma bskor bar sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das ba rnam pa gsum la dgod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu ma bskor bar sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das ba rnam pa gsum la dgod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without fully awakening to the thatness of phenomena and without turning the wheel of the Dharma, it is impossible to establish all sentient beings in the three types of nirvana.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa yin la ;
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa yin la ;
translated: The dharmakāya is the agent that fully, perfectly awakens,

original: gzugs kyi sku ni ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: and the rūpakāya is the agent that teaches.

original: yi ge dang tshig dang rtsa ba'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang / rtsol bdag las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / de'i dus na long ba dang / 'on pa dang / smyon pa la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa 'thob la /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig dang rtsa ba'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang / rtsol bdag las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / de'i dus na long ba dang / 'on pa dang / smyon pa la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa 'thob la /
translated: The sound of words, syllables, and the order of the root letters arises from place, action, and effort, and at that time, the blind, the deaf, the insane, and so on obtain eyes and so forth.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag gi snod du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu de dag gzhan gyi rgyud la yang snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag gi snod du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu de dag gzhan gyi rgyud la yang snang ngo //
translated: Since those whose mindstreams are fully ripened become vessels of the results of stream entry and so on, in that way those results appear in the mindstreams of others.

original: 'bras bu la re ba'i zhags pas bcings pa'i blo gros can dag nyid tshol bar yang byed la /
analyzed: 'bras bu la re ba'i zhags pas bcings pa'i blo gros can dag nyid tshol bar yang byed la /
translated: The wise who are bound by the noose of hope for results also seek themselves.

original: gang gzhan dag gis bkres @51b pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba tsam kho na la dmigs nas snod la mi rtog par snyoms par sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa des chos nyid mnyam par yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gis bkres @51b pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba tsam kho na la dmigs nas snod la mi rtog par snyoms par sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa des chos nyid mnyam par yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Others give gifts without conceptualizing a recipient, focusing on merely alleviating the suffering of hunger and so on. They realize the sameness of dharmatā.🔽As it has been said:

original: ji skad du gzhon nu chos gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: ji skad du gzhon nu chos gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Young man, there is one dharma that quickly causes bodhisattvas to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽It is this: the sameness of mind toward all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi yon gnas yin gyi dud 'gro ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi yon gnas yin gyi dud 'gro ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: And likewise, if a bodhisattva thinks, “The Tathāgata is my object of worship, but animals are not,”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: that is not the Dharma of a bodhisattva.

original: de la phyi rol ba'i thub pa dag ni chu ngos kyi khrus dang / se ral phreng dang / ral pa dang / shing shun dang / pags pa dang / ril ba dang / rtsva stan la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba'i rtags 'chang zhing /
analyzed: de la phyi rol ba'i thub pa dag ni chu ngos kyi khrus dang / se ral phreng dang / ral pa dang / shing shun dang / pags pa dang / ril ba dang / rtsva stan la sogs pa rnal 'byor ba'i rtags 'chang zhing /
translated: The sages of non-Buddhists bathe in the water, wear garlands of reeds, have matted hair, wear bark, skin, and a water pot, and sit on grass seats and so on.

original: 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba za ba dang / rang gi lha nyid mgu par byed pa dang / me la nye bar bsten pa dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal na gnas par byed do /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba za ba dang / rang gi lha nyid mgu par byed pa dang / me la nye bar bsten pa dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal na gnas par byed do /
translated: They eat fruits and roots, please their deity, rely on fire, and live in forests of asceticism.

original: 'di'i thub pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'di'i thub pa dag ni /
translated: The sages of this [Buddhist] system🔽are based on such statements as:🔽They bathe with the water of stainless ethics,🔽wear the white garland of patience,

original: tshul khrims dri med chus khrus dang // bzod pa'i se ral phreng dkar dang// brtson 'grus ral pa'i khur bcings dang // bsam gtan shes pa lhur len te //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri med chus khrus dang // bzod pa'i se ral phreng dkar dang// brtson 'grus ral pa'i khur bcings dang // bsam gtan shes pa lhur len te //
translated: bind the burden of hair with effort,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag par brten to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag par brten to //
translated: and are intent on the wisdom of concentration.

original: tshul khrims dri med chus khrus zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug yang dag par sdom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba bcu lhag par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dri ma med pa'i tshul lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri med chus khrus zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug yang dag par sdom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dge ba bcu lhag par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims dri ma med pa'i tshul lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The 'pure water of morality' is the pure stream of body, speech and mind, which is characterized by the practice of the ten virtues, the essence of which is the perfect control of the six senses.

original: bzod pa'i se ral phreng dkar zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i bzod pa se ral phreng dkar po lta bu thogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i se ral phreng dkar zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i bzod pa se ral phreng dkar po lta bu thogs pa'o //
translated: The 'white garland of patience' is the garland of patience, which is like a white garland, consisting of the patience of accepting suffering, the patience of disregarding harm done to one and the patience of certainty with regard to the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus ral pa'i khur bcings zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brtson 'grus kyi ral pa'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ral pa'i khur bcings zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brtson 'grus kyi ral pa'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The 'garland of diligence' is the adornment with the mass of the garland of diligence, which is characterized by the enthusiasm for virtue.

original: bsam gtan shes pa lhur len ces bya ba ni lus dang sems 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang thabs kyis shes @52a * //🔽pas byang chub kyi lam shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes pa lhur len ces bya ba ni lus dang sems 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang thabs kyis shes @52a * // pas byang chub kyi lam shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of wisdom and skillful means.🔽The phrase whose eyes of intelligence are opened wide refers to the opening wide of the eyes of the two kinds of wisdom that have as their objects the conventional and the ultimate.

original: blo mig legs par bye ba dang // bstan bcos 'jig rten shes la mkhas //🔽ngo tsha khrel yod gos dang ni //
analyzed: blo mig legs par bye ba dang // bstan bcos 'jig rten shes la mkhas // ngo tsha khrel yod gos dang ni //
translated: The phrase who are skilled in the treatises and in worldly matters refers to the treatises that are the means for developing that wisdom.

original: des pa'i ska rags 'ching ba yin //
analyzed: des pa'i ska rags 'ching ba yin //
translated: The phrase who are clothed in a sense of shame and decency refers to the sense of shame and decency that is the cause for developing that wisdom.🔽The phrase who are girded with the belt of firm resolve refers to the firm resolve that is the cause for developing that wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba blo mig legs par bye ba zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab rnam pa gnyis kyi mig rnam par bye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba blo mig legs par bye ba zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab rnam pa gnyis kyi mig rnam par bye ba'o //
translated: The phrase whose eyes of intelligence are opened wide refers to the opening wide of the eyes of the two kinds of wisdom that have as their objects the conventional and the ultimate.

original: bstan bcos 'jig rten shes la mkhas //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'jig rten shes la mkhas //
translated: The phrase who are skilled in the treatises and in worldly matters refers to the treatises that are the means for developing that wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i 'jigs pa las skyob pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'dul nus pa'i bstan bcos shes pa la mkhas pa dang / bla ma dag la gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i 'jigs pa las skyob pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'dul nus pa'i bstan bcos shes pa la mkhas pa dang / bla ma dag la gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang /
translated: This verse shows skill in knowing the treatises that protect from the fear of the miserable realms and that can subdue the enemy of the afflictions, skill in knowing the world through being diligent in the activities of respect for the gurus, prostrating, rising up,

original: thal mo sbyar ba dang / gus pa'i las la brtson pa dang / grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / mgron dag la gcugs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten shes pa nyid la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba dang / gus pa'i las la brtson pa dang / grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / mgron dag la gcugs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten shes pa nyid la mkhas pa'o //
translated: joining the palms, and being devoted, and skill in being affectionate to friends, relatives, and guests.

original: ngo tsha khrel yod gos zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i gos shing shun ltar gyon pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha khrel yod gos zhes bya ba ni chos dang 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i gos shing shun ltar gyon pa'o //
translated: The verse “The clothing of shame and embarrassment” shows that one wears the clothing of shame and embarrassment that avoids wrongdoing from the perspective of Dharma and the world, like wearing bark garments.

original: des pa'i ska rags 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni 'grogs na bde ba nyid kyi ska rags dam po 'ching pa'o //
analyzed: des pa'i ska rags 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni 'grogs na bde ba nyid kyi ska rags dam po 'ching pa'o //
translated: The verse “The belt of gentleness” shows that one tightly fastens the belt of gentleness that is the ease of being together.

original: snying rje'i pags pa gnag 'chang zhing //
analyzed: snying rje'i pags pa gnag 'chang zhing //
translated: The verse “The black hide of compassion” shows that one wears the black hide of compassion.

original: dad pa dri med ril ba dang // dran pas dbang po'i sgo bsrungs shing //
analyzed: dad pa dri med ril ba dang // dran pas dbang po'i sgo bsrungs shing //
translated: and the water pot of stainless faith.

original: brtan pa'i spa stegs stan la 'dug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: brtan pa'i spa stegs stan la 'dug / ces bya ba la /
translated: He sits on the seat of firmness,

original: snying rje'i pags pa gnag 'chang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa'i snying rje de nyid g-yang gzhi nag po lta bu ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i pags pa gnag 'chang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa'i snying rje de nyid g-yang gzhi nag po lta bu ste /
translated: He wears the black antelope skin of compassion: that very compassion which is the desire to benefit all sentient beings is like the black antelope skin.

original: de 'chang ba'o /
analyzed: de 'chang ba'o /
translated: He wears that.

original: dad pa dri med ril ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa la mos pa dri ma med pa'i ril ba spyi blugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dri med ril ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa la mos pa dri ma med pa'i ril ba spyi blugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has the water pot of stainless faith: he has the water pot of stainless faith in the unsurpassed qualities of the Buddha.

original: dran pas dbang po'i sgo bsrungs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'i dran pas mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi sgo'i sgo glegs legs par bcad pa'o /
analyzed: dran pas dbang po'i sgo bsrungs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'i dran pas mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi sgo'i sgo glegs legs par bcad pa'o /
translated: He guards the doors of the senses with mindfulness: he closes the doors of the eyes and so on with mindfulness called non-forgetfulness of wholesome dharmas.

original: brtan pa'i sba stegs stan la 'dug ces bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa brtan pa'i sba stegs kyi stan la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa'i sba stegs stan la 'dug ces bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa brtan pa'i sba stegs kyi stan la 'dug pa'o //
translated: He sits on the seat of firmness: he sits on the seat of firmness which is not divided by Mara and so on.

original: theg pa chen po dga' chen gyi //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dga' chen gyi //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the great joy,

original: dka' thub nags tshul yang dag brten //
analyzed: dka' thub nags tshul yang dag brten //
translated: the right practice in the forest of asceticism.

original: bsam gtan dga' ba'i 'bras bu za //
analyzed: bsam gtan dga' ba'i 'bras bu za //
translated: The fruit of the joy of meditation

original: dun pa nyer gzhag spyod yul can //
analyzed: dun pa nyer gzhag spyod yul can //
translated: is the establishment of the object.

original: zhes @52b bya ba la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i theg pa dag ltos na go skabs yangs pa'i phyir dang / theg pa gcig pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes @52b bya ba la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i theg pa dag ltos na go skabs yangs pa'i phyir dang / theg pa gcig pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is so called because it is the path of the six perfections together with their results, in comparison with other vehicles, it is the most extensive, and because there is only one vehicle.

original: dga' chen zhes bya ba ni de nyid lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang ; bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba'i phyir dga' ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: dga' chen zhes bya ba ni de nyid lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang ; bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba'i phyir dga' ba chen po yin no //
translated: It is the great joy because it produces the excellence of gods and humans, and because it is the great joy of the play of meditation, liberation, meditative concentration, meditative attainments, and the superknowledges.

original: dka' thub nags tshal zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med par dka' thub spyad pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog rgyas pa dang / mnyam pa med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bus brgyan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gcan gzan dang /
analyzed: dka' thub nags tshal zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med par dka' thub spyad pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog rgyas pa dang / mnyam pa med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bus brgyan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gcan gzan dang /
translated: The phrase “forest of austerities” refers to the fact that the bodhisattva practiced austerities for countless eons, that the flowers of the branches of enlightenment bloomed, that he was adorned with the fruit of enlightenment that is unequaled, and that he tamed the beasts of afflictions and the beasts of views.

original: srin po'i tshogs dang bral ba dang / dge ba dpag tu med pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srin po'i tshogs dang bral ba dang / dge ba dpag tu med pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir te /
translated: The forest of austerities is so called because he practiced austerities for countless eons, because it is adorned with the flowers of the branches of enlightenment, because it is adorned with the fruit of enlightenment, which is unequaled, because it is free from the beasts of prey of the defilements and the hordes of rakshasas, and because it is beautiful with the roots of limitless virtue.

original: de na yang dag par brten to //
analyzed: de na yang dag par brten to //
translated: He dwells there.

original: bsam gtan dga' ba'i 'bras bu za zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam gtan bzhi po shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pas dga' ba bsgom pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dga' ba'i 'bras bu za zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam gtan bzhi po shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pas dga' ba bsgom pa'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: He eats the fruit of the joy of meditation means that he enjoys the fruit of the cultivation of joy through the generation of pliancy in the four meditations, which are free from desire, reflection, investigation, joy, pleasure, and pain.

original: dran pa nyer gzhag spyod yul can //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag spyod yul can //
translated: He has the domain of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos zhes bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yul gyi spyod yul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos zhes bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yul gyi spyod yul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the domain of the objects of the applications of mindfulness called body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: zab cing rgya che mdo sde'i mtha' //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che mdo sde'i mtha' //
translated: The conclusion of the profound and extensive sūtras,

original: 'dod cing sdig pa bcom pa dang // bden pa gnyis la brten pa yi //
analyzed: 'dod cing sdig pa bcom pa dang // bden pa gnyis la brten pa yi //
translated: the desire to conquer evil, and the reliance on the two truths,

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung nyi bshad zlos //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung nyi bshad zlos // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the explanation of dependent origination, and the recitation of the mantra.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde'i mtha' 'don ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde'i mtha' 'don ces bya ba ni /
translated: The conclusion of the profound and extensive sūtras is as follows.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i mdo sde'i mtha' des pa'i don ston pa dag kha ton du 'don pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i mdo sde'i mtha' des pa'i don ston pa dag kha ton du 'don pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the profound sūtras that are difficult to fathom, such as the Perfection of Wisdom, which teach the ultimate truth.

original: sdig pa bcom pa zhes bya ba ni des sdig pa ma lus par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa bcom pa zhes bya ba ni des sdig pa ma lus par spangs pa ste /
translated: The conquest of evil means the complete abandonment of evil.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig blangs te 'chang ngam klog gam tshul bzhin yid la byed na de'i tshes byas snga ma'i mi dge ba de dag tshe 'di nyid la yongs su zad
analyzed: gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig blangs te 'chang ngam klog gam tshul bzhin yid la byed na de'i tshes byas snga ma'i mi dge ba de dag tshe 'di nyid la yongs su zad
translated: Whoever takes up even a four-line verse from this perfection of wisdom, and bears it in mind, recites it, and properly attends to it, all their previous non-virtue will be exhausted in this very life.

original: par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽bden pa gnyis la brten pa yi//
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // bden pa gnyis la brten pa yi//
translated: The sūtra says this.🔽The dependent origination based on the two truths

original: @53a * // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @53a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first of these has two parts: the actual refutation and the refutation of the🔽claim that the refutation commits the fallacy of accident.🔽

original: kun rdzob la brten pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ci lta bu zhe na /🔽ma brtags na grags pa yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa brtags na med pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob la brten pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ci lta bu zhe na / ma brtags na grags pa yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa brtags na med pa /
translated: What is the dependent origination based on the conventional?

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is what exists when not analyzed, what is renowned, what exists and does not exist when analyzed, and what has the characteristic of arising from the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:🔽The Guide has taught that

original: gang du tshogs las snang 'gyur ba //🔽'dren pas rab tu bstan mdzad pa //🔽de ni blo can 'jig rten chos //
analyzed: gang du tshogs las snang 'gyur ba // 'dren pas rab tu bstan mdzad pa // de ni blo can 'jig rten chos //
translated: whatever appears from a collection🔽is a worldly phenomenon🔽that is imputed by the wise.

original: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is taught in the Levels of Engaging in Deeds.

original: don dam pa la brten pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa la brten pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Dependent origination based on the ultimate is non-arising.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever arises from conditions does not arise.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tha dad pa 'dus pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i dus na bar du mchod par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tha dad pa 'dus pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i dus na bar du mchod par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Dependent origination is the arising of an effect from the assembly of different causes and conditions, and the arising of an effect in the interval before its destruction.

original: de nyid nyi bshad yin te /
analyzed: de nyid nyi bshad yin te /
translated: That itself is the explanation,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi mas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi mas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained by the sun of perfect buddhahood.

original: de zlos zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas brjod du zlos pa'o //
analyzed: de zlos zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas brjod du zlos pa'o //
translated: It is repeated means it is repeated as uninterrupted recitation.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sa bcu pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Sutra of the Ten Stages, it is said:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su mi 'byung ba la 'di ltar rnam par blta ste ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su mi 'byung ba la 'di ltar rnam par blta ste ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of ignorance is the non-understanding of the ultimate.

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of ignorance is confusion about the formative forces.

original: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas te /
translated: Ignorance functions in two ways:🔽it causes sentient beings to be confused about their objects, and it produces the cause for the actualization of the formative forces.

original: sems can rnams dmigs pa la kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dag las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams dmigs pa la kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dag las rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the scriptures, such as the following passage from the Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra:

original: bsgrub pa'i me tog sngags ldan pa //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i me tog sngags ldan pa //
translated: “The flower of accomplishment, endowed with mantra,

original: phyogs rnams kun tu dris khyab pas //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun tu dris khyab pas //
translated: pervades all directions.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma la //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma la //
translated: The sun of perfect buddhahood

original: nyin gcig bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed //
translated: is served day after day.

original: ces bya ba la ni bsgrub pa'i me tog yon tan mtha' yas pa'i bsngags pa dang ldan pa phyogs bcu thams cad du grags pa'i dri 'byung ba dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma la nyin gcig mi 'chad par bsnyen bkur byed pa yin🔽no // so sor rtog pa'i mi thab tu //
analyzed: ces bya ba la ni bsgrub pa'i me tog yon tan mtha' yas pa'i bsngags pa dang ldan pa phyogs bcu thams cad du grags pa'i dri 'byung ba dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma la nyin gcig mi 'chad par bsnyen bkur byed pa yin no // so sor rtog pa'i mi thab tu //
translated: In this verse, the sun of the perfect and complete Buddha is served without interruption for a day with the flowers of practice, which have the praise of infinite qualities and the fragrance that spreads in all ten directions.🔽The fire of discernment burns

original: mi dge'i kun tu rtog pa sreg / bla med go 'phang thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: mi dge'i kun tu rtog pa sreg / bla med go 'phang thob bya'i phyir //
translated: the conceptions of nonvirtue.🔽In this way, one practices the discipline of the Sage🔽in order to attain the unsurpassed state.

original: de ltar thub pa'i brtul zhugs spyod @53b ces bya ba ni yul sna tshogs 'dod pa phyir zlog pa'i so sor rtog pa'i zhugs thab tu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i bud shing gi du ma grugs ma lus pa sreg pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar thub pa'i brtul zhugs spyod @53b ces bya ba ni yul sna tshogs 'dod pa phyir zlog pa'i so sor rtog pa'i zhugs thab tu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i bud shing gi du ma grugs ma lus pa sreg pa ste /
translated: The fire of discernment that turns back the desire for various objects burns the entire heap of the fuel of improper mental activity.

original: chos 'di'i thub pa dag ni skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa dag ltar thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par rten par byed do //
analyzed: chos 'di'i thub pa dag ni skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa dag ltar thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par rten par byed do //
translated: The sages of this teaching, in order to attain the gnosis that directly realizes all phenomena in a single moment, rely on the discipline of sages just as it has been taught.

original: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par brten pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las thub pa'i brtul zhugs la yang dag par brten pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter, on the discipline of sages, from the Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way.

original: // / da ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i skabs su bab pas de bstan pa'i phyir le'u gsum pa brtsam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: // / da ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i skabs su bab pas de bstan pa'i phyir le'u gsum pa brtsam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, since the section on the search for reality is relevant, in order to present that, beginning with the third chapter,🔽it is said:

original: gang la shes pa'i mig yod pa //
analyzed: gang la shes pa'i mig yod pa //
translated: For those who have the eye of knowledge,

original: de la mig yod gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de la mig yod gzhan ma yin //
translated: they have the eye, not others.🔽Therefore, the wise strive

original: des na gang phyir blo ldan dag / de nyid shes pa tshol la brtson //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: des na gang phyir blo ldan dag / de nyid shes pa tshol la brtson // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: to search for reality.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mig yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mig yin te /
translated: The nature of knowledge is the eye.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / thag ring ba dang / nye ba dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba'i dngos po dag la thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / thag ring ba dang / nye ba dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba'i dngos po dag la thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it penetrates without obstruction the things of the past, future, and present, the distant and the near, the gross and the subtle.

original: gang la shes pa'i mig de yod pa de la ni mig yod pa yin no //🔽gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni sha'i mig ni ha cang nye ba dang ring ba dang dbang po las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la long ba 'dra bas de yod du zin kyang ci la yang mi phan pas de yod kyang mig dang ldan
analyzed: gang la shes pa'i mig de yod pa de la ni mig yod pa yin no // gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni sha'i mig ni ha cang nye ba dang ring ba dang dbang po las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la long ba 'dra bas de yod du zin kyang ci la yang mi phan pas de yod kyang mig dang ldan
translated: One who has that eye of knowledge has the eye.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “not otherwise” means that even if one has the fleshly eye, it is as if one were blind to things that are too distant, too near, beyond the range of the senses, etc. Thus, even if one has the fleshly eye, one does not have the eye.

original: des na gang gi phyir blo dang ldan pa dag ni sha'i mig ngan pa de tshol ba spangs te /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir blo dang ldan pa dag ni sha'i mig ngan pa de tshol ba spangs te /
translated: Therefore, the wise abandon the search for the inferior fleshly eye

original: de nyid shes pa tshol ba la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa tshol ba la brtson par byed do //
translated: and strive to seek the eye of reality.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir blo ldan 'jig rten gsum po dag / thogs med mthong ba long bas kyang //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir blo ldan 'jig rten gsum po dag / thogs med mthong ba long bas kyang //
translated: In order to demonstrate that meaning, the root text says, “The wise, even though blind with the fleshly eye, see the three worlds without obstruction.”

original: blta 'dod thag ring cha phra dang // bsgribs pa'i don yang mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: blta 'dod thag ring cha phra dang // bsgribs pa'i don yang mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: One can see what is far away, subtle, and obscured.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he said.

original: shes pa'i mig gi blo dang ldan pa 'jig rten gsum po dag thogs pa med par mthong ba ni sha'i mig nyams shing long bas kyang blta bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: shes pa'i mig gi blo dang ldan pa 'jig rten gsum po dag thogs pa med par mthong ba ni sha'i mig nyams shing long bas kyang blta bar 'dod pa /
translated: The one who has the eye of knowledge, the mind, sees the three worlds without obstruction. Even one whose fleshly eye is impaired and blind, if he wishes to see,

original: thag ring ba dpag tshad stong dag dang / cha phra ba rdul phran lta bu dang / bsgribs pa'i don gyi dngos po yang mig dang ldan pa bzhin du yang dag par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag ring ba dpag tshad stong dag dang / cha phra ba rdul phran lta bu dang / bsgribs pa'i don gyi dngos po yang mig dang ldan pa bzhin du yang dag par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: can see what is far away, a thousand leagues, what is subtle, like an atom, and what is obscured, just as if he had eyes.

original: gzhan yang / mig @54a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mig @54a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: stong pa yang blo med na //
analyzed: stong pa yang blo med na //
translated: If the thousand eyes are without mind,

original: mig dang ldan pa ma yin te //🔽mtho ris dang ni byang grol gyi //
analyzed: mig dang ldan pa ma yin te // mtho ris dang ni byang grol gyi //
translated: then one does not have eyes.🔽Because one does not see the path

original: lam dang lam min mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: lam dang lam min mi mthong phyir //
translated: to the higher realms and liberation.

original: mig stong pa ni lha'i dbang po yin zhes grags te /
analyzed: mig stong pa ni lha'i dbang po yin zhes grags te /
translated: It is well known that the thousand eyes are the lord of the gods.

original: de ni yul la re ba'i zhags pas blo gros yongs su dkris pas gal te shes pa'i mig gi blo med na mig dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yul la re ba'i zhags pas blo gros yongs su dkris pas gal te shes pa'i mig gi blo med na mig dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind is completely bound by the noose of hope for objects. If there is no eye of knowledge, one is not endowed with eyes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not see the path to heaven and liberation, and the path and non-path, as they really are.

original: de la mtho ris kyi lam ni dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: de la mtho ris kyi lam ni dge ba bcu'o //
translated: Among them, the path to heaven is the ten virtues.

original: byang grol gyi lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: byang grol gyi lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The path to liberation is the eightfold noble path.

original: gang gis na mig dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i shes pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na mig dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i shes pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that knowledge by which one becomes endowed with eyes?🔽Therefore, it is said:🔽The one who desires the distinction of seeing with the opened eye of wisdom

original: de'i phyir / shes rab mig phye mthong ba dang // ma mthong khyad par 'dod pa yi //🔽'bras bu re ba dug tsher gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes rab mig phye mthong ba dang // ma mthong khyad par 'dod pa yi // 'bras bu re ba dug tsher gyi //
translated: and not seeing

original: sbyin pa sogs la 'jug mi byed //
analyzed: sbyin pa sogs la 'jug mi byed //
translated: does not engage in generosity and so on, which are like poisonous thorns,

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: hoping for a result.

original: shes rab kyi mig bye ba ni mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'bras bu thob pa dag dang lan byed pa dag la byin na 'di nyid la 'bras bu thob pa dang / ma mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol dang khyad par gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig bye ba ni mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'bras bu thob pa dag dang lan byed pa dag la byin na 'di nyid la 'bras bu thob pa dang / ma mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol dang khyad par gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
translated: The eye of wisdom is opened, and the result of seeing is called the attained result.

original: brgya byin nyid la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba /
analyzed: brgya byin nyid la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba /
translated: The unseen result is called the result of the next world. The special result is called the result of a universal monarch, or of Indra, and so on.

original: skye gnas ngan pa na yang yul la longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: skye gnas ngan pa na yang yul la longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: The desired result is called the result of enjoying objects even in a bad rebirth.

original: de dag lta bu'i 'bras bu la re ba nyid dug yin te /
analyzed: de dag lta bu'i 'bras bu la re ba nyid dug yin te /
translated: Hope for such results is poison,

original: grol ba'i lus kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i lus kyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it creates obstacles to the liberation of the body.

original: de nyid tsher ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid tsher ma yin te /
translated: It is a thorn,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes harm through the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: One should not engage in such generosity, morality, and so on.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhig la brtson par byed ce na /🔽snying rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir //🔽'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yi //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhig la brtson par byed ce na / snying rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir // 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yi //
translated: Well then, what kind of striving is it?🔽He strives for generosity etc.

original: sbyin la sogs la brtson byed cing //🔽de la'ang yid ni gnas mi byed //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs la brtson byed cing // de la'ang yid ni gnas mi byed //
translated: with a completely pure threefold cycle,

original: ces bya ba ste /🔽snying rjes grags pa dang bde ba dang 'gran pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma yin par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na la gcig tu dmigs nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed @54b
analyzed: ces bya ba ste / snying rjes grags pa dang bde ba dang 'gran pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma yin par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na la gcig tu dmigs nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed @54b
translated: but his mind does not rest on that.🔽He strives for generosity etc. with a completely pure threefold cycle,🔽but his mind does not rest on that.

original: do ; /'khor gsum ni 'khor gsum po dag go //
analyzed: do ; /'khor gsum ni 'khor gsum po dag go //
translated: The three cycles are the three cycles of the giver, the gift, and the recipient.

original: yongs su dag pa ni dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Completely pure means stainless.

original: lus kyi mi dge ba rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi rnam pa gsum po de dag dang bral zhing dri ma med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mi dge ba rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi rnam pa gsum po de dag dang bral zhing dri ma med pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa'o //
translated: He strives for generosity etc. which is stainless, free from the three types of immorality of body, the four types of immorality of speech, and the three types of immorality of mind.

original: yang na sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang / len pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang bral bas mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang / len pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas stong pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang bral bas mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: Or else, it is the purity of the three sectors that is preceded by emptiness, because of the non-apprehension of the gift, giver, and receiver, etc.🔽It is the purity of the three sectors that is preceded by signlessness, because of being free from the view of individuality, wrong views, and extreme views.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mngon par mi 'dod pas smon pa med pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i 'khor gsum po yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mngon par mi 'dod pas smon pa med pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i 'khor gsum po yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the purity of the three sectors that is preceded by wishlessness, because of not aspiring for the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de la'ang yid ni gnas mi byed //
analyzed: de la'ang yid ni gnas mi byed //
translated: And in that, the mind does not abide.

original: ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la yang chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la yang chags pa med pa ste /
translated: This shows that there is no attachment even to omniscience.

original: de ltar yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de ltar yang ji skad du /
translated: As has been said:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva's contentment?

original: gang byung chub kyang mi 'dod pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang byung chub kyang mi 'dod pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the non-aspiration even for enlightenment.

original: shes rab med na sbyin pa la sogs pa bskal pa stong snyed du nye bar bsags pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir shes rab kyi mthu ston pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab med na sbyin pa la sogs pa bskal pa stong snyed du nye bar bsags pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir shes rab kyi mthu ston pa ni //
translated: If one lacks wisdom, even if one has practiced generosity and so on for a thousand eons, it does not become the cause for perfecting the transcendent perfections.🔽Wisdom is the nectar that satisfies,🔽the unhindered light of the lamp,

original: shes rab bdud rtsi ngoms byed dang // sgron ma snang ba thogs med dang // thar pa'i khang bzangs them skas dang // nyon mongs bud shing sreg pa'i me //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: shes rab bdud rtsi ngoms byed dang // sgron ma snang ba thogs med dang // thar pa'i khang bzangs them skas dang // nyon mongs bud shing sreg pa'i me // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: the staircase to the mansion of liberation,🔽the fire that burns the firewood of defilements.

original: shes rab ni shes pa rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab ni shes pa rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the best of all knowledge.

original: de nyid bdud rtsi ste /
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi ste /
translated: It is the nectar that satisfies.

original: rga shi med pa'i gnas 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi med pa'i gnas 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause for attaining the state of immortality.

original: de nyid ngoms byed kyang yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ngoms byed kyang yin te /
translated: It is the nectar that satisfies.

original: yul la mngon par 'dod pa ldog pas shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul la mngon par 'dod pa ldog pas shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It produces suppleness by stopping the craving for objects.

original: gang dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis ngoms pa de dag ni ngoms pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis ngoms pa de dag ni ngoms pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that those who are satisfied with the wisdom of the noble ones are truly satisfied.

original: shes rab de nyid sgron ma ste /
analyzed: shes rab de nyid sgron ma ste /
translated: That very wisdom is a lamp,

original: mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it destroys the darkness of ignorance.

original: de nyid snang ba thogs med yin te /🔽phas kyi rgol ba dang bdud kyi phyi ma leb dang nyes pa'i rlung dag gis snang ba mi @55a * //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba thogs med yin te / phas kyi rgol ba dang bdud kyi phyi ma leb dang nyes pa'i rlung dag gis snang ba mi @55a * //
translated: It is a boundless light,

original: choms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: choms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the winds of evil, the darkness of the afflictions, and the winds of opponents and demons do not overpower its light.

original: de nyid thar pa'i khang bzangs kyi them skas yin te /
analyzed: de nyid thar pa'i khang bzangs kyi them skas yin te /
translated: It is a staircase to the palace of liberation,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi ka bas brgyan pa bzang po'i gnas su 'dzegs pa'i ya gad lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi ka bas brgyan pa bzang po'i gnas su 'dzegs pa'i ya gad lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: because it is like a ladder to ascend to the excellent abode of nirvana, the city that is exalted above all worlds and adorned with the pillars of the branches of enlightenment.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i me yin te /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i me yin te /
translated: It is a fire that burns the fuel of the afflictions,

original: nags mes bsregs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i tshang tshing ma lus pa sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽blo gros de yang bden gnyis la //
analyzed: nags mes bsregs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i tshang tshing ma lus pa sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // blo gros de yang bden gnyis la //
translated: because it has the nature of burning the entire thicket of the afflictions, like a forest fire.🔽That very intelligence,🔽depending on the two truths,

original: ltos nas rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: ltos nas rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be of two kinds.

original: yang dag don rtogs rjes mthun phyir //
analyzed: yang dag don rtogs rjes mthun phyir //
translated: It is the knowledge of the conventional, because it is in conformity with the realization of the ultimate truth.

original: yang dag kun rdzob shes pa yin //
analyzed: yang dag kun rdzob shes pa yin //
translated: It is the knowledge of the conventional, because it is in conformity with the realization of the ultimate truth.

original: shes rab kyi blo gros de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la ltos nas rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi blo gros de yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la ltos nas rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: This wisdom is considered to be twofold, in terms of the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de la re zhig yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: First, the knowledge of the conventional is called the mundane knowledge of purification.

original: yang dag pa'i don rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the conventional, because it is in conformity with the realization of the ultimate truth.

original: de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is taught in terms of its divisions:

original: sbyin dang bsod nams ye shes kyi //
analyzed: sbyin dang bsod nams ye shes kyi //
translated: It is the knowledge of generosity, of merit, of wisdom,🔽of the completion of the accumulations, of the results of those causes,

original: tshegs rnams yongs su rdzogs byed dang // rgyu de dag gi 'bras bu dang // 'brel dang mtshan nyid la sogs shes //
analyzed: tshegs rnams yongs su rdzogs byed dang // rgyu de dag gi 'bras bu dang // 'brel dang mtshan nyid la sogs shes //
translated: of the connection, of the characteristics, and so on.🔽It is the cultivation of great love and compassion,

original: byams dang snying rje che bsgom dang // sems can sdud dang smin byed dang // skye mched bcu gnyis brten pa yi //
analyzed: byams dang snying rje che bsgom dang // sems can sdud dang smin byed dang // skye mched bcu gnyis brten pa yi //
translated: the gathering of sentient beings, their maturation, and the twelve sense bases.

original: shes rab brdar btags shes par bya //
analyzed: shes rab brdar btags shes par bya //
translated: Wisdom should be understood as a designation for knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag ste /
translated: and the wisdom that is designated as the cause of their completion.

original: sbyin pa'i tshogs ni gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang shin tu gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshogs ni gtong ba dang gtong ba chen po dang shin tu gtong ba'o //
translated: The accumulation of generosity is the giving of gifts, the giving of great gifts, and the giving of all gifts.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni dad pa dang bag yod pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa goms pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni dad pa dang bag yod pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o // ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa goms pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The accumulation of merit is faith, heedfulness, right view, and so on.🔽The accumulation of wisdom is the knowledge that comes from being accustomed to listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni shes rab brdar btags pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni shes rab brdar btags pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that is designated as the cause of their completion is the knowledge that comes from being accustomed to listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The knowledge that is designated as the cause of their completion is the knowledge of the correct conventional.🔽The knowledge of the connection between the results and those causes is the knowledge of the correct conventional.

original: rgyu de dag gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni tshogs zhes bya ba rgyu gsum po de dag 'bras bu dang ji ltar 'brel pa shes pa yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni tshogs zhes bya ba rgyu gsum po de dag 'bras bu dang ji ltar 'brel pa shes pa yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the connection between the results and those causes is the knowledge of the correct conventional.

original: de la sbyin pa'i tshogs kyi @55b 'bras bu ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'i gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i tshogs kyi @55b 'bras bu ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'i gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: The result of the accumulation of generosity is the form body well adorned with the thirty two marks and eighty minor characteristics of a great being.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The result of the accumulation of merit is the dharmakaya.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The result of the accumulation of wisdom is the wisdom that is possessed in a single instant.

original: 'brel zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ste /
translated: Connection means the connection of cause and effect.

original: de la sems kyi skad cig ma mang pos rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i rgyun gyis ma du lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: de la sems kyi skad cig ma mang pos rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i rgyun gyis ma du lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba lta bu'am /
translated: Therein, the many moments of mind accumulate the cause and the continuum of the result is like the red stamen of a lotus flower.

original: sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun ltar sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan la 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa yod pas de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes pa yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun ltar sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan la 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa yod pas de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes pa yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: Or, like the continuum of a seed and a sprout, the result is generated in another moment of mind. Since there is the capacity to generate the result, the connection of cause and effect is the knowledge of the correct relative.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i bye brag las rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i bye brag las rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic is the characteristic of things. It is twofold, the particular characteristic and the universal characteristic.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po rang gi ngo bo spyod yul dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po rang gi ngo bo spyod yul dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The particular characteristic is the own nature of a thing, which is to be ascertained by a non-conceptual cognition that possesses the object-field.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpog pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpog pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The universal characteristic is to be understood by a conceptual cognition that is an inference.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ngo bo nyid dang brda dang gdags pa dang mtshan ma dang brtsal ba dang blang ba la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ngo bo nyid dang brda dang gdags pa dang mtshan ma dang brtsal ba dang blang ba la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes essence, convention, designation, sign, search, acceptance, and so on.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par dbye ba de dag shes pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par dbye ba de dag shes pa'i blo gros te /
translated: “ Knowledge” is the intelligence that knows those distinctions.

original: de yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is knowledge of the correct conventional.

original: byams dang snying rje che bsgom zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms chen po goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byams dang snying rje che bsgom zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms chen po goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Cultivating great love and compassion means cultivating great love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sems can sdud ces bya ba ni bzhi po de dag dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can sdud pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdud ces bya ba ni bzhi po de dag dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can sdud pa'o //
translated: Gathering sentient beings means gathering sentient beings with those four and the four means of gathering.

original: smin byed ces bya ba ni sems can de dag gi rgyud la dge ba'i chos 'jog pas gang dag yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smin byed ces bya ba ni sems can de dag gi rgyud la dge ba'i chos 'jog pas gang dag yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Maturing means maturing those sentient beings by establishing virtuous dharmas in their mindstreams.

original: de dag shes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no ;
analyzed: de dag shes pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yin no ;
translated: The wisdom that knows those is also correct conventional knowledge.

original: / skyes ched bcu gnyis brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis po dag rab tu rnam par 'byed nus pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / skyes ched bcu gnyis brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis po dag rab tu rnam par 'byed nus pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is able to discern the twelve bases of the great beings is the wisdom that knows the twelve bases.

original: ji skad smos pa de dag shes pa'i shes rab ni brdar btags pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa de dag shes pa'i shes rab ni brdar btags pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that knows those as they are stated should be understood as conventional knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob @56a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob @56a * //
translated: Correct conventional knowledge

original: shes pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin no //
translated: It is consciousness.

original: don dam pa'i shes rab bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes rab bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the wisdom of the ultimate, he says:🔽The absence of conceptualization, the absence of verbalization,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa //
translated: the pacification of all the nets of conceptualization,🔽the establishment of the negation,🔽the self-experience of the individual,🔽the absence of conceptualization, the absence of verbalization,🔽the freedom from identity and diversity,

original: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa dang // zhi dang so so rang rig dang // rnam rtog med cing yi ge med //
analyzed: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa dang // zhi dang so so rang rig dang // rnam rtog med cing yi ge med //
translated: the purity like space,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,🔽the non-engagement in the reality

original: gcig nyid tha dad nyid bral dang // mkha' ltar dri med de nyid la //
analyzed: gcig nyid tha dad nyid bral dang // mkha' ltar dri med de nyid la //
translated: of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,

original: 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa yi //
translated: the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,

original: shes rab don dam shes pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab don dam shes pa yin //
translated: the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / ther zug dang / chad pa la sogs pa rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa sel bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / ther zug dang / chad pa la sogs pa rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa sel bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: of the freedom from identity and diversity,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the purity like space,

original: zhi ba ni spros pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni spros pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality🔽of the absence of verbalization,🔽the non-engagement in the reality

original: so so rang rig pa ni gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang rig pa ni gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Self-cognizance is not known from another.

original: rnam rtog med pa ni rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa ni rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptual is without conceptualization, etc.

original: yi ge med pa ni brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-verbal is not an object of expression.

original: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga nyid dang gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid dang bral ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga nyid dang gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Free from identity and difference is not to be expressed as the same or different, or both or neither.

original: mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ni nam mkha' sprin gyi rim pa dang bral ba ltar dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ni nam mkha' sprin gyi rim pa dang bral ba ltar dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Stainless like space is stainless like space free from the stages of clouds.

original: ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag lta bu'i chos kyi de nyid la 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa ni snang ba med cing 'jug pa med pa nyid de'i 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag lta bu'i chos kyi de nyid la 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa ni snang ba med cing 'jug pa med pa nyid de'i 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since there is no engagement in the reality of phenomena with such aspects as those mentioned, engagement is non-appearance and non-engagement itself is its engagement.

original: de lta bu'i shes rab ni don dam pa shes pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes rab ni don dam pa shes pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, such wisdom should be known as the knowledge of the ultimate.

original: ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni de nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni de nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The absence of seeing is the seeing of reality.”

original: de gnyis las dang po kho nar gang la brtson par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis las dang po kho nar gang la brtson par bya zhe na /
translated: Which of these two should one strive for first?

original: de dag gi go rims bstan pa'i phyir /🔽yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skas //🔽med par yang dag khang pa yi //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims bstan pa'i phyir / yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skas // med par yang dag khang pa yi //
translated: In order to show their sequence, it is said:

original: steng du 'gro bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: steng du 'gro bar bya ba ni //
translated: Without the steps of the correct relative,

original: mkhas la rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas la rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for the wise🔽To ascend to the upper stories of the house of reality.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de nyid khang bzangs thog 'dzeg pa //🔽yang dag kun rdzob them pa'i skas //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir / de nyid khang bzangs thog 'dzeg pa // yang dag kun rdzob them pa'i skas //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:🔽Without the steps of the correct relative,🔽It is not possible to ascend

original: med par rung ba ma yin pa //
analyzed: med par rung ba ma yin pa //
translated: To the upper stories of the house of reality.

original: gang gi phyir ba de phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba de phyir ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For this reason.

original: de nyid khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i khang bzangs sa gsum gyi gnas las mngon par 'phags pa dge ba'i bzo bo @56b dpag tu med pas brtsigs pa /
analyzed: de nyid khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i khang bzangs sa gsum gyi gnas las mngon par 'phags pa dge ba'i bzo bo @56b dpag tu med pas brtsigs pa /
translated: The “house of reality” is the house of liberation, which is superior to the three levels of the spiritual path and is built by the immeasurable craftsmen of virtue.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi ka ba shin tu mthon pos legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi ka ba shin tu mthon pos legs par brgyan pa /
translated: It is well adorned with the lofty pillars of the branches of enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i chos mtha' yas pa'i dkar rtsis byugs pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mtha' yas pa'i dkar rtsis byugs pa /
translated: It is anointed with the white ointment of infinite virtuous qualities.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i zla ba'i zhal gyi 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa rab rib kyi rim pa ma lus pa rnam par bsal ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i zla ba'i zhal gyi 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa rab rib kyi rim pa ma lus pa rnam par bsal ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas so //
translated: It is illuminated by the light rays of the moon-like face of the Sugata, and it completely removes all the stages of darkness. It is the abode of omniscience.

original: de'i thog tu 'dzeg pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i them skas bskal pa grangs med pa bdun po dag tu spyad pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dbang dang mngon par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas gya tshom kho nar nus par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i thog tu 'dzeg pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i them skas bskal pa grangs med pa bdun po dag tu spyad pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dbang dang mngon par shes pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas gya tshom kho nar nus par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: To ascend to that, one must have the staircase of the correct relative truth. Without practicing for seven incalculable aeons, without perfecting the perfections, the powers, and the superknowledges, it is not possible to ascend to that abode of omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun rdzob kyi chos rnams med par don dam par rtogs par mi nus zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun rdzob kyi chos rnams med par don dam par rtogs par mi nus zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Without the relative, the ultimate cannot be realized.”

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dang por kun rdzob kyi bden pa blo gros kyis rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dang por kun rdzob kyi bden pa blo gros kyis rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first, the relative truth should be well distinguished by the mind.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rnam par 'byed pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rnam par 'byed pa'i don gyis te /
translated: The conventional is so called because it is the meaning that distinguishes all things such as form.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: It is the nonerroneous mundane convention.

original: de nyid bden pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bden pa ste /
translated: That itself is the truth,

original: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la 'gro ba'i tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la 'gro ba'i tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
