translated: because it is the valid cognition that goes to all the presentations.

original: de la dang por /🔽gzugs ni rnam gnyis rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ; de bzhin du yig 'bru dang bstan bcos dang lag rtsis dang shod thabs dang / nor brgyud pa'i rgyud dang / sman dpyad dang / rtsis dang / gsang sngags dang /
analyzed: de la dang por / gzugs ni rnam gnyis rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ; de bzhin du yig 'bru dang bstan bcos dang lag rtsis dang shod thabs dang / nor brgyud pa'i rgyud dang / sman dpyad dang / rtsis dang / gsang sngags dang /
translated: First,

original: rig sngags la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten na grags pa dag rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas nas de'i 'og tu chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shin tu rnam par nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig sngags la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten na grags pa dag rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas nas de'i 'og tu chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shin tu rnam par nges par 'gyur te /
translated: having thoroughly distinguished the twenty types of form and so on, and likewise the scriptural treatises, the art of calculation, the art of writing, the art of lineage, the art of medicine, the art of astrology, the art of mantra, the art of knowledge mantra and so on, whatever is renowned in the world, then one will be very certain about the specific and general characteristics of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir des ni mtshan nyid med pa don dam pa'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rab tu rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni mtshan nyid med pa don dam pa'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rab tu rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this teaches the classification of the correct relative, the domain of the pure mundane knowledge that is attained subsequently to the ultimate, which is devoid of characteristics.

original: de la chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the specific characteristics of phenomena are such as: capable of material form, experience, apprehension of signs, conditioning, and consciousness.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //🔽yang rang @57a * //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o // yang rang @57a * //
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, and so forth.

original: gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po dang ser po dang ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po dang ser po dang ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the specific characteristics are blue, yellow, long, short, and so forth, as well as form, sound, and so forth.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The general characteristics are the emptiness of dissimilar types.

original: de la shin tu rnam par nges par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par nges par gyur nas /
translated: Having become very certain about that,

original: mkhas pa sems ni mnyam gzhag phyir //
analyzed: mkhas pa sems ni mnyam gzhag phyir //
translated: The wise one should be intent on

original: mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya //
translated: equanimity of mind.

original: de bzhin thos byung shes pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin thos byung shes pa la //
translated: And likewise, in the knowledge that arises from hearing,

original: de las gzhan shes rgyu phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan shes rgyu phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the other two kinds of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba la ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the mind be made to rest in equanimity?

original: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa dran pas so //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa dran pas so //
translated: By mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa ni dbugs phyir dbyung ba dang dbugs nang du rngub pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa ni dbugs phyir dbyung ba dang dbugs nang du rngub pa'o //
translated: Inhalation and exhalation are the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.

original: de gnyis sna'i rtse mor dran pa nye bar bzhag nas bgrang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis sna'i rtse mor dran pa nye bar bzhag nas bgrang bar bya ste /
translated: Having placed mindfulness at the tip of the nose, one should count them,

original: dang po dbyung ba nas bcu la sogs pa dang brgya'i bar du rjes su mthun pa dang rjes su mi mthun par bgrang ngo //
analyzed: dang po dbyung ba nas bcu la sogs pa dang brgya'i bar du rjes su mthun pa dang rjes su mi mthun par bgrang ngo //
translated: from one to ten and so on, up to one hundred, in accordance with the breath and in opposition to the breath.

original: yang 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la dran pa gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la dran pa gtad par bya ste /
translated: Again, one should fix the mind on the arising and entering of the breath.

original: 'byung ba ni dri nga ba dang ring ba dang dro bar dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni dri nga ba dang ring ba dang dro bar dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: Arising is the exhalation of the breath, which is foul, long, and warm.

original: 'jug pa ni dri zhim pa dang thung ba dang grang bar dbugs 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dri zhim pa dang thung ba dang grang bar dbugs 'jug pa'o //

original: lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung zhing sna'i rtse mor thug pa de lta bur rkang pa'i mthe bong nas lus thams cad la dran par 'jug par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe des lcags mgar gyi sbud pa bzhin du lus gang bar mthong ba de'i tshe na lus thams cad so so yang dag par rig pa zhes pa'i chos kyi sgo thob cing lus dang sems las su rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung zhing sna'i rtse mor thug pa de lta bur rkang pa'i mthe bong nas lus thams cad la dran par 'jug par bya'o // gang gi tshe des lcags mgar gyi sbud pa bzhin du lus gang bar mthong ba de'i tshe na lus thams cad so so yang dag par rig pa zhes pa'i chos kyi sgo thob cing lus dang sems las su rung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.

original: kha cig ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa 'gags pa na chos kyi sgo skye bar yang 'dod do //🔽de ltar de dag la sogs pas sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa 'gags pa na chos kyi sgo skye bar yang 'dod do //🔽de ltar de dag la sogs pas sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external when it is outside the body.🔽The breath is said to be internal when it is in the body, and external

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / gtan tshigs dang / gso ba dang / nang zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i gnas bzhi po dag la yongs su 'dris pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa la yang mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / gtan tshigs dang / gso ba dang / nang zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i gnas bzhi po dag la yongs su 'dris pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa la yang mngon par brtson pa nyid du bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should be diligent in the knowledge that arises from hearing, which is characterized by familiarity with the four branches of knowledge: medicine, grammar, logic, and inner science.

original: de ni de las gzhan pa bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bla na med pa'i shes pa dag 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan pa bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bla na med pa'i shes pa dag 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the cause for attaining the unsurpassed knowledge that arises from contemplation and meditation, which is different from that.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas de nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir @57b ro ;
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas de nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir @57b ro ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that reality is realized through a mind that is in equipoise, not otherwise, it is said:🔽Just as a face is not seen

original: / ji ltar chu rnyog g-yo ba la //
analyzed: / ji ltar chu rnyog g-yo ba la //
translated: in a dirty mirror,

original: bzhin ni mthong bar mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bzhin ni mthong bar mi 'gyur ba //
translated: so reality is not seen

original: de ltar sems mnyam ma bzhag dang // sgrib pas bsgribs la de nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar sems mnyam ma bzhag dang // sgrib pas bsgribs la de nyid do //
translated: with an unequipoised mind.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And also:🔽Just as a face is not seen🔽in a dirty mirror,🔽so reality is not seen🔽with a mind obscured by afflictions.

original: ji ltar chu rdul mang pos rnyog pa can dang / rlung gis bskyod cing g-yo ba la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mthong bar 'dod pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems yul mang po la 'phro zhing mnyam par gzhag pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar chu rdul mang pos rnyog pa can dang / rlung gis bskyod cing g-yo ba la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mthong bar 'dod pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems yul mang po la 'phro zhing mnyam par gzhag pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
translated: Just as a person who wants to see his own reflection in water that is disturbed by many waves and stirred by the wind will not see it, so one who wants to see the suchness of phenomena will not see it when the mind is disturbed by many objects and obscured by the five hindrances called sensual desire,

original: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa lnga po de dag gis bsgribs pa la chos kyi de nyid mthong bar 'dod pa mi mthong ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa lnga po de dag gis bsgribs pa la chos kyi de nyid mthong bar 'dod pa mi mthong ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: malice, lethargy and sleep, excited speech and remorse, and doubt.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: yid kyi glang po log 'gro ba //
analyzed: yid kyi glang po log 'gro ba //
translated: the elephant of the mind wanders off

original: dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po la //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po la //
translated: to the pillar of the object.

original: dran pa'i thag pas nges bcings nas //
analyzed: dran pa'i thag pas nges bcings nas //
translated: But when it is bound by the rope of mindfulness🔽to the post of the breath,

original: shes rab lcags kyus rim dbang bya //
analyzed: shes rab lcags kyus rim dbang bya //
translated: it is gradually controlled by the hook of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag pa dag gi yid kyi glang po che thar pa dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa la log par 'gro ba ni dge ba'i chos tshad med pa bzhi la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag pa dag gi yid kyi glang po che thar pa dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa la log par 'gro ba ni dge ba'i chos tshad med pa bzhi la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ka ba brtan po
translated: As previously explained, the elephant of the mind of those who have settled their minds is directed to the practice of virtue, such as the four immeasurables, by the stable pillar of the focus.🔽

original: la dran pa'i zhags thag gis nges par bcings nas /
analyzed: la dran pa'i zhags thag gis nges par bcings nas /
translated: As previously explained, the elephant of the mind of those who have attained meditative concentration is restrained by the rope of mindfulness to the firm pillar of the object, the four immeasurables, etc.,

original: shes rab kyi blo gros kyi lcags kyus gtsags pas rim gyis khad kyis khad kyis dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi blo gros kyi lcags kyus gtsags pas rim gyis khad kyis khad kyis dbang du bya'o //
translated: and is gradually brought under control by the hook of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du /🔽rgod pa mi rtag la sogs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du / rgod pa mi rtag la sogs pa //
translated: Thus,

original: yid la byed pas zhi bar bya //
analyzed: yid la byed pas zhi bar bya //
translated: arrogance is pacified by attention to impermanence, etc.

original: zhum pa dmigs pa rgya chen dag / bsgoms pas spangs pa nyid du bya //
analyzed: zhum pa dmigs pa rgya chen dag / bsgoms pas spangs pa nyid du bya //
translated: Depression is abandoned by meditating on a vast object.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs dang gzugs dang lang tsho'i rgyags pas rgod pa nyid du gyur na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs dang gzugs dang lang tsho'i rgyags pas rgod pa nyid du gyur na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: If one becomes arrogant through pride in one’s family, beauty, or youth, one should pacify that by attention to impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, etc.

original: ha cang zhum pa nyid du gyur na yang mdo sde la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rgya chen po dag bsgoms pas spangs pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang zhum pa nyid du gyur na yang mdo sde la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rgya chen po dag bsgoms pas spangs pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: If it is too slack, it should be eliminated by cultivating the vast objects such as the Sutras.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems bzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems bzhag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, these explain the placement of the yogin's mind.

original: sems bsdu ba dang gzengs bstod pa dag bstan pa'i phyir /🔽g-yengs pas g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma la //
analyzed: sems bsdu ba dang gzengs bstod pa dag bstan pa'i phyir / g-yengs pas g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma la //
translated: To explain the mind's withdrawal and encouragement, it says:🔽The distracted should be withdrawn

original: nyes dmigs lta bas bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: nyes dmigs lta bas bsdu bar bya //
translated: by seeing the faults of distraction.

original: zhum pa yang ni brtson 'grus kyi //
analyzed: zhum pa yang ni brtson 'grus kyi //
translated: The slack should be encouraged

original: phan yon mthong bas gzengs bstod bya //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phan yon mthong bas gzengs bstod bya // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: by seeing the benefits of effort.

original: sems @58a * //
analyzed: sems @58a * //
translated: The mind

original: dmigs pa mang po las 'phro zhing spre'u bzhin du nges par mi gnas pas chos kyi de nyid kyi don las nyams pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa mang po las 'phro zhing spre'u bzhin du nges par mi gnas pas chos kyi de nyid kyi don las nyams pa'am /
translated: is distracted from many objects and does not abide like a monkey, so it degenerates from the meaning of the reality of phenomena.

original: mi ma yin pa la sogs pas sun phyung ste /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la sogs pas sun phyung ste /
translated: Or, it is distracted by non-human beings, etc.

original: g-yengs pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: g-yengs pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma 'di lta ste /
translated: When it becomes distracted, at that time, the signs of distraction are as follows:

original: mig dag me ltar 'bar ba dang / chus g-yeng ba dang / g-yang sa nas lhung ba la sogs pa mang po 'byung ba la nyes dmigs su lta bas sems nang du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig dag me ltar 'bar ba dang / chus g-yeng ba dang / g-yang sa nas lhung ba la sogs pa mang po 'byung ba la nyes dmigs su lta bas sems nang du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: When there is a lot of agitation, such as the eyes burning like fire, being flooded with water, falling into an abyss, and so on, one should gather the mind inward by viewing it as a fault.🔽When laziness arises due to excessive exertion,

original: ha cang brtson 'grus zhum zhing le lo skye bar gyur na de yongs su spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ha cang brtson 'grus zhum zhing le lo skye bar gyur na de yongs su spang ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to completely abandon that,

original: brtson 'grus kyi phan yon mthong bas zhum pa gzengs bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi phan yon mthong bas zhum pa gzengs bstod par bya'o //
translated: one should encourage the slack by seeing the benefits of exertion.

original: sems bkru ba dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bkru ba dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cleansing of the mind,🔽it is said:🔽The mind defiled by the mud of desire,🔽hatred, and ignorance,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi / rdzab dris sbags shing ma bsdams ba //🔽mi sdug byams pa rten 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi / rdzab dris sbags shing ma bsdams ba // mi sdug byams pa rten 'byung ba'i //
translated: uncontrolled,

original: chu dag gis ni bkru bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chu dag gis ni bkru bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: should be cleansed with the water of the impurity meditation, loving kindness, and dependent origination.

original: 'dod chags yul la lhag par chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / khong khro ba dang ; gti mug mun pa dag gi 'dam rdzab kyi dri mas spags shing spros pa nye bar ma zhi bas ma bsdams pa dag go rims bzhin du mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags yul la lhag par chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / khong khro ba dang ; gti mug mun pa dag gi 'dam rdzab kyi dri mas spags shing spros pa nye bar ma zhi bas ma bsdams pa dag go rims bzhin du mi sdug pa dang /
translated: The impurities of the mire of attachment, aversion, and delusion, which are the defilements of excessive attachment to objects of desire, hostility, and the darkness of delusion, are not pacified and not restrained.

original: byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chu dag gis bkru zhing rnam par sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chu dag gis bkru zhing rnam par sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: One should wash and purify them with the water of the meditation on the impurity of the body, loving-kindness, and dependent origination.

original: rim pa de dag gis /
analyzed: rim pa de dag gis /
translated: By these stages,🔽one should be secluded, unmoving, peaceful,🔽and focused on the object.

original: dben zhing mi g-yo zhi ba dang // dmigs pa dag la gzhol ba dang // las su rung zhing mnyen shes nas //
analyzed: dben zhing mi g-yo zhi ba dang // dmigs pa dag la gzhol ba dang // las su rung zhing mnyen shes nas //
translated: When one is flexible and pliant,

original: de la legs par btang snyoms bya //
analyzed: de la legs par btang snyoms bya //
translated: one should be well-balanced there.

original: zhes bya ba la dben pa ni bkra bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dben pa ni bkra bas so //
translated: Here, seclusion is due to vividness.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mi g-yeng bas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mi g-yeng bas so //
translated: Unmoving is due to non-distraction.

original: zhi ba ni nang du bsdu bas so //
analyzed: zhi ba ni nang du bsdu bas so //
translated: Peaceful is due to internal gathering.

original: dmigs pa dag la gzhol ba ni dmigs pa mtha' dag la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dag la gzhol ba ni dmigs pa mtha' dag la 'jug pas so //
translated: Focused on the object is due to engaging the entire object.

original: las su rung ba ni dga' mgur 'jug pas so //
analyzed: las su rung ba ni dga' mgur 'jug pas so //
translated: Flexible is due to engaging as one wishes.

original: mnyen pa ni nga rgyal dang khengs pa med pas so //
analyzed: mnyen pa ni nga rgyal dang khengs pa med pas so //
translated: It is supple, because it is free from pride and arrogance.🔽And when he knows that the mind is not distracted in this way, he should settle it in that state, with ease.

original: sems de ltar bsgrim pa med kyang lam log pa de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur bar shes nas de la legs par btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o //🔽blo gros mnyam gzhag 'og tu ni //
analyzed: sems de ltar bsgrim pa med kyang lam log pa de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur bar shes nas de la legs par btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o // blo gros mnyam gzhag 'og tu ni //
translated: After the mind has been settled in this way,🔽he should examine the conventional nature of things

original: tha snyad sgo nas gzung bya yi //
analyzed: tha snyad sgo nas gzung bya yi //
translated: with wisdom, in order to understand

original: chos rnams dngos po 'di dag la //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po 'di dag la //
translated: the conventional nature of things.

original: shes rab kyis ni 'di ltar brtag / ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe de'i sems kyi blo gros mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyes par gyur pa de'i 'og tu tha snyad kyi sgo nas gzung bar bya ba @58b kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni 'di ltar brtag / ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe de'i sems kyi blo gros mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyes par gyur pa de'i 'og tu tha snyad kyi sgo nas gzung bar bya ba @58b kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis
translated: When the bodhisattva has thus generated the concentration of the mind that is settled in this way, then after that, he should examine the conventional nature of things with wisdom, in order to understand the conventional nature of things.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa 'di dag la shes rab kyis 'di ltar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa 'di dag la shes rab kyis 'di ltar brtag par bya'o //
translated: The entities of the phenomena that are established, such as earth, water, fire, and wind, have such qualities as solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility. One should investigate them with wisdom in the following way.

original: blo yis rnam par dpyad pa na //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par dpyad pa na //
translated: When they are analyzed by the mind,

original: 'di dag don dam yod dam ci //
analyzed: 'di dag don dam yod dam ci //
translated: do they exist ultimately?

original: zhes bya ba ni de blos yongs su rtog pa na dngos po 'di dag don dam par yang 'thad dam 'on te ji ltar snyam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de blos yongs su rtog pa na dngos po 'di dag don dam par yang 'thad dam 'on te ji ltar snyam pa'o //
translated: When one examines them with the mind, one should think, “Are these entities also tenable in the ultimate? Or are they not?”

original: gal te yin na 'di de nyid //
analyzed: gal te yin na 'di de nyid //
translated: If they are, then this is reality.

original: gal te gzhan na de btsal bya //
analyzed: gal te gzhan na de btsal bya //
translated: If they are not, then they should be sought.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig don dam par yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid 'di dag yod par rigs pa nyid yin na ni de lta na ni dngos po 'di dag nyid don dam pa'i de nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig don dam par yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid 'di dag yod par rigs pa nyid yin na ni de lta na ni dngos po 'di dag nyid don dam pa'i de nyid yin no //
translated: If, on the one hand, it is reasonable that these entities of the natures of phenomena exist in the ultimate, then these entities are reality itself in the ultimate.

original: gal te 'di dag brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir /
translated: If, on the other hand, they are not, then they should be sought in the ultimate because they cannot withstand analysis.

original: 'di dag las don dam pa'i de nyid gzhan yin na ni phyogs su lhung ba med pa'i blos de btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag las don dam pa'i de nyid gzhan yin na ni phyogs su lhung ba med pa'i blos de btsal bar bya'o //
translated: If the ultimate reality is different from these, then it should be sought by a mind that is not partial.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs su lhung bas sems gdungs pas //
analyzed: phyogs su lhung bas sems gdungs pas //
translated: Because the mind is tormented by partiality,

original: zhi ba nam yang rtogs mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba nam yang rtogs mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: one will never realize peace.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten ni phal cher phyogs su lhung bas sems kyi rgyud gdungs bas log par bzung ba la dam du nye bar 'dzin pa yin pas de dag gis ni nam yang zhi ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /🔽// / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten ni phal cher phyogs su lhung bas sems kyi rgyud gdungs bas log par bzung ba la dam du nye bar 'dzin pa yin pas de dag gis ni nam yang zhi ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro / // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
translated: Because the mindstream is tormented by partiality, the world is mostly attached to wrong views. Therefore, they will never realize peace.

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: The commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way, the Blaze of Reasoning,

original: de la mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na /
translated: Here, in brief,

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas chos ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas chos ni //
translated: the conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams so //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams so //
translated: are the aggregates, sense bases, and elements.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dus byas kyi chos ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dus byas kyi chos ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa rnams so //
translated: The conditioned phenomena are those produced by causes and conditions.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: Unconditioned factors are free from origination, endurance, and destruction.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de dag ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad po rnams so //
translated: They are the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements.

original: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi theg par ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi theg par ni /
translated: The Bhagavat has taught them in the Sravaka Vehicle

original: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste //🔽skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: “Alas! Conditioned things are impermanent.🔽They have the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Having arisen, they cease.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
translated: Their pacification is bliss.🔽”

original: zhes de ltar /
analyzed: zhes de ltar /
translated: And he has said,

original: nyon mongs sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir //
translated: “In order to abandon the afflictive obstructions,🔽I have taught the Sravakas

original: nyan thos rnams la rab tu bshad //🔽ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la rab tu bshad // ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is taught to the śrāvakas.🔽🔽

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the method?

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang yin de dag 'dod pa min //🔽kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags @59a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang yin de dag 'dod pa min // kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags @59a * //
translated: The various things of the world are not objects of desire.🔽Desire is the desire of the person

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin //
translated: that arises from conceptual attachment.

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs dag ni de ltar gnas bzhin du //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs dag ni de ltar gnas bzhin du //
translated: The various things of the world exist in this way.

original: bstan pa dag ni de la 'dun pa 'dul bar byed //
analyzed: bstan pa dag ni de la 'dun pa 'dul bar byed //
translated: The teachings are for the purpose of taming those who aspire to them.🔽

original: ces gsungs pa ltar ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa ltar ro //
translated: The teachings are for taming those who aspire to them.

original: theg pa chen po ni byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yod pa ma yin na nyon mongs pa rnams gal 'byung ste /🔽de ltar bag chags bcas pa yi //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yod pa ma yin na nyon mongs pa rnams gal 'byung ste / de ltar bag chags bcas pa yi //
translated: The Mahayana is not an object of knowledge by way of non-arising, non-entity, non-production, non-cessation, non-conditioning, and non-duality. If so, how can afflictions arise?🔽Thus,🔽The stains of afflictive and

original: nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib dri ma //🔽spang phyir snying rje ldan rnams la //
analyzed: nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib dri ma // spang phyir snying rje ldan rnams la //
translated: knowable obscurations, along with their imprints,🔽Are abandoned.

original: rab tu bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is taught for those who possess compassion.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rags pa spangs na dngos por 'dzin pa phra mo dang bral par sla bas /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rags pa spangs na dngos por 'dzin pa phra mo dang bral par sla bas /
translated: If one abandons coarse clinging to entities, it is easy to be free from subtle grasping at entities.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / rags phyir dang po kho nar ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rags phyir dang po kho nar ni //
translated: Because it is coarse, first

original: gzugs kyi phung po brtag par bya //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po brtag par bya //
translated: The form aggregate is to be examined.

original: de la'ang dang por 'byung ba rnams //
analyzed: de la'ang dang por 'byung ba rnams //
translated: Also, first, the elements

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because of the reason stated,

original: gnas pa khyon che ba dang / blo rtsing ge ma'i gzung ba yin pas rags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa khyon che ba dang / blo rtsing ge ma'i gzung ba yin pas rags pa'i phyir /
translated: The form aggregate is the coarsest of all the aggregates, because it is the object of the grossest, i.e., least refined, of the six sense organs.

original: dang po kho nar gzugs kyi phung po brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po kho nar gzugs kyi phung po brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the form aggregate is investigated first.

original: gzugs kyi phung po de la'ang dang por 'byung ba rnams brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po de la'ang dang por 'byung ba rnams brtag par bya ste /
translated: And within the form aggregate, the primary elements are investigated first.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
translated: Because of the reason stated.

original: 'byung ba rnams pas 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs rnams cha phra bas de'i phyir //🔽rags phyir dang po kho nar ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams pas 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs rnams cha phra bas de'i phyir // rags phyir dang po kho nar ni //
translated: The form derived from the primary elements is more subtle than the primary elements themselves.🔽Because of its coarseness,

original: 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams brtag par bya //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams brtag par bya //
translated: The form of the primary elements is investigated first.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is how the passage should be construed.

original: 'dir ni sa la sogs pa dag / don dam par na 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni sa la sogs pa dag / don dam par na 'byung ba yi //
translated: Here, earth and so on are not ultimately🔽The nature of the primary elements, because they are produced,

original: ngo bo nyid min byas phyir dang // rgyu ldan sogs phyir shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid min byas phyir dang // rgyu ldan sogs phyir shes pa bzhin //
translated: Like consciousness and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i skabs 'dir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i skabs 'dir ro //
translated: Here, in this context of the search for the knowledge of reality,

original: 'dir ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig ce na /
translated: what is it?

original: sa la sogs pa dag ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag ces bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, “earth, etc.”

original: sa zhes bya ba ni gtos che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni gtos che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Earth is so called because it is the support.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa de chu la sogs pa 'og ma dag gi dang por smos pa'i yan lag gis bsdus pa spyir bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa de chu la sogs pa 'og ma dag gi dang por smos pa'i yan lag gis bsdus pa spyir bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: Etc. means that earth, etc., are included in the first member of the series, water, etc., in the sense of a general class.

original: sogs pa'i sgras chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyang bsdu'o //🔽don dam pa zhes bya ba la don zhes bya ba ni shes bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir don te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyang bsdu'o // don dam pa zhes bya ba la don zhes bya ba ni shes bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir don te /
translated: The word etc. includes water, fire, and air.

original: brtag par bya ba dang go bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba dang go bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Ultimate means that which is to be known, that which is to be examined and understood.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba @59b ni mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gi sgra yin te /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba @59b ni mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gi sgra yin te /
translated: Supreme is a word for the highest.

original: don dam pa zhes bsdu ba ni de don yang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bsdu ba ni de don yang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
translated: The compound paramārtha is analyzed as follows: it is the ultimate because it is the highest object.

original: yang na dam pa'i don te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i don yin pas dam pa'i don to /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i don te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i don yin pas dam pa'i don to /
translated: Or else, it is the ultimate, because it is the object of the ultimate, i.e. of non-conceptual transcendental gnosis.

original: yang na don dam pa dang mthun pa ste don dam pa rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab la don dam pa de yod pas don dam pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don dam pa dang mthun pa ste don dam pa rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab la don dam pa de yod pas don dam pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is in conformity with the ultimate, because it exists in the wisdom which is in conformity with the realization of the ultimate.

original: don dam par na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa de nyid du'ang don dam par ro //
analyzed: don dam par na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa de nyid du'ang don dam par ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense means in the ultimate itself, i.e. in the ultimate truth.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid du 'byung ba'am gzhan 'byung bar byed pas 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid du 'byung ba'am gzhan 'byung bar byed pas 'byung ba dag go //
translated: The elements are so called because they originate by themselves or because they cause the origination of others.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba 'di nyid sa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba 'di nyid sa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the elements is the nature of the elements themselves, i.e. of earth, etc.

original: min zhes bya ba ni dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni dgag pa ston pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The word is is a term which indicates negation.

original: ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is to be supplied with the word not.

original: gang zhig ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is not?

original: sa la sogs pa dag don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Earth and so on are not by nature the elements in the ultimate sense.

original: 'dir min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du gzung gi ma yin par dgag pa'i don du ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du gzung gi ma yin par dgag pa'i don du ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the negation in “not in that” is to be taken as a nonimplicative negation, not as an implicative negation.

original: med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa zhes bya ba de gnyis kyi bye brag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa zhes bya ba de gnyis kyi bye brag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between a nonimplicative negation and an implicative negation?

original: ma yin par dgag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dgag pas de dang 'dra ba de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dgag pas de dang 'dra ba de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: An implicative negation is a negation of the nature of an entity, and it implies the existence of another entity that is similar to it.

original: dper na 'di bram ze ma yin no zhes dgag pas bram ze de 'dra ba de las gzhan pa bram ze ma yin pa dka' thub dang thos pa la sogs pas dman pa'i dmangs rigs yin par bsgrubs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di bram ze ma yin no zhes dgag pas bram ze de 'dra ba de las gzhan pa bram ze ma yin pa dka' thub dang thos pa la sogs pas dman pa'i dmangs rigs yin par bsgrubs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the negation “He is not a brahmin” implies that he is a non-brahmin, a member of a lower caste, such as a kṣatriya, who is inferior to a brahmin in terms of his austerities, learning, and so on.

original: med par dgag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid tsam zhig 'gog par zad kyi de dang 'dra ba de ma yin pa gzhan gyi dngos po sgrub par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid tsam zhig 'gog par zad kyi de dang 'dra ba de ma yin pa gzhan gyi dngos po sgrub par mi byed pa ste /
translated: A nonimplicative negation merely negates the intrinsic reality of a thing, but does not establish another thing that is not like that.

original: dper na bram zes chang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig 'gog par zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i btung ba btung ngo zhe'am mi btung ngo zhes mi brjod pa lta bu'o //🔽des na 'dir na 'jig rten pas yongs su btags pa'i sa la sogs pa don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par dgag pa tsam zhig byed par zad kyi gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: dper na bram zes chang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig 'gog par zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i btung ba btung ngo zhe'am mi btung ngo zhes mi brjod pa lta bu'o // des na 'dir na 'jig rten pas yongs su btags pa'i sa la sogs pa don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par dgag pa tsam zhig byed par zad kyi gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'am /
translated: For example, when it is said, “A brahmin should not drink alcohol,” that merely negates that much, but it does not say, “Drink another drink or do not drink.”

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, it merely negates that earth and so on, which are imputed by worldly people, are ultimately the intrinsic reality of the elements, but it does not establish that they are another intrinsic reality or that they are the intrinsic reality of nonthings.

original: 'dir sa la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni chos can yin @60a * //
analyzed: 'dir sa la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni chos can yin @60a * //
translated: Here, “earth and so on” is the subject.

original: la ; don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni de'i chos yin no //
analyzed: la ; don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni de'i chos yin no //
translated: “Ultimately, they are not the intrinsic reality of the elements” is its predicate.

original: chos can dang chos bsdus pa ni phyogs yin te /
analyzed: chos can dang chos bsdus pa ni phyogs yin te /
translated: The subject and the attribute are the position.

original: rigs pa la mkhas pa dag na re gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'i phyir phyogs zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rigs pa la mkhas pa dag na re gzhan la gsal bar byed pa'i phyir phyogs zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who are skilled in reasoning say: It is called a position because it is made clear to others.

original: 'dir gzhan dag gis brgal ba khyed cag gi ston pa'i tshig las 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag gis brgal ba khyed cag gi ston pa'i tshig las 'di skad ces /
translated: Here, others argue: In the words of your teacher, it is said:🔽“O Brahmin, everything, everything is the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements.”

original: kye bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad po dag go zhes bya ba dang // de bzhin du gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung la //
analyzed: kye bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad po dag go zhes bya ba dang // de bzhin du gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung la //
translated: And similarly, the definition of form is that which is suitable as form.

original: khyed kyis kyang de khas blangs nas de nyid 'gog par byed na khas blangs pas gnod do //
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang de khas blangs nas de nyid 'gog par byed na khas blangs pas gnod do //
translated: But you accept that and then refute it, so your position is undermined.

original: de bzhin du yul so sor nges pa la 'jug pa nyid ni dbang po rnams kyi mngon sum yin par grags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul so sor nges pa la 'jug pa nyid ni dbang po rnams kyi mngon sum yin par grags te /
translated: Similarly, the engagement of the sense faculties in their specific objects is known as perception.

original: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med la /
analyzed: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med la /
translated: There is no other valid cognition superior to seeing.

original: khyed dang nyid kyi mig gis kyang 'byung ba'i dbyibs dang ; gzugs dag mthong zhing de'i ngo bo nyid kyi reg pa rtsub pa dag kyang tshol la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa 'jig rten pa thams cad kyang nye bar gzung ba yod bzhin du de dag 'gog pa la mngon sum gyis kyang gnod do //
analyzed: khyed dang nyid kyi mig gis kyang 'byung ba'i dbyibs dang ; gzugs dag mthong zhing de'i ngo bo nyid kyi reg pa rtsub pa dag kyang tshol la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa 'jig rten pa thams cad kyang nye bar gzung ba yod bzhin du de dag 'gog pa la mngon sum gyis kyang gnod do //
translated: Your eyes and those of others see the shapes and forms of the elements, and you also feel their rough natures. You also see that all worldly people engage in actions such as grasping them. Thus, your refutation is undermined by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag dang / de dag gi sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dag ni ri khrod pa dang gdol pa yan chad la yang grags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag dang / de dag gi sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dag ni ri khrod pa dang gdol pa yan chad la yang grags te /
translated: Moreover, the nature of these things such as form and the nature of their attributes such as solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility are renowned even to foresters and outcastes.

original: de ltar 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar byed pas grags pas kyang gnod do zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar byed pas grags pas kyang gnod do zhe na ;
translated: Thus, your refutation is undermined by what is renowned, since it clearly contradicts the nature of things that is renowned to all the world.

original: bshad par bya ste don dam par zhes sam bcas pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa dang mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste don dam par zhes sam bcas pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa dang mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Response: I will explain. Because there is a distinction that the ultimate is so, there is no contradiction with what is accepted, with perception, or with what is well known.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Because the Transcendent Lord taught two truths,

original: de la kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang mdzad la /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang mdzad la /
translated: in the conventional truth he posited the nature and characteristics of phenomena,

original: don dam par ni ngo bo nyid med par gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ngo bo nyid med par gsungs te /
translated: but in the ultimate truth he said they are natureless.🔽Thus it says in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: de ltar yang koo shi ka chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang koo shi ka chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Kauśika, all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: That all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality is nonentity.🔽That nonentity is the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @60b phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pas dngos po nyid kyang med na de'i ngo bo nyid ltag la yod de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @60b phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pas dngos po nyid kyang med na de'i ngo bo nyid ltag la yod de /
translated: Thus, if entities do not exist, how could their intrinsic reality exist?

original: de'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with what is accepted.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang med de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang med de /
translated: Nor is there any contradiction with direct perception.

original: yul rnams log pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams blun pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin du yang rab rib cad la skra dang sbrang ma dang sbrang bu la sogs pa snang ba lta bu dang /
analyzed: yul rnams log pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams blun pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa bzhin du yang rab rib cad la skra dang sbrang ma dang sbrang bu la sogs pa snang ba lta bu dang /
translated: Because the objects are unreal, and because the sense faculties are ignorant, the power of seeing and so on is like the appearance of hair, flies, bees, and so on to one with blurred vision, and like an echo and so on.

original: brag ca la sogs pa ltar mngon sum yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin pas de'i phyir gang la ci zhig mngon sum du gyur na des gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: brag ca la sogs pa ltar mngon sum yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin pas de'i phyir gang la ci zhig mngon sum du gyur na des gnod par 'gyur /
translated: Since direct perception is also a form of conceit, therefore, if something is direct perception for someone, how could it contradict him?

original: grags pa'i gnod pa yang med de /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa yang med de /
translated: Nor is there any contradiction with what is renowned.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na mi shes pa'i ling tog gis mdongs pa yin pas don dam par dpyad pa'i skabs su de ni nor bu rin po che brtag pa dag la dmus long ma brtags pa bzhin du mi rtogs pas grags pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na mi shes pa'i ling tog gis mdongs pa yin pas don dam par dpyad pa'i skabs su de ni nor bu rin po che brtag pa dag la dmus long ma brtags pa bzhin du mi rtogs pas grags pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Because the world is blinded by the cataracts of ignorance, in the context of ultimate analysis, like a blind person not examining precious jewels, they are not understood. Therefore, there is no contradiction with what is renowned.

original: 'o na don dam pa ni gang dag blo thams cad las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na don dam pa ni gang dag blo thams cad las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Well, the ultimate is beyond all thought.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa ni yi ge'i yul yin pas de'i phyir dgag pa med par mi 'gyur rab zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa ni yi ge'i yul yin pas de'i phyir dgag pa med par mi 'gyur rab zhe na /
translated: But the negation of the reality of things is the domain of words. Therefore, it is not nonexistent.

original: don dam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ultimate is twofold:

original: de la gcig ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa spros pa med pa'o //
translated: One is the supramundane, uncontaminated, nonelaborated, which is entered without mental fabrication.

original: gnyis pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba spros pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba spros pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The second is the mundane, contaminated, elaborated, which is entered with mental fabrication, and is called “pure mundane knowledge,” which is in conformity with the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: 'dir de dam bcas pa'i khyad par nyid bzung bas nyes pa med do//
analyzed: 'dir de dam bcas pa'i khyad par nyid bzung bas nyes pa med do//
translated: Here, since only the distinction of the thesis is taken, there is no fault.

original: gal te rang gi phyogs bzhag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i co 'dri ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi phyogs bzhag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i co 'dri ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one does not posit one’s own position, is one not just prattling, refuting the positions of others?

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: In our own position, it is the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir des na co 'dri ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir des na co 'dri ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of phenomena is that, therefore it is not a mere quibble.

original: re zhig de ltar phyogs kyi skyon med par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar phyogs kyi skyon med par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the fault of the position is established in that way.

original: rigs pa can dag gtan tshigs med pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar kun tu zhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul pa med pa'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nye
analyzed: rigs pa can dag gtan tshigs med pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar kun tu zhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul pa med pa'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nye
translated: The logicians are fully engaged in the statement, “Without a reason, there is no valid cognition.” Therefore, immediately after the thesis, in order to demonstrate the unerring proof, the reason is

original: bar @61a * //
analyzed: bar @61a * //
translated: posited.

original: 'jog pa ni byas phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jog pa ni byas phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reason is “because it is produced.”

original: byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: “Produced” means that it is manifestly established by causes and conditions.

original: de'i dngos po ni byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni byas pa nyid de /
translated: Its state is “being produced.”

original: de'i phyir byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, “because it is produced” is stated as the reason.

original: 'o na gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Well, this reason is not established,

original: mngon par gsal ba smra ba la 'di ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba smra ba la 'di ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not established for the proponent of manifest action.

original: skabs 'di nyid du 'og nas mngon par gsal ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: skabs 'di nyid du 'og nas mngon par gsal ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error, because later on in this very chapter, we will refute manifest action.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs su rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa ni gang dang gang byas pa nyid yin pa de dang de 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs su rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa ni gang dang gang byas pa nyid yin pa de dang de 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The demonstration of the forward pervasion is: Whatever is a product is not by nature arisen,

original: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like consciousness.

original: shes pa ji ltar byas pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa ji ltar byas pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is consciousness a product?

original: mtho ris dang byang grol la sogs pa'i rtog ges yongs su bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol la sogs pa'i rtog ges yongs su bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is fully established by the conceptual thought of high rebirth, liberation, and so forth.

original: 'dir shes pa yang byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes dgag pa yang med par dgag pa'i don nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa yang byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes dgag pa yang med par dgag pa'i don nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, because consciousness is also a product, there is no refutation of the meaning of the nonimplicative negation that it is not by nature arisen.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid kyi tshul ma bstan pa ni 'dir smra bar 'dod pa'i tshul gnyis kho na'i gtan tshigs kyis tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid kyi tshul ma bstan pa ni 'dir smra bar 'dod pa'i tshul gnyis kho na'i gtan tshigs kyis tha snyad byed do //
translated: The third mode of the reason is not stated here, because the expression of the proposition is made by the reason of the two modes alone that are intended to be stated here.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par zad kyi /
translated: The property of the subject exists only in the similar instance.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa gzhan rdul phran tsam yang med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid med pa'i phyir des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i dpe dang gtan tshigs bstan pa ma byas so //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa gzhan rdul phran tsam yang med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid med pa'i phyir des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i dpe dang gtan tshigs bstan pa ma byas so //
translated: Since there is not even an atom of an entity that is not similar to that, the dissimilar instance itself does not exist. Therefore, the example and reason of the reversal from the dissimilar instance are not stated.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir rgyu ldan sogs zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rgyu ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di la rgyu yod pa'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir rgyu ldan sogs zhes bya ba smras te / rgyu ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di la rgyu yod pa'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: To teach another type of reason, he says, “possessing a cause, etc.”🔽“Possessing a cause” means that because this has a cause, it possesses a cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: An entity that possesses a cause is possession of a cause.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The words “and so on” are meant to include other reasons such as being an entity, being an object of knowledge, being an object of expression, and so on.

original: 'dir yang rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos te //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos te //
translated: Here, the phrase “because of having a cause, and so on” is meant to include the reason.

original: gang dang gang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang de ni @61b 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang de ni @61b 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is an entity, an object of knowledge, an object of expression, and so on, is not an element by nature,

original: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
translated: just like consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam par na 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, earth and so on are not ultimately of the nature of the elements.

original: de ltar phyogs 'dis tshad ma thams cad kyang rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs 'dis tshad ma thams cad kyang rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, all the means of knowledge should be explained.

original: 'dir gang dag go sla ba dang rnam par bshad zin pa'i don de dag ni 'og nas kyang yi ge mangs kyis dogs nas rnam par mi 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir gang dag go sla ba dang rnam par bshad zin pa'i don de dag ni 'og nas kyang yi ge mangs kyis dogs nas rnam par mi 'chad do //
translated: Here, those things that are easy to understand and whose meaning has already been explained will not be explained again below for fear of being verbose.

original: spyir dgag pa bstan nas de dag bye brag tu dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: spyir dgag pa bstan nas de dag bye brag tu dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Having generally taught the negations, in order to teach their specific negations,

original: sa ni sra ba'i ngo bo min //
analyzed: sa ni sra ba'i ngo bo min //
translated: Earth is not the essence of solidity,

original: 'byung ba nyid phyir rlung bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid phyir rlung bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an element, like wind.

original: sa yi las ni 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: sa yi las ni 'dzin ma yin //
translated: The function of earth is not to support,

original: byas pa nyid phyir chu bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid phyir chu bzhin no //
translated: Because it is produced, like water.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: And so on.

original: 'jig rten dang chos mngon pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos las sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra pa nyid yin pa las ni brtan par byed par bstan pas de dag dgag pa'i phyir tshad ma rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang chos mngon pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos las sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra pa nyid yin pa las ni brtan par byed par bstan pas de dag dgag pa'i phyir tshad ma rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod de /
translated: In the treatises of the world and the Abhidharma, the definition of earth is solidity. Since it is taught to be supportive, in order to refute those, the two valid cognitions are presented.

original: gang gi phyir chu dang me dang rlung las logs shig nas zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chu dang me dang rlung las logs shig nas zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because apart from water, fire, and wind, there is nothing at all called “earth.”

original: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dag las sa'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu bkar te bstan par ni ji ltar yang mi nus la /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dag las sa'i mtshan nyid logs shig tu bkar te bstan par ni ji ltar yang mi nus la /
translated: But it is impossible to separate the characteristics of earth from the nature of the composite.

original: las kyi bye brag kyang de bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi bye brag kyang de bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the same is true of the distinctions of action. Therefore, they do not exist inherently.

original: de ltar dpyad pa na /🔽med kyang gal te de nyid du //
analyzed: de ltar dpyad pa na / med kyang gal te de nyid du //
translated: When analyzed in this way,🔽if you think that earth is the nature of solidity,

original: sa yi dngos nyid sra snyam na //
analyzed: sa yi dngos nyid sra snyam na //
translated: even though it does not exist,🔽then,

original: rnal 'byor pa dag de la ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag de la ni //
translated: for yogins,

original: 'byung dang 'bying ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'bying ba mi rigs so //
translated: it would not make sense for it to sink or float.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na yang de'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yod par sems na rnal 'byor pa dag sa la chu la bya ba bzhin du steng du 'byung ba dang 'og tu 'bying ba dag mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na yang de'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yod par sems na rnal 'byor pa dag sa la chu la bya ba bzhin du steng du 'byung ba dang 'og tu 'bying ba dag mi rigs so //
translated: If you think that even though it is essenceless, it has such characteristics, then, for yogins, it would not make sense for it to sink into the earth or float on water, just as it does not make sense for the earth to sink or float.

original: gal te bsam gtan gyi mthus sra ba nyid kyang gsher ba nyid du sgyur bar byed do zhe na /🔽bsam gtan pa yi bsam gtan mthus //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gyi mthus sra ba nyid kyang gsher ba nyid du sgyur bar byed do zhe na / bsam gtan pa yi bsam gtan mthus //
translated: But you might say that through the power of concentration, solidity itself is transformed into fluidity.

original: sa ni gsher ba nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: sa ni gsher ba nyid mi rigs //
translated: It would not make sense for the earth🔽to be fluid through the power of concentration of a meditator.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngo bo nyid la 'gyur med phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la 'gyur med phyir //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality is immutable.

original: yang na de nyid sra ma yin //
analyzed: yang na de nyid sra ma yin //
translated: Or, that intrinsic reality is not solid.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni byas pa ma yin pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin pas sus kyang nam yang gzhan du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni byas pa ma yin pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin pas sus kyang nam yang gzhan du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Intrinsic reality is said to be unfabricated and immutable. Therefore, no one can ever transform it into something else.

original: yang na gal te rnal 'byor pa dag gis sa'i sra ba nyid gzhan du bsgyur du rung na ni de'i ngo bo nyid sra ba yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bur rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na gal te rnal 'byor pa dag gis sa'i sra ba nyid gzhan du bsgyur du rung na ni de'i ngo bo nyid sra ba yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bur rung bar 'gyur /
translated: Or, if the yogis can transform the solidity of earth into something else, then how could it be tenable to say that its intrinsic reality is solidity?

original: de bzhin chu dang @62a * //
analyzed: de bzhin chu dang @62a * //
translated: Likewise, water,

original: me rlung dag / gsher la sogs pa'i dngos nyid min //
analyzed: me rlung dag / gsher la sogs pa'i dngos nyid min //
translated: fire, and wind do not have the intrinsic reality of fluidity and so on.🔽It is also illogical that they

original: de dag las kyang sdud pa dang // smin dang g-yo bar byed mi rigs //
analyzed: de dag las kyang sdud pa dang // smin dang g-yo bar byed mi rigs //
translated: comprise, ripen, and move.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: Water and so on also arise from the cause of the four great elements.

original: de dag thams cad la sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang yang ba nyid yod pas de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan par dka'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang yang ba nyid yod pas de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan par dka'o //
translated: Since all of them have solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility, it is difficult to establish their individual characteristics.

original: las kyang thams cad la cha mnyam par yod de kha cig la lhag par snang ba ni rnam par rmongs pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyang thams cad la cha mnyam par yod de kha cig la lhag par snang ba ni rnam par rmongs pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Also, action is present in all of them equally, but it appears to be predominant in some, and that is due to delusion.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi rdul phra rab kyang 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid de /🔽sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin pas de'i phyir gang gis so so la ngo bo nyid dang las rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa ni gang la
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi rdul phra rab kyang 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid de / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin pas de'i phyir gang gis so so la ngo bo nyid dang las rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig pa ni gang la
translated: Because their atoms are also composites,

original: ci yang med la /
analyzed: ci yang med la /
translated: since they are composites of eight substances: earth, water, fire, wind, form, smell, taste, and touch. Therefore, there is nothing that has only the characteristics that would establish its individual substance and action.

original: las 'ba' zhig pa yang gang la ci yang med do //
analyzed: las 'ba' zhig pa yang gang la ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that has only action.

original: de ltar yang dag par na de dag 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin bzhin du yang gal te ngo bo nyid yod par sems na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par na de dag 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin bzhin du yang gal te ngo bo nyid yod par sems na /
translated: Thus, although they are not by nature really existent, if you think that they exist by nature,

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gting dang pha rol gyi mu med pa'i chu la sa'i steng bzhin du rgyu ba dang / nags mes mched pa yang ba mo dang mu tig ltar bsil ba nyid du byed pa dang / brag gi rtse mo rnam par 'joms pa'i rnam par 'thor rlung dag kyang sor mo'i rtse mos mi g-yo bar byed pa dag ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gting dang pha rol gyi mu med pa'i chu la sa'i steng bzhin du rgyu ba dang / nags mes mched pa yang ba mo dang mu tig ltar bsil ba nyid du byed pa dang / brag gi rtse mo rnam par 'joms pa'i rnam par 'thor rlung dag kyang sor mo'i rtse mos mi g-yo bar byed pa dag ji ltar rung ste /
translated: how could it be tenable that yogis move on the water, which is without bottom or shore, as if it were the earth, that they make a forest fire cool as if it were a snow or pearl, and that they make the wind, which destroys the peaks of mountains, motionless with the tips of their fingers?

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they do not exist by nature.

original: las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And karma does not exist.

original: sdud pa ni gzungs byed pa'o ;
analyzed: sdud pa ni gzungs byed pa'o ;
translated: “To gather” means to hold.

original: / smin pa ni dro ba'o //
analyzed: / smin pa ni dro ba'o //
translated: “To ripen” means to heat.

original: g-yo ba ni 'gul ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni 'gul ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “To move” means to shake.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthu'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthu'i bye brag gis /
translated: “The minds of those who possess supernatural powers, through the power of concentration,

original: dngos po thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas rnams la gang du 'gro bar 'dod pa dag tu 'gro ba 'grub par zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas rnams la gang du 'gro bar 'dod pa dag tu 'gro ba 'grub par zad kyi /
translated: But it is only due to the existence of things that are impeded that one can go where one wishes.

original: dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to the nonexistence of things in every way.

original: gal te dngos po rnams med pa'i phyir thogs par mi 'gyur ba yin na ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa mnyam par bzhag pa las langs pa dang / srog chags gzhan dag @62b kyang rang gi gnas la sogs pa na gnas par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na thogs par yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin no /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams med pa'i phyir thogs par mi 'gyur ba yin na ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa mnyam par bzhag pa las langs pa dang / srog chags gzhan dag @62b kyang rang gi gnas la sogs pa na gnas par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na thogs par yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin no /
translated: If it were due to the nonexistence of things that one is not impeded, then even those who possess magical powers and those who have arisen from meditative equipoise, and other living beings, would not remain in their own abodes and so on. But since they are seen to be impeded, therefore things are not nonexistent in every way.

original: gal te 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
translated: If you imagine this,

original: rnal 'byor pa mnyam par bzhag pa las langs pa dag gi mos pa'i dbang gis na dngos po yod pa ma yin yang lus la thogs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mnyam par bzhag pa las langs pa dag gi mos pa'i dbang gis na dngos po yod pa ma yin yang lus la thogs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then even though things do not exist, the body of yogins and yoginīs who have arisen from meditative equipoise would be impeded by things due to the power of their aspirations.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mos pa'i mtshan ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mos pa'i mtshan ma ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not a sign of interest.

original: nam mkhar 'du shes pa mun pa la sogs pa'i nang du ka ba la sogs pa dag la thogs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / shel la sogs pa'i skyang nul dag la chur 'du shes pa yang log pa yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkhar 'du shes pa mun pa la sogs pa'i nang du ka ba la sogs pa dag la thogs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / shel la sogs pa'i skyang nul dag la chur 'du shes pa yang log pa yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Because when one has the discernment of space, one encounters obstacles such as darkness, and because the discernment of water in a crystal pavement is mistaken.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: mos pa yang gzhan la 'dod pa'i khyad par yang gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: mos pa yang gzhan la 'dod pa'i khyad par yang gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: Interest is one thing, and the specific desire of the mind is another.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i mos pas zad par nam mkha' la sogs pa dag la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa thams cad nam mkha' kho nar mos par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'ba' zhig la de ltar snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i mos pas zad par nam mkha' la sogs pa dag la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa thams cad nam mkha' kho nar mos par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'ba' zhig la de ltar snang bar zad kyi /
translated: Because the yogi’s interest is to imagine that everything—earth, water, fire, wind, and so on—in space and so on is space alone. That is all that appears to the yogi alone.

original: gzhan su la yang mi snang ba'i phyir dang / dngos po gzhan dag nam mkha' nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan su la yang mi snang ba'i phyir dang / dngos po gzhan dag nam mkha' nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not appear to anyone else, and other things do not become space.

original: 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis ni rnal 'byor pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sa yang gsher pa nyid du byed pa kho na yin gyi //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis ni rnal 'byor pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sa yang gsher pa nyid du byed pa kho na yin gyi //
translated: By the power of his supernormal knowledge, the yogin can transform earth into water.

original: mos pa tsam du ma zad de /🔽rtsig pa dang ra ba dang ri la sogs pa dag la thal byung du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / chu yang sra ba nyid du byed de /🔽chu la yang sa la bya ba bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'gro ba'i phyir dang / me yang bsil ba nyid du byed de sems can dmyal ba'i bsreg bya 'bar ba dag zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rlung gi g-yo ba yang thogs par byed de /
