analyzed: mos pa tsam du ma zad de / rtsig pa dang ra ba dang ri la sogs pa dag la thal byung du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir dang / chu yang sra ba nyid du byed de / chu la yang sa la bya ba bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'gro ba'i phyir dang / me yang bsil ba nyid du byed de sems can dmyal ba'i bsreg bya 'bar ba dag zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rlung gi g-yo ba yang thogs par byed de /
translated: This is not mere imagination.

original: rnam par 'thor rlung chen po la sogs pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag kyang sor mo gcig gis gnon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor rlung chen po la sogs pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag kyang sor mo gcig gis gnon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He can pass through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, without being obstructed, as if through space. He can walk on water without breaking through it, as if on earth. He can make fire cool, as when he extinguishes a great mass of fire by blowing on it. He can touch the sun and moon, so powerful are they, with his hand. He can travel in the Brahma world by the power of his body.

original: 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis kha cig tu ni bdag nyid kho na la thogs pa med par ston par yang byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis kha cig tu ni bdag nyid kho na la thogs pa med par ston par yang byed de /
translated: By the difference of desire, in some places he shows himself alone,

original: ri la sogs pa dag la bdag nyid lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / yo byad dag dang bcas bzhin du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽kha cig @63a * //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa dag la bdag nyid lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / yo byad dag dang bcas bzhin du thogs pa med par 'gro ba'i phyir ro // kha cig @63a * //
translated: because he goes without impediment, with his bowl, his robes, and his other belongings, on mountains, etc.

original: tu ni gzhan dag kho na ston te /
analyzed: tu ni gzhan dag kho na ston te /
translated: In some places he shows others,

original: dper na yi dags la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa sbyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yi dags la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa sbyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, when he gives water, etc. to hungry ghosts, etc.

original: kha cig tu ni rang dang gzhan gnyig ston te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni rang dang gzhan gnyig ston te /
translated: In some places he shows both himself and others,

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i me 'bar ba la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba'i me 'bar ba la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, when he pacifies the burning fire of the hells, etc.

original: de la gal te mos pa tsam kho nar zad na ni dngos po gzhan du mi 'gyur bas me'i gdung ba yang zhi bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gal te mos pa tsam kho nar zad na ni dngos po gzhan du mi 'gyur bas me'i gdung ba yang zhi bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were only a matter of his own aspiration, since the thing would not change, the burning fire would not be extinguished,🔽and the thirsty would not be satisfied.

original: skom pa yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: skom pa yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so.

original: shel la sogs pa'i skyang nul dag la chur 'du shes pa ni log pa yin pas dper mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shel la sogs pa'i skyang nul dag la chur 'du shes pa ni log pa yin pas dper mi rung ngo //
translated: The cognition of water in a polished crystal surface is mistaken, so it is not a suitable example.

original: zad par nam mkha' la sogs pa dag don dam pa nyid yin par gyur na yang sa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' la sogs pa dag don dam pa nyid yin par gyur na yang sa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
translated: Even if the totalities of space and so on are ultimate reality, it is not established that earth and so on exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: kha cig /'byung ba mkha' rlung me chu sa //
analyzed: kha cig /'byung ba mkha' rlung me chu sa //
translated: Some assert: The elements are space, wind, fire, water, and earth.

original: yon tan dag ni lhag pa yin //
analyzed: yon tan dag ni lhag pa yin //
translated: The qualities are the remaining ones.

original: sgra dang reg pa gzugs dang ro //
analyzed: sgra dang reg pa gzugs dang ro //
translated: Sound, touch, form, taste,

original: dri dang de yi yon tan yin //
analyzed: dri dang de yi yon tan yin //
translated: and smell are their qualities.

original: zhes bya bar 'dod pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'dod pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: To refute that, it is said:

original: rlung la sogs pa kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa kun rdzob tu //
translated: Wind and so on are not asserted

original: yon tan mnyam par mi 'dod min //
analyzed: yon tan mnyam par mi 'dod min //
translated: to be equal in terms of qualities conventionally.

original: lus kyi dbang pos dmigs phyir dang // 'byung ba yin phyir sa bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos dmigs phyir dang // 'byung ba yin phyir sa bzhin no // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are observed by the body faculty and because they are elements, like earth.

original: rlung la sogs pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang thams cad yon tan cha mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang thams cad yon tan cha mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Those elements such as wind and so on are not asserted to be equal in terms of all qualities even conventionally.

original: lus kyi dbang pos dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na sa bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na sa bzhin no //
translated: because it is perceived by the body faculty, and because it is an element, like earth.

original: nam mkha' nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not space,

original: 'byung ba nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽la la yon tan kha cig shas che ba yod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // la la yon tan kha cig shas che ba yod do //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is an element.🔽Some say that one element predominates in some places.

original: la la yon tan kha cig bag la zha ste /
analyzed: la la yon tan kha cig bag la zha ste /
translated: Some say that one element is latent in some places.

original: ha cang cha phra ba'i phyir nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: ha cang cha phra ba'i phyir nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: Because it is extremely subtle, it cannot be ascertained.

original: kha cig ni sa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni sa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin la /
translated: Some say that earth, etc., are collections of atoms.

original: rdzas su yod pa kho nar yang 'dod de /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa kho nar yang 'dod de /
translated: They assert that they exist substantially.

original: 'di ltar gang rdul phra rab tu bshig kyang de'i blo yod pa nyid yin pa de'i rdzas su yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang rdul phra rab tu bshig kyang de'i blo yod pa nyid yin pa de'i rdzas su yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: They say that whatever exists as an idea even when it is destroyed into atoms exists substantially.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not tenable,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: sa la sogs pa rdzas yod min //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rdzas yod min //
translated: Earth, etc., do not exist substantially,

original: tshogs pa'i yan lag min med phyir //🔽gang dag ji skad bstan pa de //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i yan lag min med phyir // gang dag ji skad bstan pa de //
translated: because they are not parts of a collection.🔽Those who see earth, etc.,

original: rdzas yod ma mthong nags tshal bzhin //
analyzed: rdzas yod ma mthong nags tshal bzhin //
translated: as taught here do not see substantial existence, like a forest.

original: zhes bya ba la sa la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sa la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Earth, etc., do not exist substantially,

original: chu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i yan lag ma @63b gtogs par sa zhes bya ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i yan lag ma @63b gtogs par sa zhes bya ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because earth, etc., are not perceived apart from the collection of water, etc.

original: gang tshogs pa'i yan lag ma bzung na gzung du med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa'i yan lag ma bzung na gzung du med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not perceived apart from the collection of parts does not exist substantially,

original: dper na nags tshal bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nags tshal bzhin no //
translated: like a forest.

original: shing dha ba dang seng ldeng dang / pa la sha la sogs pa ma gtogs par nags tshal zhes bya ba gzung du med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing dha ba dang seng ldeng dang / pa la sha la sogs pa ma gtogs par nags tshal zhes bya ba gzung du med pa bzhin no //
translated: A forest is not perceived apart from the trees, bamboo, etc.

original: 'dus pa la ni nags tshal zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus pa la ni nags tshal zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
translated: A forest is a conventional designation for a collection.

original: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi blo gros kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi blo gros kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since earth, etc., do not exist substantially, the intellect that has them as its object does not exist substantially,

original: rgyu yod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i phyir nags tshal gyi blo bzhin pas de'i phyir ;
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i phyir nags tshal gyi blo bzhin pas de'i phyir ;
translated: because its cause exists and because it perishes, like the intellect of a forest.

original: sa la sogs pa yul gyi blo //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa yul gyi blo //
translated: Therefore, the intellect that has earth, etc., as its object

original: de yang rdzas yod ma yin 'dod //
analyzed: de yang rdzas yod ma yin 'dod //
translated: But we do not accept that they exist substantially.

original: rgyu dang bcas phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they have causes and because they perish,

original: nags tshal la sogs blo bzhin no //
analyzed: nags tshal la sogs blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of a forest, etc.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang / rtsol ba dag las mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir gang gis sa la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra de yang /
analyzed: sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang / rtsol ba dag las mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir gang gis sa la sogs pa brjod pa'i sgra de yang /
translated: Sound is produced from a substratum, an agent, and an effort. Therefore, the sound that expresses earth, etc.,

original: sa la sogs pa ston pa'i sgra //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ston pa'i sgra //
translated: The sound that reveals earth, etc.,

original: brjod pa rdzas su mi 'dod de //🔽mnyan pa yin phyir dmag la sogs //
analyzed: brjod pa rdzas su mi 'dod de // mnyan pa yin phyir dmag la sogs //
translated: is not accepted as a substance.🔽Like the sound that reveals an army, etc.,

original: ston pa'i sgra dag mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: ston pa'i sgra dag mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: is not accepted as a substance.

original: 'dir bye brag pa dag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag pa dag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here the Vaiśeṣika objects:

original: gang dag la nags tshal dang dmag la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de dag la skyon 'di lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag la nags tshal dang dmag la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de dag la skyon 'di lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: This fault would apply to those for whom a forest, an army, etc. do not substantially exist.

original: kho bo cag gi tshig las phrad pa rnams kyi rdzas zhes 'byung bas nags tshal la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi tshig las phrad pa rnams kyi rdzas zhes 'byung bas nags tshal la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But since the word “substance” occurs in our statement “the conjunction of substances,” forests, etc. certainly exist substantially.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di na shing pa la sha nags tshal rtsom pa ni phrad pa dang bcas pas shing pan da na dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ro //🔽shing pa la sha dang pan dan gnyis kyang phrad pa dang bcas pas shing dha ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na shing pa la sha nags tshal rtsom pa ni phrad pa dang bcas pas shing pan da na dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ro // shing pa la sha dang pan dan gnyis kyang phrad pa dang bcas pas shing dha ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the army of elephants is formed, it is connected with the army of horses because it is connected with them.

original: de bzhin du glang po che dmag rtsom pa na yang phrad pa dang bcas pas rta dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ba glang po che dang rta gnyis dang phrad pa dang bcas pas shing rta la sogs pa dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir nags
analyzed: de bzhin du glang po che dmag rtsom pa na yang phrad pa dang bcas pas rta dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur ba glang po che dang rta gnyis dang phrad pa dang bcas pas shing rta la sogs pa dang lhan cig sbyor bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir nags
translated: And the two, the army of elephants and the army of horses, are connected with the army of chariots and so on because they are connected with them.

original: tshal dang dmag la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe la bsgrub par bya bas stong pas dpe med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshal dang dmag la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe la bsgrub par bya bas stong pas dpe med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the forest and the army and so on exist as substances, your example is empty of the probandum.

original: grangs can dag kyang 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: grangs can dag kyang 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas also say this:

original: grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Number is twofold:

original: nges @64a * //
analyzed: nges @64a * //
translated: definite🔽and indefinite.

original: pa'i grangs ni gcig bu pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i grangs ni gcig bu pa'o //
translated: The number one is a single unit.

original: ma nges pa'i grangs ni nyi shu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i grangs ni nyi shu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The number twenty and so on are indefinite numbers.

original: de la gang gi tshe ma nges pa rdzas du ma dag la nges pa'i grangs su 'jug pa de'i tshe na nags tshal la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod pas /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe ma nges pa rdzas du ma dag la nges pa'i grangs su 'jug pa de'i tshe na nags tshal la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod pas /
translated: When indefinite numbers are applied to many substances, then the expressions forest and so on are used.

original: nags tshal la sogs pa de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: nags tshal la sogs pa de dag kyang rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, forests and so on exist as substances,

original: grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i yul can gyi blo dang sgra yang rdzas su yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // de'i yul can gyi blo dang sgra yang rdzas su yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: because they possess number.🔽The cognition and words that apprehend them exist as substances.

original: nags tshal gyi blo dang sgra'i dpe dag sa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nags tshal gyi blo dang sgra'i dpe dag sa la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i dper mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the examples of the cognition and words of forest are not suitable as examples of that which does not exist as a substance, such as earth and so on.

original: de la re zhig bye brag pa dag la skyon 'dogs pa ltar snang ba nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽pa la sha pan dha la sogs pa //
analyzed: de la re zhig bye brag pa dag la skyon 'dogs pa ltar snang ba nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir / pa la sha pan dha la sogs pa //
translated: To demonstrate that the fault imputed to the Vaiśeṣikas is only apparent, he says:🔽The author of the forest is not accepted

original: nags tshal rtsom pa yin mi 'dod //
analyzed: nags tshal rtsom pa yin mi 'dod //
translated: to be the creator of the parts, such as the śāla tree.

original: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: The reason, such as possessing a cause,

original: dper na rtsa ba la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba la sogs bzhin //
translated: It is like a root, etc.🔽

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the root, etc.

original: shing pa la sha dang pan dha la sogs pa dag ni nags tshal rtsom pa yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: shing pa la sha dang pan dha la sogs pa dag ni nags tshal rtsom pa yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: The root, etc. are not asserted to be the beginning of the forest.

original: ji ltar pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal gyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal gyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: Just as the palasha tree, etc. are limbs of the forest,

original: de dag gi yan lag ni rtsa ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi yan lag ni rtsa ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: their limbs are the root, etc.

original: yan lag nyid yin par 'dra bzhin pa las pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yan lag nyid yin par 'dra bzhin pa las pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa yin la /
translated: Although they are similar in being limbs, the palasha tree, etc. are the beginning of the forest,

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ci yod /
translated: but the root, etc. are not. What is the difference in reason?

original: de'i phyir pa la sha dang pan dha la sogs pa de dag ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir pa la sha dang pan dha la sogs pa de dag ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those palasha trees, etc. are not the beginning of the forest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
translated: Because they possess a cause, etc. are reasons.

original: dper na rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang lo ma dad 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang lo ma dad 'dab ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the root, trunk, branches, leaves, and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: shing dha ba dang / pa la sha la sogs pa yan lag tu gyur pa thams cad la nags tshal yan lag can so so'i rjes su zhugs pa ltar nges par gzung du rung ste /
analyzed: shing dha ba dang / pa la sha la sogs pa yan lag tu gyur pa thams cad la nags tshal yan lag can so so'i rjes su zhugs pa ltar nges par gzung du rung ste /
translated: Just as the forest is the possessor of branches, and so on, it is suitable to apprehend all that are branches, such as the dhava, palasha, and so on, as the forest.

original: yan lag de dag med par yan lag can nags tshal dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yan lag de dag med par yan lag can nags tshal dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because without those branches, the forest, the possessor of branches, is not observed.

original: de'i phyir pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir pa la sha la sogs pa ni nags tshal rtsom par byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore the palasha, and so on, are the initiators of the forest,

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //🔽bshad pa / yan lag can gyi nags tshal ni //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no // bshad pa / yan lag can gyi nags tshal ni //
translated: but the root, and so on, are not.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: pa la sha la sogs brtsams min //
analyzed: pa la sha la sogs brtsams min //
translated: The forest is not initiated by the palasha, and so on,

original: de dag re rer ma rdzogs phyir //
analyzed: de dag re rer ma rdzogs phyir //
translated: because they are not complete in each individual,

original: yal ga la sogs gang yin bzhin //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs gang yin bzhin //
translated: just like the branches, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la yan @64b lag can zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag yod pa'i phyir yan lag can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yan @64b lag can zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag yod pa'i phyir yan lag can no //
translated: Here “possessor of branches” is a possessor of branches because it has branches.

original: yan lag can gyi nags tshal zhes bya ba de ni pa la sha la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi nags tshal zhes bya ba de ni pa la sha la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
translated: The so-called forest, which has parts, is not produced by the palasha tree, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: pa la sha la sogs pa de dag re re la nags tshal de ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa la sha la sogs pa de dag re re la nags tshal de ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the forest is not complete in each of those palasha trees, etc.

original: dper na yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la nags tshal zhes bya ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la nags tshal zhes bya ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the so-called forest is not complete in each of the branches, twigs, etc.

original: nags tshal de yal ga la sogs pa de dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du pa la sha la sogs pa de dag re re la yang nags tshal zhes bya ba de ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nags tshal de yal ga la sogs pa de dag gis brtsams pa ma yin pa de bzhin du pa la sha la sogs pa de dag re re la yang nags tshal zhes bya ba de ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the forest is not produced by those branches, etc. Likewise, the so-called forest is not complete in each of those palasha trees, etc.

original: de de dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par grub pas nags tshal la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de de dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par grub pas nags tshal la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is not produced by those. Thus forests, etc. do not substantially exist.

original: de'i phyir bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la dpe'i skyon yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la dpe'i skyon yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the example is also untenable in the Vaiśeṣika position.

original: gnyis pa grangs can gyi phyogs la ji ltar dpe'i skyon med pa de de ltar 'di brjod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa grangs can gyi phyogs la ji ltar dpe'i skyon med pa de de ltar 'di brjod de /
translated: The second, how the fault of the example does not apply to the Sāṃkhya position, is stated as follows.

original: nags tshal sgra ni ma nges pa //
analyzed: nags tshal sgra ni ma nges pa //
translated: The word “forest” is not indefinite,

original: du ma'i rdzas grangs 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: du ma'i rdzas grangs 'jug pa yin //
translated: because it is used for the number of many substances.

original: khyad par can gyi blos brtag phyir //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blos brtag phyir //
translated: Because it is imagined by a mind that has distinctions,

original: bum bzangs la sogs sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: bum bzangs la sogs sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the words “good pot” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la nags tshal gyi sgra ni pa la sha la sogs pa ma nges pa du ma'i rdzas kyi grangs brjod pa la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nags tshal gyi sgra ni pa la sha la sogs pa ma nges pa du ma'i rdzas kyi grangs brjod pa la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
translated: The word “forest” is not used to express the number of many indefinite substances such as palāśa trees, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par can gyi blos brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blos brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is imagined by a mind that has distinctions. The reason is understood.

original: dper na bum pa dang / zangs dang / phru tog la sogs pa gcig la sogs par nges par grangs la 'jug pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang / zangs dang / phru tog la sogs pa gcig la sogs par nges par grangs la 'jug pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the words “good pot,” “good copper,” “good fruit,” and so on, which are used for a number that is definite as one and so on.

original: de ltar re zhig rigs pa'i sgo nas sa la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rigs pa'i sgo nas sa la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin par gnas so //
translated: Thus, for the time being, earth and so on are established as not having characteristics and not existing substantially by way of reasoning.

original: lung gi sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi sa'i khams gang yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gnyis su med pa'i don dang / gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa dang /
analyzed: lung gi sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi sa'i khams gang yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas gnyis su med pa'i don dang / gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa dang /
translated: Also, from the perspective of scripture, the Bhagavān said, “The internal earth element and the external earth element are nondual in meaning by the Tathāgata, nondual, not dual,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: and🔽are fully, completely awakened to as having a single characteristic, which is no characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bka' stsal cing /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bka' stsal cing /
translated: He is fully enlightened into the single characteristic that is devoid of characteristics.🔽

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: blo yis rnam par dpyad pa na //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par dpyad pa na //
translated: When analyzed by the mind,

original: gang phyir dngos nyid gzung med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos nyid gzung med pa //
translated: because entities are not apprehended,

original: de phyir dbyung ba med pa dang // dngos nyid med par nga smra'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir dbyung ba med pa dang // dngos nyid med par nga smra'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore I say they are not emitted and do not exist.

original: 'dir chos @65a * //
analyzed: 'dir chos @65a * //
translated: Here, the Abhidharma

original: mngon pa bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: mngon pa bdag gis smras pa /
translated: says:

original: 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bye brag rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The specific elements do exist by intrinsic reality.

original: de dag rgyur byas nas kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam pa nyi shu 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag rgyur byas nas kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam pa nyi shu 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the form that is the nature of color and shape arises in twenty different ways, taking those as its cause.

original: 'di na gang ngo bo nyid med pa ni de rgyur byas nas ci yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang ngo bo nyid med pa ni de rgyur byas nas ci yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Here, whatever is devoid of intrinsic reality does not arise in any way, taking that as its cause.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa las ni kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang mig gis gzung bar bya ba dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa las ni kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang mig gis gzung bar bya ba dag 'byung ste /
translated: But form that is the nature of color and shape arises, taking the elements as its cause, and is apprehended by the eye.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the elements do exist by intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas kun nas bslang ba de yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas kun nas bslang ba de yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The form base exists conventionally, being generated by the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de yang byis pa rnams ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa la lta ba bzhin du lta ba rnam par rmongs la /
analyzed: de yang byis pa rnams ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa la lta ba bzhin du lta ba rnam par rmongs la /
translated: Further, childish beings are confused about their views, like those who view illusions, mirages, and cities of gandharvas.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni de lta ma yin te /🔽gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa sgom pa la gnas pa dag kyang re zhig gzugs kyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni de lta ma yin te / gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa sgom pa la gnas pa dag kyang re zhig gzugs kyi 'du shes dang /
translated: Aryas are not like that.🔽Because mundane yogis who abide in the cultivation of the meditative attainment of infinite space, infinite consciousness, and the base of nothingness, for a while, all aspects of the discernment of form and the discernment of obstruction subside.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du nub cing de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag bsgom pa goms par 'jug tu yang gzugs kyi 'du shes spong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du nub cing de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag bsgom pa goms par 'jug tu yang gzugs kyi 'du shes spong bar 'gyur na /
translated: Similarly, if those who cultivate the eight liberations, the bases of subjugation, and the bases of totality abandon the discernment of form,

original: theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bskal pa dpag tu med par dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du bsgoms pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa mthar phyin pa la gnas pa rnams gzugs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i rnal 'byor pa bskal pa dpag tu med par dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du bsgoms pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa mthar phyin pa la gnas pa rnams gzugs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention that yogins of the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, who have cultivated emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness for immeasurable eons, and who abide in the perfection of cultivation of the intrinsic nature of entities, would apprehend form?

original: de rigs pa ma yin pas de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de rigs pa ma yin pas de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since that is illogical, it is explained:

original: gang phyir gzugs ni don dam du //
analyzed: gang phyir gzugs ni don dam du //
translated: Because form is not ultimately

original: mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba min //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba min //
translated: The object of the eye sense faculty.

original: bsags phyir dper na sgra bzhin dang // 'byung las gyur phyir de nyid bzhin //
analyzed: bsags phyir dper na sgra bzhin dang // 'byung las gyur phyir de nyid bzhin //
translated: Because it is a composite, like sound, and because it is derived, like the elements.

original: zhes bya ba la mig gi yul gyi gzugs ni don dam par na mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mig gi yul gyi gzugs ni don dam par na mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba ma yin no zhes dam bca'o //
translated: The thesis is: Form, the object of the eye sense faculty, is not ultimately the object of the eye sense faculty.

original: mig ces bya ba ni blta ba'i phyir mig ste /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba ni blta ba'i phyir mig ste /
translated: The eye is so called because it sees.

original: don rnams gsal bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don rnams gsal bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that which clearly apprehends objects.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa 'di las rang gi yul bye brag tu 'byed pa'i sgo nas @65b dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa 'di las rang gi yul bye brag tu 'byed pa'i sgo nas @65b dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty is so called because it exercises controlling power over the specific object, since it is distinguished from the other faculties.

original: gzugs ni des gzung zhing brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni des gzung zhing brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Form is not the object of the eye,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is aggregated.

original: rdzas brgyad bsags pa'i phyir te dper na sgra bzhin ne zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas brgyad bsags pa'i phyir te dper na sgra bzhin ne zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: yang na 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir dper na sgra de nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir dper na sgra de nyid bzhin te /
translated: Or, because it is derived from the elements, like sound.

original: gzugs dang sgra gnyi ga bsags pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid yin par 'dra bzhin du gzugs ni mig gi yul yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra gnyi ga bsags pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid yin par 'dra bzhin du gzugs ni mig gi yul yin la /
translated: Although both form and sound are similar in being aggregated and derived from the elements, form is the object of the eye but sound is not.

original: sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is because there is no difference in the reason.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na /
translated: Again, in another enumeration:

original: gzugs ni mig gis gzung min te //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gis gzung min te //
translated: Form is not apprehended by the eye,

original: 'byung las gyur phyir rang gzugs bzhin //
analyzed: 'byung las gyur phyir rang gzugs bzhin //
translated: because it is derived from the elements, like its own form.

original: bde la sogs 'byung rgyu phyir dang // brjod bya yin phyir ro sogs bzhin //
analyzed: bde la sogs 'byung rgyu phyir dang // brjod bya yin phyir ro sogs bzhin //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, etc., and because it is the object of expression, like, etc.

original: gzugs ni mig gis gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gis gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, form is not apprehended by the eye.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir rang gi gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽khyed kyi lung las gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir rang gi gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te / khyed kyi lung las gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: The reason is because it is derived from the elements, like one’s own form.🔽In your scriptures, it is said that whatever form there is, all of that is the object of the eye.

original: de thams cad mig gi yul yin no zhes bya ba de yang rang gi gzugs dang gzhan gyi gzugs kyi bye brag las rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de thams cad mig gi yul yin no zhes bya ba de yang rang gi gzugs dang gzhan gyi gzugs kyi bye brag las rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: That is divided into two types based on the distinction between one’s own form and the form of another.

original: de la 'dir ni gzhan gyi gzugs chos can nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dir ni gzhan gyi gzugs chos can nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the form of another is taken as the subject.

original: de mig gis gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de mig gis gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
translated: It is not apprehended by the eye is its property.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because it is derived from the elements, etc., is the reason.

original: rang gi gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: rang gi gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /

original: 'di ltar mig gi rang gi gzugs ni autpala'i 'dab ma ltar sngo ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rang gi gzugs ni autpala'i 'dab ma ltar sngo ba /

analyzed: 'bras bu cung zad bkra ba / rdzi ma bung ba'i tshogs ltar gnag cing mdzes pas bkab pa /

original: mig sman gyi rdul mdzes pas mdog bsgyur ba ste ;
analyzed: mig sman gyi rdul mdzes pas mdog bsgyur ba ste ;
translated: The pollen is beautiful like the dust of collyrium.

original: de lta bu'i mig gi gzugs kyang mig nyid kyis gzung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mig gi gzugs kyang mig nyid kyis gzung ba ma yin pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi gzugs kyang mig des gzung ba ma yin no /

analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, etc., and because it is an object of expression, it is like taste, etc.

original: de ltar gzugs yul gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pas de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs yul gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pas de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because form does not exist as a real entity of the object, since it does not exist,

original: mig kyang yul can nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mig kyang yul can nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: the eye also does not exist as the subject.

original: de dag gi sgra yang de dag brjod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi sgra yang de dag brjod pa nyid ma yin no //

original: de dag rgyur byas nas gzugs 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs te don ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag rgyur byas nas gzugs 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs te don ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason “because form arises in dependence on them” is shown to be unproven.

original: de bzhin gzugs @66a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs @66a * //
translated: Likewise, form🔽

original: ni 'byung 'gyur min //
analyzed: ni 'byung 'gyur min //
translated: So too, form is not derived from the elements.

original: 'byung phyir me la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'byung phyir me la sogs pa bzhin //

original: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //

original: yang na sems bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: yang na sems bzhin shes par bya //

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Form is not derived from the elements,

original: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir me la sogs pa bzhin te 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba rnams las mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir me la sogs pa bzhin te 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba rnams las mngon par grub pa'o //

translated: And that is not the intrinsic nature of the derivative form, like the elements, by the reasonings of having a cause, etc.,

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'byung ba rnams ma gtogs par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dmigs su med de /

analyzed: 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dag kho na bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dag kho na bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: Therefore, like the elements, the nature of this derivative form also does not substantially exist.🔽The defining characteristics of form are imagined to be of various types,

original: des ni kha dog dbyibs dang ni //
analyzed: des ni kha dog dbyibs dang ni //
translated: such as color, shape,

analyzed: bsags dang phra dang rags sogs kyi ; / dbye bas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dag / ji snyed rnam par brtags pa rnams // zhes bya ba la /

original: kha dog gi gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha dog gi gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //

analyzed: dbyibs kyi gzugs ni rnam pa brgyad de thung ngu dang / ring po dang / lham pa dang / gru bzhi dang ; mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba'i bye brag gis so //

analyzed: bsags pa ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa dag gis bsags pa'o //

original: rags pa ni ri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa ni ri la sogs pa'o //

translated: Likewise, the other characteristics of the form of the atom, as distinguished by the distinctions of far and near, of god and human, of bad and good, etc.,🔽are to be understood as refuted

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: de bzhin gzugs ni kha dog min ;
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs ni kha dog min ;
translated: Form is not color,

original: /'byung phyir me la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: /'byung phyir me la sogs pa bzhin //

original: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: rgyu ldan la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //

original: yang na sems bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: yang na sems bzhin shes par bya //

analyzed: zhes ji ltar rigs pa'i sbyor bas bkag pa khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg / dgag pa'i tshul yang de yin no //
translated: are to be refuted in the same way.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sgra ni rnam pa gsum ste @66b zin pa dang / ma zin pa dang gnyi ga'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //

original: dri yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dri yang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri mi mnyam pa'i bye brag las so //

original: ro ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: ro ni rnam pa drug ste /

analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / kha ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / bska ba zhes bya ba'o //

original: reg pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /

analyzed: lci ba dang / yang ba dang / grang ba dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi bye brag las so //

original: de dag dgag pa'i tshul yang de yin te /
analyzed: de dag dgag pa'i tshul yang de yin te /

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽gang phyir sgra ni don dam du //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / gang phyir sgra ni don dam du //

original: rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba min ;
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba min ;
translated: the object of the ear sense faculty.

original: / bsags phyir dper na gzugs bzhin dang // 'byung las gyur phyir de nyid bzhin //🔽zhes ji ltar rigs pa'i sbyor ba des bkag par khong du chud par bya'o /
analyzed: / bsags phyir dper na gzugs bzhin dang // 'byung las gyur phyir de nyid bzhin // zhes ji ltar rigs pa'i sbyor ba des bkag par khong du chud par bya'o /
translated: Because it is accumulated, like form; because it is derived from the elements, like the elements themselves.

analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba // bam po bzhi pa // 'dir smras pa /
translated: One should understand that this refutes them by the appropriate application of the above arguments.

original: gzugs ni mig gi yul kho na yin te ;
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gi yul kho na yin te ;
translated: Here someone might argue as follows: Form is the object of the eye alone,

original: byed pa po dang las kyi tha snyad yod pa'i phyir dper na ral gris bcad pa gcod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las kyi tha snyad yod pa'i phyir dper na ral gris bcad pa gcod pa bzhin no //
translated: because the conventions of agent and action are applicable to it, just as cutting is the action of the knife.

original: mig la yang byed pa po'i tha snyad yod de /
analyzed: mig la yang byed pa po'i tha snyad yod de /
translated: The eye is also conventionally accepted as the agent,

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the eye sees forms.

original: de'i blta bar bya ba gzugs ni las yin no //
analyzed: de'i blta bar bya ba gzugs ni las yin no //
translated: And the object of its seeing is form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs ni mig gis blta bar bya ba kho na yin pas de yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ni mig gis blta bar bya ba kho na yin pas de yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since form is the object of the eye’s seeing, it exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: gal te mig byed pa po nyid yin par 'thad na ni gzugs kyang las yin par 'gyur grang na //
translated: If it is tenable that the eye is the agent, then form would be the object.

original: de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: ji ltar mi mthad ce na /🔽mig gi dbang po don dam du //
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthad ce na / mig gi dbang po don dam du //
translated: How is it not tenable?🔽The eye sense faculty is not ultimately

original: gzugs la blta ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs la blta ba ma yin te //
translated: The seer of form,

original: sems dang sems byung las gzhan phyir ;
analyzed: sems dang sems byung las gzhan phyir ;
translated: Because it is different from mind and mental factors,

original: / dper na ri yi dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: / dper na ri yi dbang po bzhin //
translated: Like the king of mountains.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: gal te mig de la blta ba'i mthu yod par gyur na ni gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang shi ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag dang / mun khung dang dus thams cad du yang thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If the eye has the power to see, then in the states of sleep, intoxication, death, and so on, and in the dark, it would see everything at all times.

original: gal te mi mthong na ni de la blta ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshad ma rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: gal te mi mthong na ni de la blta ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshad ma rnam par bzhag go //
translated: If it does not see, then it does not see. Thus the valid cognition is established.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhe na ni /
translated: If it is said that consciousness sees,

original: dmus long gis kyang gzugs mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmus long gis kyang gzugs mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that even a blind person would see forms.

original: gal te mig ma nyams pas yid kyis mthong ngo zhe na ni de lta na mig byed pa po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te @67a * //
analyzed: gal te mig ma nyams pas yid kyis mthong ngo zhe na ni de lta na mig byed pa po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro // gal te @67a * //
translated: If you say that the eye sees by means of the mental faculty when the eye is not impaired, then in that case the eye would not be the agent.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis mthong ngo zhe na de ni kun rdzob tu kun kyang 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis mthong ngo zhe na de ni kun rdzob tu kun kyang 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: If you say that the eye sees when it is associated with consciousness, that is accepted in the conventional sense, but

original: de la yang mig 'ba' zhig byed pa po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yang mig 'ba' zhig byed pa po ma yin gyi /
translated: in that case, the eye alone is not the agent.

original: mthong ba ni gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa tshogs pa la rag lus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba ni gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa tshogs pa la rag lus pa'i phyir /

original: des na mig 'ba' zhig byed pa po nyid yin par bstan dka'o //
analyzed: des na mig 'ba' zhig byed pa po nyid yin par bstan dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to show that the eye alone is the agent.

original: de ltar byed pa po med pa'i phyir las kyang ga la yod pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po med pa'i phyir las kyang ga la yod pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no agent in that way, how can there be an action? Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gang dag tshogs pa las blta ba'i bya ba skye bas de dag thams cad la blta ba'i nus pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag tshogs pa las blta ba'i bya ba skye bas de dag thams cad la blta ba'i nus pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since the action of seeing arises from the assembly, all of them do not have the ability to see.

original: de'i phyir blta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod pa de dag gi phyir rab tu bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir blta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod pa de dag gi phyir rab tu bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, the eye that generates the action of seeing sees.🔽

original: yang na mig ni don dam du //
analyzed: yang na mig ni don dam du //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The eye sees, since the action of seeing arises in the eye” is made for the sake of those who believe that.🔽The verse is stated to refute that.

original: gzugs la blta ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs la blta ba ma yin te //
translated: The eye does not ultimately see visible form,

original: rnam shes dngos med mi skye'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam shes dngos med mi skye'i phyir //
translated: because consciousness does not arise without an entity,

original: pags pa dag la sogs pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa med par blta ba'i bya ba /
analyzed: pags pa dag la sogs pa bzhin // zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa med par blta ba'i bya ba /
translated: like skin and so on.

original: mi skye ba'i phyir mig gis kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i phyir mig gis kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: Since the action of seeing does not arise without consciousness, the eye does not see.🔽The Abhidharma states that the eye sense faculty is like a jasmine flower or like yogurt, and its object is the visible form of color and shape.

original: chos mngon pa las mig gi dbang po ni go snyod kyi me tog lta bu 'am zhog chu lta bu yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa de ni kho bo cag kyang kun rdzob tu 'dod do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las mig gi dbang po ni go snyod kyi me tog lta bu 'am zhog chu lta bu yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa de ni kho bo cag kyang kun rdzob tu 'dod do //
translated: We also assert that conventionally.

original: don dam par ni mig gi dbang po yul gyi kha dog gzugs dang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni mig gi dbang po yul gyi kha dog gzugs dang ba ma yin te /
translated: But ultimately the eye sense faculty is not the clear form of color and shape that is its object.

original: byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis dpe yang pags pa dag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis dpe yang pags pa dag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is produced, etc. The example is like skin, etc.

original: de'i yul kha dog dgag pa byed pa ni //
analyzed: de'i yul kha dog dgag pa byed pa ni //
translated: The refutation of the object of that eye sense faculty is stated:

original: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can min //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can min //
translated: The eye is not the sense faculty of form.

original: rang gi gzugs la mi 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs la mi 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because it does not apprehend its own form,🔽like the sense faculties of hearing, etc.,

original: nyan la sogs pa'i dbang po dang // gzugs can yin phyir ro sogs bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyan la sogs pa'i dbang po dang // gzugs can yin phyir ro sogs bzhin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: because it has form, etc.

original: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can min //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can min //
translated: The eye is not the sense faculty of form.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang la yul gzugs yod pa de ni gzugs kyi yul can zhes bya ste /🔽mig ni gzugs kyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang la yul gzugs yod pa de ni gzugs kyi yul can zhes bya ste / mig ni gzugs kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: That which has form as its object is called the sense faculty of form.

original: rang gi gzugs la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa bzhin nam //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa bzhin nam //
translated: The eye is not the sense faculty of form because it does not apprehend its own form, like the sense faculties of hearing, etc.,

original: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: or because it has form, etc.

original: gzugs ni re zhig rang gi gzugs dang gzhan gyi gzugs zhes bya ba de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gzugs ni re zhig rang gi gzugs dang gzhan gyi gzugs zhes bya ba de tsam du zad de /
translated: Form is simply called one’s own form and the form of others.

original: de la re zhig mig des rang gi gzugs mi mthong ba ni grags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig mig des rang gi gzugs mi mthong ba ni grags pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is well known that the eye does not see itself.

original: gzhan gyi gzugs kyang ri dang ra ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa tshu rol @67b lam ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzugs kyang ri dang ra ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa tshu rol @67b lam ;
translated: Nor does it see other forms, such as those that are obscured by walls, etc.

original: dbus sam pha rol gyi chos bcad pa'i phyogs gcig grong khyer la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba ni 'dis mthong ngo zhes nye bar 'dogs pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dbus sam pha rol gyi chos bcad pa'i phyogs gcig grong khyer la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba ni 'dis mthong ngo zhes nye bar 'dogs pa tsam du zad de /
translated: It sees only those forms that are in the vicinity, such as those in the middle or on the other side of a wall, etc., just as one sees a city, etc., that is partially obscured.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa tsam gyi mthong ba ni don dam par dpyad pa la tshad mar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa tsam gyi mthong ba ni don dam par dpyad pa la tshad mar mi rung ngo //
translated: But seeing that is merely imputed in this way is not valid in the ultimate analysis.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān also said:

original: mig ni gzugs la mi lta zhing //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la mi lta zhing //
translated: The eye does not see form,

original: yid kyis chos nyid mi rtogs te //
analyzed: yid kyis chos nyid mi rtogs te //
translated: and the mind does not cognize phenomena.

original: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
translated: That which the world does not engage with

original: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the highest truth.

original: 'dir grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here, the Sāṃkhyas and Vaiśeṣikas say:

original: 'dis mthong ngo zhes lta ba'i byed pa la 'dis zhes bya bar brjod pas lta ba'i byed pa mig gis lta ba pos mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dis mthong ngo zhes lta ba'i byed pa la 'dis zhes bya bar brjod pas lta ba'i byed pa mig gis lta ba pos mthong ste /
translated: “This sees” refers to the action of seeing. Therefore, the action of seeing is seeing by the seer, the eye.

original: dper na sta res gcod do zhes bya ba yang sta re 'ba' zhig gis gcod par mi byed de /
analyzed: dper na sta res gcod do zhes bya ba yang sta re 'ba' zhig gis gcod par mi byed de /
translated: For example, “an axe cuts” does not mean that the axe alone performs the action of cutting.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what does it mean?🔽The axe does not cut what is to be cut, but the person wielding the axe cuts the tree.

original: byed pa sta res bcad pa po mi gcod pa shing gcod pa de bzhin du mi 'ba' zhig gis mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa sta res bcad pa po mi gcod pa shing gcod pa de bzhin du mi 'ba' zhig gis mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, a person alone does not see.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what does it mean?

original: byed pa mig gis lta ba po mis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa mig gis lta ba po mis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed do zhe na /
translated: The eye does not see what is to be seen, but the person who possesses the eye sees visible form.

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain this, the root text says:

original: de bzhin lta po mig med pa //
analyzed: de bzhin lta po mig med pa //
translated: Likewise, without an eye, the seer

original: dpe yang med pas mthong ma yin //
analyzed: dpe yang med pas mthong ma yin //
translated: is not seen, even in the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig gis mthong ba bkag pa de bzhin du lta ba pos mthong ba yang dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig gis mthong ba bkag pa de bzhin du lta ba pos mthong ba yang dgag par bya ste /
translated: Just as seeing by the eye is refuted, so too seeing by the seer should be refuted.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di na gzugs mthong ba las rjes su dpags nas lta ba po zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di na gzugs mthong ba las rjes su dpags nas lta ba po zhes bya na /
translated: Here, having seen visible form, one infers the existence of the seer.

original: gzugs mthong ba de yang mig dang / gzugs dang / nam mkha' dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dag tshogs na yod par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba de yang mig dang / gzugs dang / nam mkha' dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dag tshogs na yod par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: Seeing form also exists when the eye, form, space, light, and attention are assembled.

original: de'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba lta bu tshogs pa nyid la lta ba po zhes bya bar rigs kyi gzhan mig med pa bum pa la sogs pa lta bu /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba lta bu tshogs pa nyid la lta ba po zhes bya bar rigs kyi gzhan mig med pa bum pa la sogs pa lta bu /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the mere assembly is the seer, as in the case of Devadatta, but not the other, which is without eyes, like a pot, etc.

original: dper na mig kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i dpe yang med pas mthong bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dper na mig kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i dpe yang med pas mthong bar mi rigs so //
translated: For example, the eye is not seen, and there is no example of seeing. Therefore, it is unreasonable to say that it sees.

original: lta ba po mig med pa de yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin te //
analyzed: lta ba po mig med pa de yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin te //
translated: Moreover, that seer without eyes is either the same entity as the seer,

original: dper na grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: dper na grangs can dag na re /
translated: for example, as the Sāṃkhyas say:

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid de /🔽yongs su lta bar byed pa po zhes zer ba la sogs pa lta bu zhig gam /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid de / yongs su lta bar byed pa po zhes zer ba la sogs pa lta bu zhig gam /
translated: The existence of consciousness is the nature of the person.🔽It is the one who sees.

original: 'on te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhig yin te /
translated: Or it is not the nature of the seer,

original: dper na bye brag pa dag na re /
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa dag na re /
translated: for example, as the Vaiśeṣikas say:

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni yid tsam du zad la /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni yid tsam du zad la /
translated: The existence of consciousness is merely the mind.

original: skyes bu ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar thams cad du song ba sems pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar thams cad du song ba sems pa med pa yin te /
translated: A person is like space, omnipresent, and without thought.

original: de yid dang phrad pas lta bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de yid dang phrad pas lta bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin grang na /
translated: It is said that it sees by coming into contact with the mind.

original: de lta gal te lta ba @68a * //
analyzed: de lta gal te lta ba @68a * //
translated: If that is so, then if it is the entity of the seer,

original: po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ngo bo nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ngo bo nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: since an entity does not depend on another,

original: mig med par yang des lta nus par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: mig med par yang des lta nus par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: it would be logical that it could see even without eyes.

original: ci ste sta re med pa'i gcod pa pos gcod pa nyid du mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: ci ste sta re med pa'i gcod pa pos gcod pa nyid du mi 'grub kyi /
translated: But if you say that without an axe the woodcutter is not established as a woodcutter,

original: sta re dang ma bral bar gcod pas gcod pa po nyid du 'grub pa bzhin du blta ba dang ma bral bar blta ba'i lta ba pos mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sta re dang ma bral bar gcod pas gcod pa po nyid du 'grub pa bzhin du blta ba dang ma bral bar blta ba'i lta ba pos mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: but when not separate from the axe, since he cuts he is established as a woodcutter, in the same way, without seeing, the seer is not established as a seer, but when not separate from seeing, since he sees, he is established as a seer,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa byed pa dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol dang / byed pa dang bral ba'i 'og rol na lta ba med pas /🔽lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa byed pa dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol dang / byed pa dang bral ba'i 'og rol na lta ba med pas / lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas //
translated: then since seeing does not exist prior to or subsequent to the seer,🔽how could it be the entity of the seer?

original: ji ltar gzugs la blta bar rigs //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la blta bar rigs //
translated: How could it be logical that it sees form?

original: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa la ni lta ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa la ni lta ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ;
translated: But if it is not the entity of the seer, it cannot be seeing,

original: dmus long la lta ba med pa lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: dmus long la lta ba med pa lta bu yin pas /
translated: like the blindness of one who is born blind.

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid min pas //
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid min pas //
translated: Since it is not the entity of seeing,

original: ji ltar gzugs la blta bar rigs //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la blta bar rigs //
translated: how could it be suitable to see form?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar lta ba po gang yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / shes pa po yang yin nam 'on te tha dad pa yin ;
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar lta ba po gang yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / shes pa po yang yin nam 'on te tha dad pa yin ;
translated: Moreover, is the seer the same as the hearer, the smeller, the taster, the toucher, and the thinker, or are they different?

original: de la gal te tha dad pa yin na ni bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la gal te tha dad pa yin na ni bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: If they are different, then there would be many selves.🔽But that is unacceptable, because it is said:

original: de ni gcig tu zad de /
analyzed: de ni gcig tu zad de /
translated: “The self is one.”

original: 'on te de nyid /🔽gal te lta po nyan po na //
analyzed: 'on te de nyid / gal te lta po nyan po na //
translated: But if they are the same,🔽then why is it that the seer

original: ci phyir de ni nyan par 'gyur /🔽gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar de rang gi ngo bo nyid bral nas /
analyzed: ci phyir de ni nyan par 'gyur / gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar de rang gi ngo bo nyid bral nas /
translated: would be the hearer?

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the entity of the seer, how could it be devoid of its own entity and arise as another entity?

original: des na ngo bo nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be devoid of its own entity.

original: skyon 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: skyon 'di yang yod de /
translated: This error also arises:

original: de shes nyid dang rtag mi 'dod //
analyzed: de shes nyid dang rtag mi 'dod //
translated: It is not the consciousness itself, nor is it permanent.

original: bsgyur rung khyad par yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsgyur rung khyad par yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is a distinctive state that can be transformed.

original: gcig nyid ma yin tshul gnyis phyir //
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin tshul gnyis phyir //
translated: It is not the same, because it has two modes.

original: lus gzhan dag gis gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: lus gzhan dag gis gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like the form of another body.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag lta ba po nyan pa por yang 'gyur ba de lta ba po'i shes pa de nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag lta ba po nyan pa por yang 'gyur ba de lta ba po'i shes pa de nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The self is not the consciousness itself that sees and hears,

original: rtag pa nyid kyang yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyang yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: nor is it permanent.

original: bsgyur du rung ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsgyur du rung ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is a distinctive state that can be transformed.

original: bsgyur du rung ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni de blta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi khyad par du bsgyur bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur du rung ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni de blta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi khyad par du bsgyur bar nus pa'o //
translated: A distinctive state that can be transformed means that it can be transformed into the distinctive states of seeing, hearing, and so on.

original: gang rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur bar nus pa de'i shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gzhan du bsgyur bar nus pa de'i shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: That which can be transformed into another nature is not the nature of consciousness itself, nor is it permanent.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid dang mi 'bral ba yin pa'i rigs na /🔽de sngar lta ba por gyur nas gang gi tshe nyan pa por 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid dang mi 'bral ba yin pa'i rigs na / de sngar lta ba por gyur nas gang gi tshe nyan pa por 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that a permanent thing is not separated from an unchanging nature and essence.🔽When it was previously a seer, it was not separated from the nature of a seer.

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba dang ngo bo nyid bral bar snang ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba dang ngo bo nyid bral bar snang ngo //
translated: But when it becomes a hearer, it appears to be separated from the nature of a seer.

original: bdag gi ngo bo nyid ni gcig pa @68b nyid du tha snyad gdags pa yin na de ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo nyid ni gcig pa @68b nyid du tha snyad gdags pa yin na de ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the self were a single essence, it would not be a single essence.

original: tshul gnyis su gyur pa'i phyir lus gzhan dag gi gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul gnyis su gyur pa'i phyir lus gzhan dag gi gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It would have two modes, like the body of another.

original: de'i phyir de ni shes pa de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni shes pa de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not the essence of that consciousness.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not permanent and not a single essence. Thus, it is definitely essenceless.

original: de bzhin mig gi dbang po ni //🔽gzugs la dmigs pa'i byed mi 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin mig gi dbang po ni // gzugs la dmigs pa'i byed mi 'dod //
translated: The eye faculty is not accepted as the seer🔽Because it is not the seer when it is not conjoined with the mind.

original: yid bral nyid na lta po las //
analyzed: yid bral nyid na lta po las //
translated: When it is separated from the mind, it is not the seer,

original: gzhan phyir nyan la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan phyir nyan la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: Like the ear and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig de dbang po'i tshogs rnams las gzhan ma yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid la byed pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig de dbang po'i tshogs rnams las gzhan ma yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid la byed pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: If the seer is not different from the collection of sense faculties, then it is impossible for it to function with regard to its own characteristics.

original: 'on te gzhan yin na ni gzhan nyid du 'dra bas ji ltar rna ba gzugs la dmigs pa'i byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin na ni gzhan nyid du 'dra bas ji ltar rna ba gzugs la dmigs pa'i byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if it is different, then, being different in the same way as the ear, the eye also would not function with regard to form.

original: yid dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ni lta ba yin par grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la yang grags pas /
analyzed: yid dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ni lta ba yin par grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la yang grags pas /
translated: In all philosophical systems, it is well known that the sense faculties are not separate from mind.

original: de'i phyir yid dang bral ba nyid yin na mig de lta ba po las gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs kyis khyad par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid dang bral ba nyid yin na mig de lta ba po las gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs kyis khyad par smos so //
translated: Therefore, if the eye were separate from mind, then the reason, “because it is different from the seer,” would be qualified.

original: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say,

original: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te /🔽dbang po ni yul dang phrad par byed do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te / dbang po ni yul dang phrad par byed do //
translated: This is our philosophical tenet:🔽The sense faculties contact their objects.

original: dbang po dang phrad pa'i yul la yid kyis rjes su gcod par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po dang phrad pa'i yul la yid kyis rjes su gcod par byed do //
translated: The mind subsequently determines the object that the sense faculties contact.

original: yid kyis bcad pa la nga rgyal gyis rlom par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyis bcad pa la nga rgyal gyis rlom par byed do //
translated: And through pride, one conceives of the object that is mentally determined.

original: nga rgyal gyis rlom pa la blos sems par byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis rlom pa la blos sems par byed do //
translated: And through conceiving through pride, one thinks with the intellect.

original: blos bsams pa'i yul de skyes bu la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blos bsams pa'i yul de skyes bu la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The object that is thought by the intellect appears to the person.

original: dper na chu rnyog pa med pa nye bar gnas pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs par gnas pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan shar ba la blta ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yod pa de bzhin du skyes bu'i rdzas nges par gnas pa
analyzed: dper na chu rnyog pa med pa nye bar gnas pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs par gnas pa'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan shar ba la blta ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yod pa de bzhin du skyes bu'i rdzas nges par gnas pa
translated: For example, just as the reflection of the form of the moon appears in a clear, nearby pond, and the convention of seeing it exists, in the same way, in the person, the substance that definitely abides,

original: nyid la chos gzhan 'byung ba dang / chos gzhan 'gag pa na skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyid la chos gzhan 'byung ba dang / chos gzhan 'gag pa na skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: when another phenomenon arises and another phenomenon ceases, the nature of the person does not deteriorate.

original: rang bzhin dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyes bu ni mi rtag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyes bu ni mi rtag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: And because it is not devoid of its nature, therefore the person is not impermanent.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yang ma yin /
translated: And it is not that he does not exist essentially.

original: du ma yang ma yin zhing byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ma yang ma yin zhing byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And he is not multiple, nor is he an agent.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ni lta po nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: de ni lta po nyid mi rigs //
translated: It is not tenable that it is the seer.

original: mig la sogs pa ltos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltos pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it depends on the eye, etc.

original: yid bzhin yongs su 'gyur phyir dang // de bzhin gzugs brnyan 'char phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bzhin yongs su 'gyur phyir dang // de bzhin gzugs brnyan 'char phyir ro //
translated: Because it transforms like the mind, and because a reflection arises in it.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If it were the entity of the seer,

original: byed po'i chogs dag la mi ltos pa kho @69a * //
analyzed: byed po'i chogs dag la mi ltos pa kho @69a * //
translated: it would be tenable that it does not depend on the collection of conditions,

original: nar rigs so //
analyzed: nar rigs so //
translated: like the self.

original: de mi rtag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de mi rtag pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also impermanent,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it transforms, like milk, etc.

original: de lta po nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta po nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that it is the seer,

original: gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i phyir bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i phyir bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i chu bzhin no //
translated: because a reflection arises in it, like water in which a reflection arises.

original: yid ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba yang 'dod na /
analyzed: yid ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba yang 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the mind is the seer,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
