analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pas ma mthong ba'i yul la yid kyis kyang mi 'dzin pas de'i phyir re zhig yid nyid kyang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pas ma mthong ba'i yul la yid kyis kyang mi 'dzin pas de'i phyir re zhig yid nyid kyang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na /
translated: Because the mind does not apprehend an object that is not seen by the eye, etc., therefore the mind itself is not the entity of the seer.

original: de dang 'dra bar bdag lta ba por 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar bdag lta ba por 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: In the same way, how could the self be the seer?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: lta po ji ltar yid dang 'dra //
analyzed: lta po ji ltar yid dang 'dra //
translated: How could the seer be like the mind?

original: dbang po gzhan gyis mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyis mi mthong phyir //
translated: Because it is not seen by another sense faculty.

original: zhes bya ba la dbang po ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dbang po ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: Here, sense faculty refers to the sense faculties.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzhan las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzhan las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzhan gyis so //
translated: Another refers to another sense faculty that is different from another sense faculty.

original: don lhag ma ni smras par zad do //🔽gzhan yang / yid ni yang dag nyid du na //
analyzed: don lhag ma ni smras par zad do // gzhan yang / yid ni yang dag nyid du na //
translated: The rest of the meaning is self-evident.🔽Moreover:🔽The mind is not accepted as seeing in reality,

original: lta bar mi 'dod bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: lta bar mi 'dod bdag bzhin no //
translated: just like the self.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag lta ba ma yin par bkag pa bzhin du yid kyang lta ba ma yin par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag lta ba ma yin par bkag pa bzhin du yid kyang lta ba ma yin par dgag pa ste /
translated: Just as the self is refuted as not being the seer, the mind is also refuted as not being the seer.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la yid kyang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid dam lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di la yid kyang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid dam lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: Here, the mind would be either the entity of the seer or not the entity of the seer.

original: gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni mig med pa la yang lta ba yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni mig med pa la yang lta ba yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the entity of the seer, seeing would exist even without eyes.

original: gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de la nam yang lta ba yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de la nam yang lta ba yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not the entity of the seer, then seeing would never exist.

original: ji ste mig dang gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa tshogs pa'i dbang gis yid lta bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste mig dang gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa tshogs pa'i dbang gis yid lta bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind sees due to the power of the assembly of eyes, forms, light, space, and attention,

original: bshad pa / de ni lta min tshogs pa dag / rdzas su med phyir de nyid bzhin //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni lta min tshogs pa dag / rdzas su med phyir de nyid bzhin //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is not seeing, because the assembly does not exist substantially, just like that.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid de ni lta ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid de ni lta ba ma yin te ;
translated: The mind is not seeing.

original: tshogs pa dag rdzas su med pa'i phyir nags tshal la sogs pa tshogs pa de nyid bzhin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: tshogs pa dag rdzas su med pa'i phyir nags tshal la sogs pa tshogs pa de nyid bzhin no zhes ston te /
translated: He demonstrates that the assembly does not exist substantially, just like a forest and so on.

original: gal te yid mig la sogs pa la mi ltos pa 'ba' zhig la lta ba yin par gyur na ni don dam pa pa yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir tshogs pa dag med par yid la lta ba med pa de'i phyir nye bar gdags pa ma gtogs
analyzed: gal te yid mig la sogs pa la mi ltos pa 'ba' zhig la lta ba yin par gyur na ni don dam pa pa yin pa zhig na gang gi phyir tshogs pa dag med par yid la lta ba med pa de'i phyir nye bar gdags pa ma gtogs
translated: If the mind were to see without depending on the eye and so on, it would be ultimate. But because the mind does not see without the assembly, it is merely designated as seeing.

original: par gang yang rung ba cig la lta ba yod par tha snyad gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: par gang yang rung ba cig la lta ba yod par tha snyad gdags par mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to impute the existence of a seer in any of the images.

original: tshogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir yid dang 'dra bar bdag lta ba yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir yid dang 'dra bar bdag lta ba yin par mi rigs so //
translated: And because the collections do not substantially exist, like a forest and so on, therefore, like the mind, it is not logical that the self is the seer.

original: gal te bdag med na gang gis @69b mthong zhe na //
analyzed: gal te bdag med na gang gis @69b mthong zhe na //
translated: If there is no self, who sees?

original: kho bo cag ni tha snyad du ni sems nyid kyis mthong bar 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni tha snyad du ni sems nyid kyis mthong bar 'dod do //
translated: We assert that the mind itself sees conventionally.

original: gal te sems ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the mind is not an agent because it is momentary,🔽it is said:

original: bshad pa / byed po nyid rung chos gzhan dag / mngon par 'grub phyir dril bu bzhin //
analyzed: bshad pa / byed po nyid rung chos gzhan dag / mngon par 'grub phyir dril bu bzhin //
translated: Because other phenomena are produced, it is suitable to be an agent, like a bell.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag med du zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the self imputed by other tīrthikas does not exist,

original: sems skad cig ma nyid tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du rung ste /
analyzed: sems skad cig ma nyid tha snyad du byed pa po nyid du rung ste /
translated: the mind itself is suitable to be an agent conventionally because it is momentary.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed bdag med pa dag la rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges par tshogs pa'i dbang gis chos gzhan dag mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir dper na dril bu sgra 'byin pa dang / mar me ngang bar byed pa dang / chu 'bab par byed pa de bzhin du ste //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed bdag med pa dag la rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges par tshogs pa'i dbang gis chos gzhan dag mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir dper na dril bu sgra 'byin pa dang / mar me ngang bar byed pa dang / chu 'bab par byed pa de bzhin du ste //
translated: Because other phenomena are manifestly established by the power of the assembly of causes and conditions that are individually ascertained in the internal and external compositional factors that are devoid of self, it is like, for example, a bell’s sound, a lamp’s illumination, and a river’s flow.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni tshogs pa las tha snyad du lta ba khas len gyi don dam par ni de gang la yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni tshogs pa las tha snyad du lta ba khas len gyi don dam par ni de gang la yang mi gnas te /
translated: Therefore we accept that conventionally things are seen in dependence on an assembly, but ultimately they do not abide in any of them.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
translated: It does not exist in the eyes or forms.

original: de gnyis par na'ang mi gnas te //
analyzed: de gnyis par na'ang mi gnas te //
translated: Nor does it exist between those two.

original: gang du de ni gnas 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang du de ni gnas 'gyur ba /
translated: Where it abides,

original: de yod ma yin de med min //
analyzed: de yod ma yin de med min //
translated: it is not existent nor nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: kha cig mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song nas 'dzin par byed do snyam du sems pa de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: kha cig mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song nas 'dzin par byed do snyam du sems pa de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute the idea of some that the eye’s light rays go out to the object and apprehend it, it is said:

original: mig ni 'od zer ldan mi rigs //
analyzed: mig ni 'od zer ldan mi rigs //
translated: It is illogical that the eye possesses light rays.

original: dbang po yin phyir dbang gzhan bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni mig ni 'od zer dang ldan par mi rigs te /
analyzed: dbang po yin phyir dbang gzhan bzhin // zhes bya ba ni mig ni 'od zer dang ldan par mi rigs te /
translated: Because it is a sense faculty, like the other sense faculties.

original: dbang po yin pa'i phyir dbang po gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: dbang po yin pa'i phyir dbang po gzhan bzhin te /
translated: The eye is not reasonable to possess light rays because it is a sense faculty, like the other sense faculties.

original: ji ltar rna bas kyang sgra thag ring po na 'dug pa thos la /
analyzed: ji ltar rna bas kyang sgra thag ring po na 'dug pa thos la /
translated: Just as the ear hears sound that is far away,

original: yid kyis kyang yul dpag tshad stong gis bskal pa dag kyang shes mod kyi /
analyzed: yid kyis kyang yul dpag tshad stong gis bskal pa dag kyang shes mod kyi /
translated: and the mind knows objects that are a thousand yojanas away,

original: de dag 'od zer dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang de dang 'dra bas de 'od zer dang ldan par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dag 'od zer dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang de dang 'dra bas de 'od zer dang ldan par mi rigs so //
translated: but they do not possess light rays, so too the eye is similar to them. Therefore it is unreasonable for it to possess light rays.

original: gal te de ltar mig gi dbang po 'od zer dang ldan pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar byi la dang 'ug pa dag mun khrod na mig dag las sgron ma ltar 'bar ba 'byung bar snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mig gi dbang po 'od zer dang ldan pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar byi la dang 'ug pa dag mun khrod na mig dag las sgron ma ltar 'bar ba 'byung bar snang zhe na /
translated: If the eye sense faculty does not possess light rays, then how is it that cats and owls are seen to emit light from their eyes like lamps in the darkness?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig 'bras snang //
analyzed: mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig 'bras snang //
translated: The eyes of nocturnal creatures shine.

original: dbang po snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculty is not light.

original: zhes bya ba ni mun khrod na mtshon mo rgyu ba rnams kyi mig gi 'bras bu snang bar zad kyi dbang po ni mi snang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mun khrod na mtshon mo rgyu ba rnams kyi mig gi 'bras bu snang bar zad kyi dbang po ni mi snang ste /
translated: This is like the eyes of those who move about in the dark, for the eyes themselves are illuminated, but the sense faculty is not illuminated.

original: de ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not illuminated because it is not visible.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that conception is not good.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: mig ni bde sogs bdag nyid min //
analyzed: mig ni bde sogs bdag nyid min //
translated: The eye is not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: dngos po yin @70a * //
analyzed: dngos po yin @70a * //
translated: Because it is a thing,

original: phyir skyes bu bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag mig ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyir skyes bu bzhin // zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag mig ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: like a person.

original: 'di ltar yul yid du 'ong ba mthong na bde ba skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul yid du 'ong ba mthong na bde ba skye la /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say the eye is of the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, because when one sees a pleasant object, pleasure arises,🔽and when one sees the opposite, pain and delusion arise.

original: de las bzlog pa dag la sdug bsngal dang gti mug skye'o zhes zer bas de dgag pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dag la sdug bsngal dang gti mug skye'o zhes zer bas de dgag pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: This is explained in order to refute that.

original: mig bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mig bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: The eye is not of the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu bzhin te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu bzhin te /
translated: because it is a thing, like a person.

original: ji ltar zhe na mig de yod pa'am med pa'am /🔽rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /🔽gang yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na mig de yod pa'am med pa'am / rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am / gang yin yang rung ste /
translated: How so?🔽Whether the eye exists or not,🔽whether it is permanent or impermanent,🔽whatever it is,🔽

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: How so? The eye does not exist, does not not exist, is not existent and nonexistent, is not permanent, is not impermanent, and is not both permanent and impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po dang rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a thing and a substance.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: skyes bu bzhin te /
analyzed: skyes bu bzhin te /
translated: Like a person.

original: 'di ltar de dag skyes bu ni yon tan med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //🔽kha cig mig ni thams cad du song ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag skyes bu ni yon tan med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // kha cig mig ni thams cad du song ba yin te /
translated: Because a person is accepted as not having qualities.🔽Some think that the eye is all-pervading because it is not obstructed with respect to all that is visible.

original: blta bar bya ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de dag la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de dag la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them it should be said:

original: mig ni kun tu song min te //
analyzed: mig ni kun tu song min te //
translated: The eye is not all-pervading

original: yod phyir de 'bras la sogs bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni mig ni kun tu song ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod phyir de 'bras la sogs bzhin // zhes bya ba ni mig ni kun tu song ba ma yin te /
translated: because it exists, like its effects and so on.

original: yod pa'i phyir mig de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin te rang gi gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir mig de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bzhin te rang gi gnas bzhin no //
translated: The eye is not all-pervading because it exists, like its effects and so on, like its location.

original: dbang po yang de'i khongs na 'dug pas thams cad du song ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: dbang po yang de'i khongs na 'dug pas thams cad du song ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: The sense faculty is included in that category, so it is not omnipresent.

original: yang na mig ni kun 'gro min //
analyzed: yang na mig ni kun 'gro min //
translated: Or, the eye is not omnipresent,

original: gzhan don nyid phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan don nyid phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: because it is for the sake of another, like a pot.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na mig ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na mig ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, the eye is not omnipresent,

original: gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin te /
translated: because it is for the sake of another, like a pot.

original: grangs can dag gzhan zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: grangs can dag gzhan zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say that another is the knowing self.

original: mig la sogs pa ni de'i don gyi phyir 'dod do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de'i don gyi phyir 'dod do //
translated: They assert that the eye and so on are for the sake of that.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi don nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi don nyid do //
translated: The state of being for the sake of another is for the sake of another.

original: dper na bum pa ni gzhan dag la phan pa'i don gyi phyir mngon par sgrub par byed kyang de thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang skyes bu'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin no
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni gzhan dag la phan pa'i don gyi phyir mngon par sgrub par byed kyang de thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang skyes bu'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin no
translated: For example, although a pot is established for the sake of benefitting others, it is not omnipresent. Similarly, the eye is established for the sake of the self but is not omnipresent.

original: zhes bya ba slob dpon gyis bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba slob dpon gyis bsams so //
translated: This is the thought of the master.

original: yang na mig ni kun 'gro min //🔽gzugs dmigs 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: yang na mig ni kun 'gro min // gzugs dmigs 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin phyir //
translated: Or else, the eye is not omnipresent,🔽because it is the cause of the perception of form,

original: dper na gzugs bzhin de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzhin de bzhin no //
translated: just like form.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na mig ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na mig ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the eye is not omnipresent,

original: gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of the perception of form,

original: dper na @70b gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na @70b gzugs bzhin no //
translated: just like form.

original: ji ltar mig ni gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar mig ni gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas /
translated: Just as the eye is the cause of the perception of form, so form is the cause of the perception of form.

original: dper na gzugs ni gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as form is not omnipresent because it is the cause of the perception of form, so the eye is not omnipresent because it is the cause of the perception of form.

original: kha cig na re mig ni me'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mig ni me'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Some say: The eye has the nature of fire,

original: gsal ba ches chen po dag gis zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ches chen po dag gis zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: But that is not good.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mig ni me dang ldan ma yin //🔽dbang po yin phyir lpags sogs bzhin //
analyzed: mig ni me dang ldan ma yin // dbang po yin phyir lpags sogs bzhin //
translated: The eye is not associated with fire.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is a sense faculty, like the skin, etc.

original: kha cig mig ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba yin yang me'i shas che ba yin no snyam du sems pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: kha cig mig ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba yin yang me'i shas che ba yin no snyam du sems pa de dag la yang /
translated: Some think that the eye, although it arises from the four great elements, is dominated by the element of fire.🔽To them it is said:

original: 'byung chen dang sogs bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: 'byung chen dang sogs bdag nyid ni //
translated: The nature of the great elements, etc.,

original: me shas che ba ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: me shas che ba ma yin no // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: is not dominated by fire.

original: mig 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba gzugs dang ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can ni me shas che ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mig 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba gzugs dang ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can ni me shas che ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye, which has the nature of clear form, etc., and arises from the great elements, is not dominated by fire.

original: dbang po yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: dbang po yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: Because it is a sense faculty, like the body sense faculty, etc.

original: grangs can dag yid ma gtogs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag ni yul dang phrad nas 'dzin par 'dod de /
analyzed: grangs can dag yid ma gtogs pa'i dbang po lnga po dag ni yul dang phrad nas 'dzin par 'dod de /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas assert that the five faculties, except for the mental faculty, apprehend objects by coming into contact with them.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni gnas nas phyi rol du 'phos nas yul 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni gnas nas phyi rol du 'phos nas yul 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: They say this because they want to refute the theory that the eye and so on engage their objects by projecting out to the object and grasping it.

original: mig ni yul dang phrad ma yin //
analyzed: mig ni yul dang phrad ma yin //
translated: The eye does not come into contact with its object.🔽Because it is a sense faculty, like the mind,

original: dbang po yin phyir yid bzhin dang // rgyun phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang po yin phyir yid bzhin dang // rgyun phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is a continuum, and because it possesses a cause.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya bar smras so ;
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin // zhes bya bar smras so ;
translated: Or else, like form and so on.

original: / chos mngon pa pa dag na re /
analyzed: / chos mngon pa pa dag na re /
translated: The Abhidharmikas say:

original: mig dang rna ba dang yid ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang yid ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The eye, ear and mental faculty apprehend noncontiguous objects.

original: 'di ltar mig dang rna ba ni thag ring pos bskal pa'i gzugs dang sgra yang 'dzin la yid kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang thag ring ba dang nye ba'i don rnams la thogs pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang rna ba ni thag ring pos bskal pa'i gzugs dang sgra yang 'dzin la yid kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang thag ring ba dang nye ba'i don rnams la thogs pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the eye and ear apprehend form and sound that are separated by a distance and the mental faculty is not obstructed from apprehending past, future and distant objects.

original: sna dang lce dang lus ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The nose, tongue, and body are not like that.🔽Because they only apprehend objects that they contact.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni yul phrad pa kho na 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni yul phrad pa kho na 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel that assertion, he says:

original: sna tshogs yul phrad 'dzin mi 'dod //
analyzed: sna tshogs yul phrad 'dzin mi 'dod //
translated: It is not asserted that they apprehend objects that they contact.🔽Because they apprehend present external objects,

original: phyi don mngon sum 'dzin phyir dang // 'das dang ma 'ongs mi 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: phyi don mngon sum 'dzin phyir dang // 'das dang ma 'ongs mi 'dzin phyir //
translated: and because they do not apprehend past and future objects.

original: dper @71a * //
analyzed: dper @71a * //
translated: For example,

original: na mig gi dbang po bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na mig gi dbang po bzhin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the eye sense faculty.

original: sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po dang ni yul phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po dang ni yul phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod de /
translated: The nose, tongue, and body faculties do not apprehend objects that they contact.

original: phyi rol gyi don mngon sum du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po bzhin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don mngon sum du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po bzhin te /
translated: Because they apprehend present external objects and because they do not apprehend past and future objects, for example, like the eye sense faculty.

original: ji ltar sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po dag ni phyi rol gyi don mngon sum du gyur pa dag 'dzin pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag mi 'dzin pa bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po dag ni phyi rol gyi don mngon sum du gyur pa dag 'dzin pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag mi 'dzin pa bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as the nose, tongue, and body faculties apprehend present external objects and do not apprehend past or future objects, so too the eye faculty is like that.

original: mig gi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du de dag kyang yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du de dag kyang yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the eye faculty is like that, so too those faculties do not apprehend objects that they contact.

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pas ma nges pa'i skyon bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pas ma nges pa'i skyon bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: To dispel the error that the body faculty and so on are indefinite, it is said:

original: bsgrub dang 'dra bar bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsgrub dang 'dra bar bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are similar to what is established, they are refuted.

original: lus la sogs pas ma nges min //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pas ma nges min // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The body faculty and so on are not indefinite.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly:

original: mig rna yid kyi mtshan nyid gsum //
analyzed: mig rna yid kyi mtshan nyid gsum //
translated: The three characteristics of the eye, ear, and mind

original: yul dang ma phrad 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad 'dzin ma yin //
translated: Do not apprehend objects that they do not contact.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po yin pa'i phyir dang / sems skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po yin pa'i phyir dang / sems skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are faculties and because they are the cause of the arising of the mind,

original: dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: they are like the nose and so on.

original: lta ba ji ltar rgyas bshad pas //
analyzed: lta ba ji ltar rgyas bshad pas //
translated: Because the view is extensively explained,

original: nyan dang snom dang myang ba dang // lus kyi dbang po bsags pa dag / nges par khong du chud par bya //
analyzed: nyan dang snom dang myang ba dang // lus kyi dbang po bsags pa dag / nges par khong du chud par bya //
translated: should be understood in the same way.🔽Just as seeing, the idea of seeing, and the word “seeing” are not tenable in the eye, the seer, and the mind, in the same way, listening, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lta ba dang lta ba'i blo dang lta ba'i sgra dag mig dang lta ba po dang yid la yod par mi rigs pa de bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dang / de dag gi blo dang de dag gi sgra yang de dag gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lta ba dang lta ba'i blo dang lta ba'i sgra dag mig dang lta ba po dang yid la yod par mi rigs pa de bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dang / de dag gi blo dang de dag gi sgra yang de dag gi dbang po dang /
translated: and the ideas of listening, etc., and the words for listening, etc., are not tenable in the sense faculties, the self, and the mind.

original: bdag dang yid la yod par mi rigs par dgag pa mtshungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang yid la yod par mi rigs par dgag pa mtshungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The refutation should be understood in the same way.🔽Sound, smell, taste, and tactility,

original: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg / dgag pa'i tshul yang de yin te //🔽mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg / dgag pa'i tshul yang de yin te // mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
translated: should be understood in the same way.🔽The wise should understand

original: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
translated: them appropriately with an impartial mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzugs mig dang lta ba po dang yid kyi yul yin par mi rigs pa dang / gzugs kyi blo dang sgra yang de dag la yod par mi rigs pa de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzugs mig dang lta ba po dang yid kyi yul yin par mi rigs pa dang / gzugs kyi blo dang sgra yang de dag la yod par mi rigs pa de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: Just as it is illogical that form is the object of the eye, the seer, and the mind, and it is illogical that the cognition of form and sound exist in them, so the ear and so on,🔽the self, and the mind are illogical as the object of sound and so on, and it is illogical that the cognition of sound and so on and sound exist in them.

original: bdag dang yid kyi yul yin par mi rigs pa dang / sgra la sogs pa'i blo dang sgra yang de dag la yod par mi rigs par dgag pa mtshungs par mkhas pas phyogs su lhung ba med pa'i blo dag gis ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang yid kyi yul yin par mi rigs pa dang / sgra la sogs pa'i blo dang sgra yang de dag la yod par mi rigs par dgag pa mtshungs par mkhas pas phyogs su lhung ba med pa'i blo dag gis ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The wise should understand that the refutations are similar in the same way, as appropriate, with a mind free from bias.

original: de ltar re zhig gzugs kyi phung po brtags nas tshor ba'i phung po yang brtag par bya ste //🔽tshor ba don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzugs kyi phung po brtags nas tshor ba'i phung po yang brtag par bya ste // tshor ba don dam nyid du na //
translated: Having thus examined the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate should be examined.🔽It is illogical that feeling

original: myong ba'i bdag nyid yin mi rigs //
analyzed: myong ba'i bdag nyid yin mi rigs //
translated: is the nature of experience in reality.

original: rnam shes mtshungs @71b par ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam shes mtshungs @71b par ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is concomitant with consciousness,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems byung bzhin //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems byung bzhin //
translated: it is like any other mental factor.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa myong ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa myong ba yin la /
translated: The opponent’s position is that the characteristic of feeling is the experience of contact, which is the coming together of the three: faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: de yang myong ba'i bye brag las rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang myong ba'i bye brag las rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
translated: And that is asserted to be threefold due to the distinctions of experience.

original: tshor ba de don dam pa nyid du na myong ba'i bdag nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: tshor ba de don dam pa nyid du na myong ba'i bdag nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable that feeling is ultimately the nature of experience,🔽because it is concomitant with consciousness, like any other mental factor.

original: rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya bar tshad ma nye bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya bar tshad ma nye bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the opponent applies the argument.

original: de ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i gnas skabs yang re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag spangs pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i gnas skabs yang re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag spangs pa yin na /
translated: For, in the context of the four absorptions, pleasure and pain are abandoned.

original: tshor ba thams cad 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: So what need is there to mention the context of nirvana, in which all feelings have ceased?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ting nge 'dzin de ni tshor ba tshad med pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i sa bon med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni tshor ba tshad med pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i sa bon med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This concentration is without the seeds of unlimited feelings and discriminations.

original: tshor ba'i khyad par dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshor ba'i khyad par dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to refute the distinction of feelings, he says:

original: bde ba phan 'dogs mi 'dod de //
analyzed: bde ba phan 'dogs mi 'dod de //
translated: 1. Pleasure is not a benefit,

original: reg las byung phyir de gzhan bzhin //
analyzed: reg las byung phyir de gzhan bzhin //
translated: because it arises from contact, like another.

original: sdug bsngal gnod pa'i bdag nyid min //🔽gtan tshigs bstan pas shes par bya //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnod pa'i bdag nyid min // gtan tshigs bstan pas shes par bya //
translated: Pain is not an injury,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is known through a reason.

original: bde ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la sdug bsngal ni gnod pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: bde ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la sdug bsngal ni gnod pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: Pleasure has the characteristic of benefit, pain has the characteristic of injury.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain has the nature of both, but that is not its nature.

original: reg pa las byung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba bzhin te /
analyzed: reg pa las byung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba bzhin te /
translated: Because it arises from contact, like another feeling.

original: gang gi phyir gcig tu bde ba nyid ni 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig tu bde ba nyid ni 'ga' yang med la /
translated: Because there is nothing that is only pleasure,

original: gcig tu sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang 'ga' yang med cing gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang gang na yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang 'ga' yang med cing gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang gang na yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no one who is only suffering, nor is there anyone who is the nature of both.

original: 'o na sred pa zad pa gtan du bde ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sred pa zad pa gtan du bde ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t the extinction of craving for the ultimate happiness?

original: gnas skabs su ni rnam par rtog pa med pa myong ba thams cad dang bral ba ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin no //🔽de la bde ba nye bar gdags pa ni 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gnas skabs su ni rnam par rtog pa med pa myong ba thams cad dang bral ba ngo bo nyid gang gis kyang tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin no // de la bde ba nye bar gdags pa ni 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: In the present, it is nonconceptual, free from all experience, and not to be designated by any nature.

original: sdug min bde min mi 'dod de //🔽'bras bu sred phyir gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug min bde min mi 'dod de // 'bras bu sred phyir gzhan bzhin no //
translated: The designation of happiness is not faulty, because it is free from all the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba'i sdug pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi 'dod de /🔽de'i @72a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sdug pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi 'dod de / de'i @72a * //
translated: He does not assert that the feeling that is neither suffering nor happiness is its nature,🔽because craving is its result, like any other action.

original: 'bras bu sred pa yin pa'i phyir de'i las gzhan bzhin no zhes dpe nye bar bzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu sred pa yin pa'i phyir de'i las gzhan bzhin no zhes dpe nye bar bzhag go //
translated: He presents an example.

original: gang gi 'bras bu sred pa yin pa de ni 'bras bu sred pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu sred pa yin pa de ni 'bras bu sred pa yod pa yin te /
translated: That which has craving as its result has the existence of craving as its result,

original: tshor ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni sred pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni sred pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because craving is the result of all feelings.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshul gyis sems yod pas tshor ba dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshul gyis sems yod pas tshor ba dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that feelings exist because mind exists, since mind and mental factors exist in the same way,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / rnam shes ngo bo nyid kyang ni //🔽dgag pa smra bar 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam shes ngo bo nyid kyang ni // dgag pa smra bar 'dod phyir ro //
translated: The nature of consciousness is also to be refuted,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because you assert that it is to be refuted.🔽The nature of consciousness is also to be refuted, because you assert that it is to be refuted later.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag par yang 'og nas smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir tshor ba rnam gsum ni don dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag par yang 'og nas smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir tshor ba rnam gsum ni don dam pa ma yin te /
translated: The three kinds of feelings are not ultimate,

original: sems dgag pa na sems las byung ba dag dgag pa byas pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems dgag pa na sems las byung ba dag dgag pa byas pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: because when mind is refuted, mental factors are also refuted.

original: pha rol gyi rgyal po pham na de'i dmag kyang pham par mngon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi rgyal po pham na de'i dmag kyang pham par mngon pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like when a king is defeated, his army is also defeated.🔽The two kinds of discrimination and formation

original: 'du shes 'du byed rnam gnyis dag / des ni rnam par bshad gyur te //
analyzed: 'du shes 'du byed rnam gnyis dag / des ni rnam par bshad gyur te //
translated: have been explained by that.

original: mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
analyzed: mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
translated: The wise should understand them

original: ci rigs par ni shes par bya ;
analyzed: ci rigs par ni shes par bya ;
translated: in accordance with the truth, as is appropriate.

original: / zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag dgag pa yang tshor ba bkag pa des de dang 'dra bar rnam par bshad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po dag dgag pa yang tshor ba bkag pa des de dang 'dra bar rnam par bshad par shes par bya ste /
translated: The refutation of the aggregates of perception and formation should be understood as explained by the refutation of feeling.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'du shes kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: Perception also has no intrinsic reality,

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir smig rgyu dang grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal gyi 'du shes bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir smig rgyu dang grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal gyi 'du shes bzhin no //
translated: because it functions to discriminate, like the perception of a mirage, a city of gandharvas, or a garden.

original: de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis kyang don dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnam pa gnyis kyang don dam pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the two kinds of formations, those that are associated and those that are not associated, also are not ultimate,

original: 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chu shing gi phung po bzhin no //🔽rnam shes don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chu shing gi phung po bzhin no // rnam shes don dam nyid du na //
translated: because they have the nature of being aggregates, like a pile of reeds.

original: dngos po rnam rig dngos nyid min //
analyzed: dngos po rnam rig dngos nyid min //
translated: Consciousness is not the reality of the ultimate,🔽because it is the perception of an entity,

original: dmigs dang bcas phyir 'du shes bzhin //
analyzed: dmigs dang bcas phyir 'du shes bzhin //
translated: like perception, because it has an object.

original: yang na 'jig phyir mar me bzhin //
analyzed: yang na 'jig phyir mar me bzhin //
translated: Or else, because it perishes, like a lamp.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni don dam nyid du na dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni don dam nyid du na dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness, in the ultimate sense, is not the entity that is the perception of objects,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'du shes bzhin nam /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'du shes bzhin nam /
translated: because it has an object, like ideation,

original: yang na 'jig pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa'i phyir mar me bzhin no //
translated: or else, because it perishes, like a lamp.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni de dngos su 'dug pa'i phyir dngos po'am /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni de dngos su 'dug pa'i phyir dngos po'am /
translated: An entity is so called because it is in the process of becoming,

original: yang na 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gnas pa'i phyir dngos po ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gnas pa'i phyir dngos po ste /
translated: or else, because the mind and mental functions abide in it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag go //
translated: It is form, etc.

original: de so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sgo nas rang gi ngo bo @72b yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: de so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sgo nas rang gi ngo bo @72b yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The perception of it is the thorough knowledge of its nature by way of non-imagination.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is not its nature.

original: phung po bkag pa dang 'dra bar khams dang skye mched dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po bkag pa dang 'dra bar khams dang skye mched dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the elements and sense bases are also refuted in the same way that the aggregates are, he says,

original: phung po lnga po rnam dpyad pa'i //
analyzed: phung po lnga po rnam dpyad pa'i //
translated: The five aggregates are analyzed.

original: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des //🔽phung po rnams kyi khams zhes bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des // phung po rnams kyi khams zhes bya //
translated: By the practice as taught,🔽one should know the elements of the aggregates,

original: skye mched rnams kyang shes par bya //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyang shes par bya //
translated: and also the sense bases.

original: zhes bya ba la khams ni bco brgyad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la khams ni bco brgyad de /
translated: The elements are eighteen:

original: dbang po drug dang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug po dag go //
analyzed: dbang po drug dang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug po dag go //
translated: the six sense faculties, the six sense objects, and the six consciousnesses.

original: skye mched ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: skye mched ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: The sense bases are twelve:

original: mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug gi bye brag las so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug gi bye brag las so //
translated: the six beginning with the eye and the six beginning with form.

original: de dag kyang 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And since they are of the nature of a collection,

original: tshogs pa las ma gtogs par ji ltar dmigs su med pa de ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa las ma gtogs par ji ltar dmigs su med pa de ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: they are not apprehended apart from the collection, as was previously explained.

original: kun rdzob tu gdags pa'i dngos po tsam du ni yod de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gdags pa'i dngos po tsam du ni yod de /
translated: They exist as mere things designated conventionally,

original: bde bar gshegs pas ji skad du /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas ji skad du /
translated: as the Well-Gone One has said:

original: srid gsum btags pa nyid tsam ste //
analyzed: srid gsum btags pa nyid tsam ste //
translated: The three worlds are mere designations;

original: dngos po'i ngo bor yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor yod ma yin //
translated: they do not exist as entities.🔽The fools imagine that

original: btags la dngos po'i dngos nyid du //🔽ngan rtog rnams ni rtog par byed //
analyzed: btags la dngos po'i dngos nyid du // ngan rtog rnams ni rtog par byed //
translated: a designation is the entity itself.

original: ces gsungs pa dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Feelings are like water bubbles,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Perceptions are like mirages,

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Formations are like banana trees,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //🔽de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes // de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //
translated: And consciousness is like an illusion—

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
translated: Thus it was taught by the one who sees reality.

original: /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aggregates, bases, and constituents definitely exist essentially ultimately,

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the characteristics of produced phenomena, such as arising.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist is not a produced phenomenon,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: The aggregates, bases, and constituents are produced phenomena,

original: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: because, monks, these three are the characteristics of produced phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Origination, enduring, and disintegrating.”

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas phung po dang ; skye mched dang khams rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas phung po dang ; skye mched dang khams rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore conditioned phenomena—the aggregates, bases, and constituents—definitely exist inherently.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus byas yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus byas yin nam /
translated: Are those origination and so on conditioned phenomena?

original: 'on te 'dus ma byas yin /🔽de la gal te 'dus byas yin na ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched las gzhan pa'i skye bar byed pa @73a * //
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma byas yin / de la gal te 'dus byas yin na ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched las gzhan pa'i skye bar byed pa @73a * //
translated: Or are they unconditioned phenomena?🔽If they are conditioned phenomena, then apart from the aggregates, constituents, and bases, there is no example of an origination,

original: dang ; gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa yod pa'i dpe med do //
analyzed: dang ; gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa yod pa'i dpe med do //
translated: a duration, or a disintegration.

original: skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don la yang skur ba 'debs pa yin la /🔽skye ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don la yang skur ba 'debs pa yin la / skye ba ni /
translated: You also repudiate the meaning of the origination of origination, the duration of duration, and the disintegration of disintegration.

original: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Origination is not the characteristic of all conditioned phenomena.

original: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the producer, like a father, for example, who is not the characteristic of his son.

original: gnas par byed pa yang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor is endurance the characteristic of the conditioned,

original: dper na bum pa gnas par byed pa'i bran mo bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa gnas par byed pa'i bran mo bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like a maid servant, for example, who is not the characteristic of the pot that she tends.

original: 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor is destruction the characteristic of the conditioned,

original: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i thob bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes smra bar nus so //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i thob bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes smra bar nus so //
translated: like a hammer, for example, which is not the characteristic of the pot that it destroys.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus ma byas yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa de dag 'dus ma byas yin na ni /
translated: If arising, etc., were unconditioned,

original: de dag ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: how could they be the characteristics of the conditioned?

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' ni 'dus byas gang gi mtshan nyid yin par yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' ni 'dus byas gang gi mtshan nyid yin par yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: For space is not seen to be the characteristic of anything conditioned.

original: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba zhig yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'dus pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba zhig yin te /
translated: Moreover, arising, etc., would be the characteristics of the conditioned only if they were assembled.

original: dper na mdo sde pa dag na re //
analyzed: dper na mdo sde pa dag na re //
translated: For example, Sautrantikas say:

original: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu ba skyed pa las byung ba'i rgyun la dus gcig kho nar gang ma byung ba las byung ba de ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthu ba skyed pa las byung ba'i rgyun la dus gcig kho nar gang ma byung ba las byung ba de ni skye ba yin la /
translated: The arising of a continuum that arises from the power of specific causes and conditions is the arising of that which did not exist previously.

original: skad cig ma snga ma nyid kyi rgyun gyis gnas pa ni gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma nyid kyi rgyun gyis gnas pa ni gnas pa yin la /
translated: Abiding is the endurance of the continuum of the prior moment.

original: skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bar rgas shing bral ba ni 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bar rgas shing bral ba ni 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin nam /
translated: Aging is the change and separation of the prior moment from the subsequent moment.

original: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa so so ba dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa so so ba dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Or are individual arising and so on the characteristics of conditioned states,

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba dag na re sngon ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba dag na re sngon ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
translated: for example, like the assertion of Vaibhasikas that arising is the occurrence of that which did not previously exist,

original: skyes pa'i gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
analyzed: skyes pa'i gnas pa ni gnas pa yin /
translated: abiding is the endurance of that which has arisen,

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang rga ba dang rnyings pa dang 'gag pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin grang na //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang rga ba dang rnyings pa dang 'gag pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes zer ba lta bu zhig yin grang na //
translated: and destruction is the transformation, aging and decay of that which abides.

original: de la re zhig 'dus pa rnams ni dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs pa dag mi srid de //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dus pa rnams ni dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs pa dag mi srid de //
translated: First, the collection of the three characteristics is not possible, because arising, etc. are not possible at one time.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir so so ba dag kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir so so ba dag kyang mi srid do //
translated: Nor is the collection of the three characteristics possible as distinct things, because they occur in sequence, because their characteristics are not similar, and because they are incompatible.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar dngos po ma skyes pa las ni gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas @73b kyi mtshan nyid med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ma skyes pa las ni gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas @73b kyi mtshan nyid med la /
translated: Thus, since abiding and destruction do not exist in an unarisen thing, the three characteristics of the conditioned do not exist.

original: dngos po gnas pa la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Since arising and destruction do not exist in an abiding thing, the three characteristics of the conditioned do not exist.

original: dngos po zhig pa ni skye ba dang gnas pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: dngos po zhig pa ni skye ba dang gnas pa gnyis med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Since arising and abiding do not exist in a destroyed thing, the three characteristics of the conditioned do not exist.

original: skye ba la yang skye ba med pa dang gnas pa la yang gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba la yang skye ba med pa dang gnas pa la yang gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since arising does not arise, abiding does not abide, and destruction does not cease,

original: de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med pas skye ba la sogs pa so so ba dag gis kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med pas skye ba la sogs pa so so ba dag gis kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Since they do not have the characteristics of conditioned states, they cannot function as the characteristics of conditioned states by means of their individual characteristics of arising, etc.

original: de ltar de dag sems kyi mdun du bzhag nas bshad pa //🔽skye sogs 'dus byas nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: de ltar de dag sems kyi mdun du bzhag nas bshad pa // skye sogs 'dus byas nyid kyis ni //
translated: Having thus placed them in the mind, he explains:

original: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi'i nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi'i nyid mi rigs //
translated: Arising, etc. are not reasonable as the characteristics of the characterized

original: 'dus byas yin phyir rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin phyir rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: because they are conditioned and because they are to be realized.

original: de las gzhan pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: They are like something else.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pas phung po la sogs pa mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pas phung po la sogs pa mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Since arising, etc. are the characteristics of conditioned states, it is not reasonable that the aggregates, etc. are the characterized that have the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are conditioned and because they are to be realized.

original: skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid de las gzhan pa'i mtshan gzhi nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid de las gzhan pa'i mtshan gzhi nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: They are like something else, i.e., the characterized that have characteristics other than arising, etc.

original: de'i phyir / skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur ;
translated: a dream, a flash of lightning, and a cloud,

original: /'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //🔽gang dag dngos po rnams ni ngo bo yod pa kho na yin te //
analyzed: /'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya // zhes gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // gang dag dngos po rnams ni ngo bo yod pa kho na yin te //
translated: so should conditioned things be seen.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who say that things do exist essentially because their characteristics exist,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes zer ba de dag kyang ma grub ste //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes zer ba de dag kyang ma grub ste //
translated: and that such things as the son of a barren woman do not exist and therefore do not have characteristics, are also incorrect.

original: dngos rnams mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos rnams mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because things have characteristics,

original: ngo bo nyid yod nyid mi 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod nyid mi 'dod //
translated: we do not assert that they have essence.

original: ces smras te /
analyzed: ces smras te /
translated: This is what they say.

original: ngo bo nyid yod nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having essence” means “having an essence.”

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs don ma grub //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs don ma grub //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: don 'gal nyid du'ang gyur pa yin //
analyzed: don 'gal nyid du'ang gyur pa yin //
translated: It is also contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sngar bstan pa de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don dbu ma pa la ma grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sngar bstan pa de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don dbu ma pa la ma grub ste /
translated: This is because things are essenceless, as was previously explained. Therefore, the meaning of the statement “because the reason is characterized” is not established for the Mādhyamika.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid du'ang gyur pa yin te sa la @74a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro // gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid du'ang gyur pa yin te sa la @74a * //
translated: Because all phenomena are without characteristics.🔽The meaning of that reason is also contradictory, because in order to prove that earth and so on are essenceless, it is seen that they have characteristics.

original: sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dag sgrub pa la mtshan nyid yod par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dag sgrub pa la mtshan nyid yod par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa de ltar 'di bshad de /🔽sa yi mtshan nyid sa nyid kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa de ltar 'di bshad de / sa yi mtshan nyid sa nyid kyis //
translated: As there are no characteristics, this is explained as follows:🔽The characteristic of earth is not tenable as

original: sra ba nyid du mtshon mi rigs ;
analyzed: sra ba nyid du mtshon mi rigs ;
translated: hardness,

original: / lus kyi rnam shes rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: / lus kyi rnam shes rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of the body consciousness,

original: me nyid kyis ni mi rigs bzhin //
analyzed: me nyid kyis ni mi rigs bzhin //
translated: just as fire is not tenable as heat.

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid 'gog ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid 'gog ste //
translated: This refutes that they are identical.

original: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sa nyid kyis sra ba nyid du mtshon par mi rigs te /
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sa nyid kyis sra ba nyid du mtshon par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that earth is characterized by solidity by virtue of earth itself,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i mtshan nyid me nyid kyis sra ba nyid du mtshon par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i mtshan nyid me nyid kyis sra ba nyid du mtshon par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of the body consciousness, just as it is not logical that fire is characterized by heat by virtue of fire itself.

original: sa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te //
analyzed: sa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te //
translated: By virtue of earth itself means by the characteristic of that which is so.

original: dper na ji ltar khyod kyis ril ba las slob mar ram /
analyzed: dper na ji ltar khyod kyis ril ba las slob mar ram /
translated: For example, is it seen that a student is a student by virtue of a water pot,🔽or is it seen that a preceptor is a preceptor by virtue of a student?

original: slob ma las mkhan por mthong ngam zhes ril ba thogs pa'i sgo nas slob ma yin par mtshon pa'am /
analyzed: slob ma las mkhan por mthong ngam zhes ril ba thogs pa'i sgo nas slob ma yin par mtshon pa'am /
translated: A student is characterized by a water pot in the sense that he holds it,

original: slob ma khrid pa'i sgo nas mkhan po yin par mtshon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: slob ma khrid pa'i sgo nas mkhan po yin par mtshon pa lta bu'o //
translated: and a preceptor is characterized by a student in the sense that he leads him.

original: 'dir ni sa nyid kyis sa'i mtshan nyid de de ltar mtshon par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sa nyid kyis sa'i mtshan nyid de de ltar mtshon par mi rigs te /
translated: Here, it is not logical that the characteristic of earth is characterized by earth itself in that way.

original: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na sa nyid las logs shig na gang gis de mtshon par byed pa'i sra ba nyid ces bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na sa nyid las logs shig na gang gis de mtshon par byed pa'i sra ba nyid ces bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are identical, then since there is nothing at all called “hardness” that is separate from earth, by what is it characterized?

original: de bzhin du ;🔽glang gi mtshan nyid glang nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du ; glang gi mtshan nyid glang nyid kyis //
translated: Similarly,🔽The characteristics of an ox are not asserted

original: nog dang lkog shal sogs mi 'dod //
analyzed: nog dang lkog shal sogs mi 'dod //
translated: to be a dewlap, a tail, and so on.

original: khyad par can gyi blos brtag phyir //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blos brtag phyir //
translated: Because they are to be apprehended by a qualified mind,

original: dper na bong bu'i mtshan nyid bzhin //
analyzed: dper na bong bu'i mtshan nyid bzhin //
translated: they are like the characteristics of a donkey.

original: zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa nyid 'gog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa nyid 'gog ste /
translated: This refutes their being different.

original: glang gi mtshan nyid ni glang nyid kyis nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa yin par mtshon par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: glang gi mtshan nyid ni glang nyid kyis nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa yin par mtshon par mi 'dod de //
translated: The characteristics of an ox are not asserted to be a dewlap, a tail, and so on, by the mere fact of being an ox.

original: khyad par can gyi blos brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bong bu'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blos brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bong bu'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because they are to be apprehended by a qualified mind, they are like the characteristics of a donkey.

original: glang nyid kyis bya ba ni glang gi dngos po ste /
analyzed: glang nyid kyis bya ba ni glang gi dngos po ste /
translated: The state of being an ox is the entity of an ox,

original: rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa dag gis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa dag gis stong pa nyid do //
translated: empty of being a horse and so on, which are of a different type.

original: glang nyid ces bya ba de glang gi rdzas kyi mthun pa nyid nog dang lkog shal dang mjug ma dang / rmig pa dang rva la sogs pa yin par mtshon par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: glang nyid ces bya ba de glang gi rdzas kyi mthun pa nyid nog dang lkog shal dang mjug ma dang / rmig pa dang rva la sogs pa yin par mtshon par mi 'dod de /
translated: The so-called ox itself is not asserted to be the ox’s substantial sameness, such as its dewlap, tail, hooves, horns, and so on.

original: gal te glang nyid ces bya ba dang glang gi rdzas gnyis tha dad pa yin na khyad par can gyi blos brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te glang nyid ces bya ba dang glang gi rdzas gnyis tha dad pa yin na khyad par can gyi blos brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
translated: If the so-called ox itself and the ox’s substance were different, then it would be apprehended by a mind that apprehends the difference.

original: dper na glang nyid kyis bong bu'i mtshan nyid @74b mtshon par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na glang nyid kyis bong bu'i mtshan nyid @74b mtshon par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the ox itself cannot illustrate the characteristics of a donkey.

original: de la rang gi sde pa dag na re //
analyzed: de la rang gi sde pa dag na re //
translated: In response to that, our own schools say,

original: mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin te //
translated: “The characteristics are not different from the basis of those characteristics

original: de mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de mtshon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because they are to be illustrated by that.

original: skyes bu chen po las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the major marks of a great being are not different from a great being.”

original: zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: gcig na ji ltar mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: gcig na ji ltar mtshan nyid yin //
translated: If they are the same, how can they be characteristics?

original: des ni de nyid mi mtshon phyir //
analyzed: des ni de nyid mi mtshon phyir //
translated: Because that does not illustrate itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin na /🔽mtshan gzhi ni gang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin na / mtshan gzhi ni gang /
translated: If the basis and characteristic were identical,

original: mtshan nyid gang zhes tha snyad gdags pa yang med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang zhes tha snyad gdags pa yang med do //
translated: then there would be no basis and no characteristic.

original: yang na mtshan gzhi gcig kho nas sam mtshan nyid gcig kho nas 'grub pas gnyis su smos pa zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na mtshan gzhi gcig kho nas sam mtshan nyid gcig kho nas 'grub pas gnyis su smos pa zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if the basis and characteristic were identical, then the basis would be established by the characteristic alone, or the characteristic would be established by the basis alone.

original: bye brag pa dag ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid du 'dod de //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid du 'dod de //
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas assert that the basis and characteristic are different.🔽They say, “The characteristic is that by which something is characterized.”

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pa'i phyir mtshan nyid do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pa'i phyir mtshan nyid do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: To respond to them, it is said:

original: gzhan na ji ltar mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: gzhan na ji ltar mtshan nyid yin //
translated: If they are different, how can it be a characteristic?

original: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid mi mtshon phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid mi mtshon phyir //
translated: Because one thing cannot characterize another.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin la /
translated: The basis and characteristic are different.

original: gal te gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon par gyur na lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis kyang rta mtshon par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan gzhi ma skyes pa'am zhig pa na yang mtshan nyid dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon par gyur na lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis kyang rta mtshon par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan gzhi ma skyes pa'am zhig pa na yang mtshan nyid dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And if the characterized does not arise or has ceased, then the characteristic would be observed. Therefore, in this way, the characteristic is neither identical to nor different from the characterized.

original: gzhan yang 'di la mtshan nyid dang bcas pa zhig gam mtshan nyid med pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la mtshan nyid dang bcas pa zhig gam mtshan nyid med pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, is this characterized or not?

original: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de la yang mtshan nyid gzhan yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de la yang mtshan nyid gzhan yod par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is characterized, then it would have another characteristic.

original: yang de la yang mtshan nyid gzhan dang gzhan yod par 'gyur bas thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de la yang mtshan nyid gzhan dang gzhan yod par 'gyur bas thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it has another characteristic, then there would be an infinite regress of characteristics.

original: ci ste mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni de ltar na yang mtshan nyid gtan med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni de ltar na yang mtshan nyid gtan med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not characterized, then in that case it would be completely without a characteristic.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space flowers and so on do not exist.
