original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid grub ste /
translated: Therefore the nonexistence of characteristics is established.

original: de la 'dir khungs ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir khungs ni /
translated: Here the source is as follows.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa ste //🔽gang chos gang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhing mtshan nyid mngon par @75a * //
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa ste // gang chos gang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhing mtshan nyid mngon par @75a * //
translated: Śāradvatīputra, all phenomena are without characteristics.🔽That which is the characteristic of any phenomenon is not the characteristic of that, and because characteristics are not established, no phenomenon abides.

original: 'grub pa'i phyir chos 'ga' yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i phyir chos 'ga' yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: 'jig rten nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The world has the characteristic of space,

original: nam mkha' la yang mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang mtshan nyid med //
translated: But space has no characteristic.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa dag yin no /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa dag yin no /
translated: And so on, as it is stated.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: The commentary on the essence of the middle way, the blazing logic

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: Volume five

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ni don dam par mtshan nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag ni don dam par mtshan nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, and sources have characteristics ultimately, because

original: de'i yul la tha snyad khyad par can gyi bya ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i yul la tha snyad khyad par can gyi bya ba mi skye ste /
translated: But the activity of a special convention does not arise in regard to that object.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la 'gro ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la 'gro ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the son of a barren woman, who does not go.

original: lha sbyin la ni de'i yul la 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad khyad par can gyi bya ba yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams la mtshan nyid yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: lha sbyin la ni de'i yul la 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad khyad par can gyi bya ba yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams la mtshan nyid yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But in regard to Devadatta, the activity of a special convention, such as “he goes,” exists. Therefore, characteristics exist in things.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te ma brtags na grags pas 'jig rten gyi dbang du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod par 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma brtags na grags pas 'jig rten gyi dbang du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod par 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you assert that the conventions of going and so on exist in terms of worldly renown when not analyzed, then you are proving what is already established.

original: 'on te rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa dag la don dam par 'gro ba la sogs par yod par 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa dag la don dam par 'gro ba la sogs par yod par 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: But if you assert that going and so on exist ultimately in terms of yogins who are equipoised and who analyze the nature of things just as they are with wisdom, then your reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar don dam par de'i yul la gtan tshigs khyad par can gyi tha snyad yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par de'i yul la gtan tshigs khyad par can gyi tha snyad yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable to apply the term “ultimate” to its object.

original: ji ltar zhe na gal te 'gro ba don dam par yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am bgom pa'i lam la yod par 'gyur grang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gal te 'gro ba don dam par yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am bgom pa'i lam la yod par 'gyur grang ste /
translated: How so? If going existed ultimately, it would exist on the path gone over, not gone over, or being gone over.

original: de la re zhig bye brag tu smra ba dang bye brag pa dag ma song ba la 'gro ba yod par 'dod pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽ma song ba la don dam du //
analyzed: de la re zhig bye brag tu smra ba dang bye brag pa dag ma song ba la 'gro ba yod par 'dod pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa / ma song ba la don dam du //
translated: First, to refute the Vaibhāṣhikas and Vaiśeṣhikas, who assert that going exists on that not yet gone over, it is said:🔽Going does not exist ultimately

original: 'gro ba yod par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par mi 'dod de //
translated: On that not yet gone over.

original: lam yin phyir dang 'gro med phyir //
analyzed: lam yin phyir dang 'gro med phyir //
translated: Because it is a path and because there is no going,

original: dper na ma 'ongs lam bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma 'ongs lam bzhin no //
translated: It is like the path not yet traversed.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba mngon par ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba mngon par ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “the activity of going is not established” is implied.

original: grangs can dag kyang rdul gyi chas che ba'i bya ba byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'jug pa mngon par gsal ba'i tshon ma song ba la 'gro ba yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: grangs can dag kyang rdul gyi chas che ba'i bya ba byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'jug pa mngon par gsal ba'i tshon ma song ba la 'gro ba yod par 'dod de /
translated: Sāṃkhyas assert that going exists on that which has not yet gone over the extent of the part of the particle that is the collection of the activity of the cause of the gross element.

original: de dag ni mngon par gsal ba bkag pas 'gro ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par gsal ba bkag pas 'gro ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Since they refute manifest action, their assertion of going is also not established. Therefore it is mere speculation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: ma song ba la ni 'go ba med de der 'gro ba'i bya ba ma zhugs pa'i @75b phyir ro ;
analyzed: ma song ba la ni 'go ba med de der 'gro ba'i bya ba ma zhugs pa'i @75b phyir ro ;
translated: There is no beginning of going on that over which one has not yet gone because the action of going has not yet engaged there.

original: / song ba la yang 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: / song ba la yang 'gro ba med de /
translated: Nor is there going on that over which one has gone

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of going has disintegrated.

original: bgom pa la ni rkang pa gnyis 'jog pa dang / 'degs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir de la ni 'gro ba yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: bgom pa la ni rkang pa gnyis 'jog pa dang / 'degs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir de la ni 'gro ba yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: But on that over which one goes, going exists because the action characterized by the lowering and raising of the two feet is engaged.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, in response, it is said:

original: bgom la don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: bgom la don dam nyid du na //
translated: In reality,

original: 'gro ba yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa ma yin te //
translated: going does not exist on that over which one goes.🔽Because that over which one goes is never

original: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //🔽bgom par rtag tu med phyir ro //
analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //🔽bgom par rtag tu med phyir ro //
translated: excluded from that over which one has gone and that over which one has not gone.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la bgom pa zhes bya ba de ni song ba'am ma song ba'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la bgom pa zhes bya ba de ni song ba'am ma song ba'am /
translated: Here, that which is called “that being gone over” is either where one has gone, where one has not gone, or that being gone over.🔽

original: gang cung zad ni ma song ba zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gang cung zad ni ma song ba zhig yin grang na /
translated: Here, that which is called “that being gone over” is either that over which one has gone, or that over which one has not gone, or that over which one is going.

original: gnyi ga'i don yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don yang bstan zin to //
translated: But the meaning of both has already been explained.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi bgom pa zhig yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi bgom pa zhig yod par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that that being gone over has the nature of both,

original: de la yang gang nas rkang pa bteg pa de ni song ba yin la /
analyzed: de la yang gang nas rkang pa bteg pa de ni song ba yin la /
translated: then that over which the foot is lifted is that over which one has gone,🔽and that over which the foot is placed is that over which one has not gone.

original: gang du rkang pa 'jog pa de ni ma song ba yin pas de gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i gsum pa gang bgom pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de ni ci yang med pas de'i phyir bgom pa la yang 'gro ba yod pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang du rkang pa 'jog pa de ni ma song ba yin pas de gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i gsum pa gang bgom pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de ni ci yang med pas de'i phyir bgom pa la yang 'gro ba yod pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But apart from those two, there is nothing at all that is a third that being gone over. Therefore it is untenable that going exists on that being gone over.

original: ci ste bgom pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste bgom pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: But if you think that that being gone over is not an object of expression,

original: de ni song ba nyid dam ma song ba nyid du tha snyad gdags par mi nus pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni song ba nyid dam ma song ba nyid du tha snyad gdags par mi nus pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it is not possible to impute it as either that over which one has gone or that over which one has not gone,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bgom pa song dang ma song bar //
analyzed: bgom pa song dang ma song bar //
translated: That being gone over is not That over which one has gone and that over which one has not gone.

original: brjod pa min la'ang 'gro med de //
analyzed: brjod pa min la'ang 'gro med de //
translated: Nor is there going where there is no path,

original: lam yin phyir na 'das pa bzhin //
analyzed: lam yin phyir na 'das pa bzhin //
translated: Because it is a path, like the past,

original: yang na ma 'ongs lam bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na ma 'ongs lam bzhin no //
translated: Or else, like the future path.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te brjod par bya ba yang ma yin la blo'i spyod yul du yang yod pa ma yin na ni des na med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te brjod par bya ba yang ma yin la blo'i spyod yul du yang yod pa ma yin na ni des na med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is neither an object of expression nor the domain of awareness, then it is nonexistent.

original: gal te yod na yang de la 'gro ba yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te yod na yang de la 'gro ba yod par mi rigs te /
translated: If it exists, then it is not tenable that there is going there,

original: lam yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i lam dag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i lam dag pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a path, like the past and future paths.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: “Going surely exists,

original: des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention of possessing it exists.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad med de /
translated: If something does not exist, then the convention of possessing it does not exist,

original: ri bong gi rva can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med pa bzhin no //
translated: like the convention of possessing rabbit horns.

original: 'gro ba yod pa la ni des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod de //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa la ni des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod de //
translated: But if going exists, then the convention of possessing it exists.

original: dper na tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “one goes to Caitra.”

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since going exists, going exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:🔽In the convention “one goes to Caitra,” if one analyzes whether it is the goer or the nongoer, then first:

original: tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa de yang dag par na 'gro ba po'am 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig la brtag grang na de la re zhig /'gro ma grub phyir 'gro @76a * //
analyzed: tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa de yang dag par na 'gro ba po'am 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig la brtag grang na de la re zhig /'gro ma grub phyir 'gro @76a * //
translated: Since going is not established, the goer does not exist.

original: po med ; / de phyir de ni 'gro mi 'dod //
analyzed: po med ; / de phyir de ni 'gro mi 'dod //
translated: Therefore, one who does not go does not go.

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa'i lam dag la 'gro ba rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa'i lam dag la 'gro ba rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: When going is not established in any way on the path gone over, not gone over, and that being gone over,

original: 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'gro ba po yang med bzhin du ji ltar 'gro ba yod pa zhig gang du 'gro na tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'gro ba po yang med bzhin du ji ltar 'gro ba yod pa zhig gang du 'gro na tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: at that time, since going does not exist, how could the goer exist without going? Where would one go such that the convention “the goer goes to Caitra” would be applicable?

original: gal te de 'gro ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni de nam yang 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de 'gro ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni de nam yang 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the intrinsic reality of the goer, then it would never be devoid of the action of going.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po de ni 'gro bar mi 'dod do //🔽kha cig 'gro ba po ma yin par bya ba'i shugs kyis 'gro bar 'dod pa de dag la yang ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po de ni 'gro bar mi 'dod do // kha cig 'gro ba po ma yin par bya ba'i shugs kyis 'gro bar 'dod pa de dag la yang ;
translated: Therefore, it is not maintained that the goer goes.

original: 'gro bo min par 'gro mi rigs //🔽'gro dang bral phyir sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gro bo min par 'gro mi rigs // 'gro dang bral phyir sngon bzhin no //
translated: To those who maintain that the goer does not go by the force of the action of going,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang 'gro bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang 'gro bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that the nongoer goes.🔽Because of being devoid of going, as before.🔽It is not tenable that the nongoer goes.

original: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir dper na sngon dang phyi ma dag la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir dper na sngon dang phyi ma dag la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because of being devoid of going, for example, like the prior and subsequent states of the goer.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'gro ba po ma yin na ni ji ltar 'gro ba po yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'gro ba po ma yin na ni ji ltar 'gro ba po yin /
translated: Moreover, if the goer does not go, how could he be a goer?

original: 'on te 'gro ba po yin na ni 'o na de ltar na 'gro ba po ma yin zhes bya bar 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba po yin na ni 'o na de ltar na 'gro ba po ma yin zhes bya bar 'gal lo //
translated: But if he is a goer, then it is contradictory to say he is a nongoer.

original: rnam grangs las 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig 'gro ba po nyid du khas len pa la ni 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni med pas de la 'gro ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs las 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig 'gro ba po nyid du khas len pa la ni 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni med pas de la 'gro ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
translated: In the case of the one who is a goer and the one who is not a goer, since there is no third possibility apart from the one who is a goer and the one who is not a goer, going does not exist.

original: gal te 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if you think that going exists because

original: 'gro ba po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dug pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽'dug pa po dpyad pa yang de nyid yin te /🔽ci 'gro ba po 'dug gam 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'dug grang na de la re zhig 'gro ba po ni mi 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dug pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na / 'dug pa po dpyad pa yang de nyid yin te / ci 'gro ba po 'dug gam 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'dug grang na de la re zhig 'gro ba po ni mi 'dug ste /
translated: the opposite of the goer, the nongoer, exists,🔽then the analysis of the nongoer is the same as that of the goer.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro // 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'dug ste /
translated: In that case, the goer does not rest because he is not separate from the action of going.

original: 'gro ba dang bral ba la ni tha snyad du yang 'gro ba las ldog pa'i 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba la ni tha snyad du yang 'gro ba las ldog pa'i 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nongoer also does not rest because it is untenable that one who is separate from going engages in resting.

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni med pas de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dug pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa'i gsum pa ni med pas de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dug pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since a third possibility other than those two does not exist, therefore the meaning of the reason “because the opposite of going exists” is not established.

original: bye brag pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Vaiśeṣika says:

original: gang 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas mi 'gro bar ni rigs so //
analyzed: gang 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas mi 'gro bar ni rigs so //
translated: It is logical that one does not go where the action of going has not yet arisen.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba skyes pa ni @76b 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba skyes pa ni @76b 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: One goes where the action of going has arisen.

original: gang gi phyir rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yod pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yod pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Because going exists as something other than the goer, therefore, even though the goer is not the entity of going, he goes because he possesses going.

original: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i yul las lha sbyin 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i yul las lha sbyin 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ste /
translated: The cognition “Devadatta possesses going” arises in dependence on the object that is connected to the entity of going that is different from its own self.

original: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na lha sbyin dbyug pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes smra bar nus so zhe na /
analyzed: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na lha sbyin dbyug pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes smra bar nus so zhe na /
translated: One can say that the cognition and term “Devadatta possesses a stick” arise because they conform to the object.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽rang las gzhan pa'i don 'brel pa //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / rang las gzhan pa'i don 'brel pa //
translated: Here we say:🔽The cognition “The goer”

original: 'gro po snyam pa'i blo 'di 'dod //
analyzed: 'gro po snyam pa'i blo 'di 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be related to an object other than itself.

original: blo dang sgra rjes 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo dang sgra rjes 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the cognition and term conform to the object,

original: dbyug can bzhin min rjes 'gro med //
analyzed: dbyug can bzhin min rjes 'gro med //
translated: it is not like “stick-holder,” because there is no conformity.

original: ces bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i yul la lha sbyin 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i yul la lha sbyin 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ste /
translated: The opponent says that the cognition “Devadatta possesses going” arises in dependence on the object that is related to the entity of going that is different from Devadatta’s own self.

original: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the cognition and term conform to the object,

original: dper na lha sbyin dbyug pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes smras pa'i tshig des rang las gzhan pa'i don dang 'brel pa la 'gro ba po snyam pa'i blo 'di 'byung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin dbyug pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes smras pa'i tshig des rang las gzhan pa'i don dang 'brel pa la 'gro ba po snyam pa'i blo 'di 'byung bar 'dod de /
translated: For example, the cognition “Devadatta has a stick” arises.🔽The cognition “Devadatta is a goer” arises in dependence on the meaning of the word “goer,” which is different from the word itself.🔽The cognition and the word are related because the word “goer” is a valid means of knowledge that is applied to the meaning of the word “goer” in the same way that the word “stick-holder” is applied to the meaning of the word “stick-holder.”

original: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na dbyug pa can bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma nye bar bzhag pa de ni de lta min te /
analyzed: blo dang sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na dbyug pa can bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma nye bar bzhag pa de ni de lta min te /
translated: This is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because there is no relation.

original: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med ce na /
translated: How is there no relation?

original: dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can dag ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang ldan pa shin tu med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can dag ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang ldan pa shin tu med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: A stick and a stick-holder are not related because they do not exist ultimately and because possession does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la 'di 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad tsam yod mod kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ni ci yang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'du byed kyi tshogs yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la 'di 'gro ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad tsam yod mod kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ni ci yang yod pa ma yin
translated: In the relative truth, there is the mere convention that a collection of formations possesses going, since it has the attribute of arising in another place.

original: pas de'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: pas de'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: But since there is no going that is different from the collection of formations, that is also not good.

original: rang gi sde pa kha cig na re 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs 'dun pa'i rgyu dang 'bad pa bskyed pas rlang gi khams kyis bdas pas yul gzhan du rgyun chags su 'byung ba la 'gro zhes bya bar zad kyi 'gro ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: rang gi sde pa kha cig na re 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs 'dun pa'i rgyu dang 'bad pa bskyed pas rlang gi khams kyis bdas pas yul gzhan du rgyun chags su 'byung ba la 'gro zhes bya bar zad kyi 'gro ba zhes bya ba
translated: Some Buddhist schools say: The collection of elements and derivative forms is impelled by the element of wind, and through the cause of intention and exertion, it arises in a continuous series in another place. That is called going.

original: 'gro ba po las don tha dad par gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba po las don tha dad par gyur ba ni med de /
translated: But going is not different from the goer,

original: skye ba'i phyogs nyid du skye ba po zhig pa'i phyir me la sogs pa'i rgyun bzhin pas 'gro ba ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes @77a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyogs nyid du skye ba po zhig pa'i phyir me la sogs pa'i rgyun bzhin pas 'gro ba ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes @77a * //
translated: like the continuum of fire and so on, because the goer ceases in the very place where he arises. Therefore going is an error.

original: zer ba de dag la yang kho bo cag ni don dam par 'gro ba zhes bya ba med pa dang / kun rdzob tu ni de 'dod pa kho na yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rgyun chags yul gzhan 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: zer ba de dag la yang kho bo cag ni don dam par 'gro ba zhes bya ba med pa dang / kun rdzob tu ni de 'dod pa kho na yin par bstan pa'i phyir / rgyun chags yul gzhan 'byung ba yi //
translated: In response to those who say this, we say that ultimately there is no such thing as a “transmigrator,” but we do assert it conventionally.🔽In dependence on the continuum of compounded phenomena

original: 'du byed rgyun la brten nas ni //
analyzed: 'du byed rgyun la brten nas ni //
translated: That is a continuum and arises in other places,

original: me la sogs bzhin 'khrul pa'i 'gro ;
analyzed: me la sogs bzhin 'khrul pa'i 'gro ;
translated: The world is confused, like the perception of a fire wheel.

original: / de yang kun rdzob de nyid min //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / de yang kun rdzob de nyid min // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is conventional, not ultimate.

original: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: We say this because we refute that it is the same or different, because it is the nature of a collection, and because consciousness itself is confused.

original: grangs can dag ni rdul gyi shas che ba'i bya ba byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'jug pa mngon par gsal ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni rdul gyi shas che ba'i bya ba byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'jug pa mngon par gsal ba'i tshe na /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas assert that when the activity of the collection that is dominated by the quality of motility becomes manifest, the goer exists.

original: 'gro ba po yod par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba po yod par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir /
translated: Therefore, for their sake, we say:

original: ser skya pa yis rnam brtags pa'i //
analyzed: ser skya pa yis rnam brtags pa'i //
translated: The goer imputed by the Sāṃkhyas

original: 'gro po don dam nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: 'gro po don dam nyid mi rigs //
translated: is not tenable even conventionally.

original: tshogs pa rdzas su med phyir dang // yang na g-yo ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa rdzas su med phyir dang // yang na g-yo ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection does not substantially exist, or because it is devoid of movement.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what they say.

original: gal te ser skya pa dag na re /
analyzed: gal te ser skya pa dag na re /
translated: If the Sāṃkhya says,

original: gang dag la tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de dag la ni skyon der 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang dag la tshogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de dag la ni skyon der 'gyur gyi /
translated: “The error would apply to those for whom the collection does not substantially exist.

original: kho bo cag ni tshogs pa can rdzas su yod pa kho nar 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni tshogs pa can rdzas su yod pa kho nar 'dod de /
translated: But we assert that the collection of parts substantially exists.🔽Because if the parts of the collection of activity are not apprehended, the collection of activity is not apprehended, like the nature of the parts of the collection.”

original: byed pa tshogs pa'i yan lag rnams ma bzung na bya ba tshogs pa can yang gzung du med pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i yan lag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag gi 'di ltar gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa tshogs pa'i yan lag rnams ma bzung na bya ba tshogs pa can yang gzung du med pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i yan lag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag gi 'di ltar gsal bar bya ste /
translated: This should be clarified for them:

original: gal te tshogs pa rdzas yod de //🔽tshogs byed ma bzung gzung med phyir //
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa rdzas yod de // tshogs byed ma bzung gzung med phyir //
translated: If the collection substantially exists,

original: de yi bdag bzhin de mi rigs //
analyzed: de yi bdag bzhin de mi rigs //
translated: it is not tenable that it is like the self of that,

original: de dag rdzas su med phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rdzas su med phyir ro //
translated: because it does not substantially exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / byed pa mig la sogs pa de dag ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / byed pa mig la sogs pa de dag ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that activity and so on are the four great elements and the agent, such as the eye, and so on.

original: bya ba byed pa tshogs pa'i yan lag de dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa tshogs pa'i yan lag de dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those parts of the activity of going do not substantially exist.

original: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: How they do not substantially exist has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rnam par bzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yin pas don dam par dpyad pa mi bzod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rnam par bzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yin pas don dam par dpyad pa mi bzod do //
translated: Therefore, the presentation of coming and going is a worldly convention, and so cannot withstand ultimate analysis.

original: bya ba lhag ma dgag pa yang //
analyzed: bya ba lhag ma dgag pa yang //
translated: The refutation of the remaining activities

original: phyogs des rab tu bstan pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs des rab tu bstan pa yin //
translated: Is also taught by this approach.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'di ni lha sbyin smra'o zhes bya ba de yang smras pa smra'am /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'di ni lha sbyin smra'o zhes bya ba de yang smras pa smra'am /
translated: How so?

original: 'on te ma smras pa smra grang na /
analyzed: 'on te ma smras pa smra grang na /
translated: If it is said, “Devadatta speaks,” is it the case that one who has already spoken speaks, or is it the case that one who has not yet spoken speaks?

original: re zhig smras pa @77b la ni smra ba med de /
analyzed: re zhig smras pa @77b la ni smra ba med de /
translated: First, one who has already spoken does not speak,

original: tshig gi bya ba 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of speaking has already passed.

original: ma smras pa la yang smra ba med de /
analyzed: ma smras pa la yang smra ba med de /
translated: One who has not yet spoken also does not speak,

original: tshig gi bya ba ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of speaking has not yet begun.

original: smra bzhin pa yang smra ba med de /
analyzed: smra bzhin pa yang smra ba med de /
translated: One who is currently speaking also does not speak,🔽because

original: smras pa dang ma smras pa ma gtogs par smra bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa dang ma smras pa ma gtogs par smra bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no speaking other than speaking that has already occurred or not yet occurred.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar smra ba po smra'am smra ba po ma yin pa smra grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar smra ba po smra'am smra ba po ma yin pa smra grang na /
translated: In the same way, does the speaker speak, or does the non-speaker speak?

original: de la smra ba po gang smra bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
analyzed: de la smra ba po gang smra bar 'gyur ba ni med de /
translated: In this regard, the speaker does not speak,

original: rnam pa thams cad du smra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du smra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no speaking in any way.

original: smra ba po ma yin pa la yang smra ba med de /
analyzed: smra ba po ma yin pa la yang smra ba med de /
translated: The non-speaker also does not speak,

original: smra ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not endowed with speaking.

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa'i smra ba po ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa'i smra ba po ni mi 'thad de /
translated: A speaker other than those two is untenable,

original: sngon dang phyi ma dag la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin bas de'i phyir su zhig smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma dag la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin bas de'i phyir su zhig smra bar 'gyur /
translated: because he is like the one who has not yet come into existence and the one who has ceased to exist. Therefore, who would speak?

original: de bzhin du smra ba po dang smra ba gcig gam tha dad pa cig yin grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba po dang smra ba gcig gam tha dad pa cig yin grang na /
translated: In the same way, is the speaker and the speaking the same or different?

original: gnyi ga yang skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Both are faulty.

original: de bzhin du za ba po za bar byed pa dang / byed pa po las byed pa dang / gcod pa po gcod pa dang / lta ba po lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po bkag pa bzhin du dpyad pa dang dgag pa 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du za ba po za bar byed pa dang / byed pa po las byed pa dang / gcod pa po gcod pa dang / lta ba po lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po bkag pa bzhin du dpyad pa dang dgag pa 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: So too, the eater and the eaten, the agent and the action, the cutter and the cut, the viewer and the seen, and so on, should be analyzed and refuted in the same way that going and the goer are refuted.

original: de'i phyir lung las /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las /
translated: Therefore, a scripture says:

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are without coming and going.🔽They do not pass beyond that state.

original: de dag ni gnas de las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni gnas de las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: 'di la 'ong med 'gro ba 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: 'di la 'ong med 'gro ba 'ga' yang med //
translated: Here there is no coming at all, nor any going.

original: chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' ji bzhin no //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad nam mkha' ji bzhin no //
translated: All phenomena are like space.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni blun pa dang / sems med pa dang / bya ba med pa dang / rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni blun pa dang / sems med pa dang / bya ba med pa dang / rtsva dang shing dang rtsig pa lta bu'o //
translated: And similarly, all phenomena are stupid, mindless, inactive, like grass, trees, walls, and so on.

original: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: These and other such statements are established.

original: 'dir smras pa nang gi dngos po rnams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa nang gi dngos po rnams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: Internal things certainly exist essentially ultimately.

original: de dag la bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because bondage and liberation exist for them.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni de dag med de mo gsham gyi bu las bcings pa dang thar pa dag med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni de dag med de mo gsham gyi bu las bcings pa dang thar pa dag med pa bzhin no //
translated: They do not exist for what is nonexistent, just as bondage and liberation do not exist for the son of a barren woman.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag yod de /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag yod de /
translated: Bondage and liberation exist for internal things.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis / dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: Because the Bhagavān said:🔽The childish, who do not know the true Dharma,

original: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
translated: Have a long samsara.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And he said, “In order to liberate beings from the prison of samsara, I teach the eightfold noble path.”

original: @78a * // 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: @78a * // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te dngos nyid yod 'dod de //
analyzed: gal te dngos nyid yod 'dod de //
translated: If you assert that things exist through their own characteristics,

original: 'khor dang thar pa yod phyir na //
analyzed: 'khor dang thar pa yod phyir na //
translated: Bondage and liberation would not exist.

original: gang tshe ji ltar rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: gang tshe ji ltar rnam brtags pa //
translated: When and how could

original: de dag rang bzhin rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin rnam dpyad na //
translated: When they are analyzed,

original: nges gzung med pa de yi tshe //
analyzed: nges gzung med pa de yi tshe //
translated: their nature is not ascertained.

original: ji ltar bcings shing gang nas thar //
analyzed: ji ltar bcings shing gang nas thar //
translated: Then how could they be bound, and from what could they be liberated?

original: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid byed pa dag gis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i nang gi dngos po de dag gi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas rnam par dpyad pa na //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid byed pa dag gis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i nang gi dngos po de dag gi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas rnam par dpyad pa na //
translated: When the nature of those internal things that are imagined by the characteristics of the agent, etc., is analyzed by the process explained above,

original: nges par gzung du med pa de'i tshe na gang zhig de ltar bcings shing gang nas thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges par gzung du med pa de'i tshe na gang zhig de ltar bcings shing gang nas thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: then their nature is not ascertained. At that time, how could they be bound and from what could they be liberated?

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ci bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it only untenable that they are bound and liberated?

original: de'i phyir 'du byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid yod ma yin pa //🔽sgyu ma rmi lam lta bu dang // rang gi rgyu dang rkyen dbang las //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod ma yin pa // sgyu ma rmi lam lta bu dang // rang gi rgyu dang rkyen dbang las //
translated: Compounded phenomena do not intrinsically exist.🔽Like illusions and dreams,🔽it is tenable that they obtain their nature

original: bdag nyid khyad par 'thob la 'thad //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag nyid khyad par 'thob la 'thad //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
translated: in dependence on their own causes and conditions.

original: gang dag la 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa de dag ni sngar dpyad pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir bcings pa dang thar ba dag mi 'thad do //🔽'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang las skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi khyad par thob pa dag la ni bcings pa
analyzed: gang dag la 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa de dag ni sngar dpyad pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir bcings pa dang thar ba dag mi 'thad do // 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang las skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi khyad par thob pa dag la ni bcings pa
translated: Those for whom compounded phenomena exist inherently cannot have bondage and liberation, because of the arguments previously explained.

original: dang thar pa dag 'thad do //
analyzed: dang thar pa dag 'thad do //
translated: But for those for whom compounded phenomena do not exist inherently, but are like illusions and mirages, arising from their own causes and conditions, and attaining their own nature, which is a particular state different from the previous instant, bondage and liberation are tenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di na 'du byed kyi tshogs thog ma med pa'i dus na zhugs pa bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i 'dzin khris zin pa /
analyzed: 'di na 'du byed kyi tshogs thog ma med pa'i dus na zhugs pa bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i 'dzin khris zin pa /
translated: Here, the collection of compounded phenomena, which has been operating since beginningless time, is seized by the tight fist of the apprehension of “I” and “mine.”

original: 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis bcings pa las yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis bcings pa las yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pas /
translated: It is bound by the shackles of the afflictions, such as desire.

original: bcing ba mtha' dag bkrol zhing 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par 'das pa'i thar pa zhes bya ba tha snyad du gtogs pa'i shes rab kyis tha snyad gdags pa 'thad do //
analyzed: bcing ba mtha' dag bkrol zhing 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par 'das pa'i thar pa zhes bya ba tha snyad du gtogs pa'i shes rab kyis tha snyad gdags pa 'thad do //
translated: The conventional wisdom that is included in the conventional designation of liberation, which is the complete release from all bonds and the transcendence of the prison of cyclic existence, is tenable.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not ultimately.

original: de ltar yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de ltar yang ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba ldog par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor ba med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba ldog par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor ba med la /
translated: The Tathāgata stops cyclic existence, but no one is in cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Tathāgata demonstrates nirvāṇa, but no one attains nirvāṇa.

original: rang gi sde pa kha cig na re /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa kha cig na re /
translated: Some Buddhist schools say:

original: rgyu dang rkyen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud @78b pa'i rgyun 'brel ba'i ming dang gzugs 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thar pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan pa ni bcings pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud @78b pa'i rgyun 'brel ba'i ming dang gzugs 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thar pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan pa ni bcings pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Name and form that are the continuity of the connection of causes and conditions from one to another, which is concomitant with attachment and so on and possesses the factors that are adverse to liberation, is called bondage.

original: bcings pa la dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i sgron ma mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral ba skyes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ni thar pa zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: bcings pa la dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i sgron ma mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral ba skyes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ni thar pa zhes bya ba'o
translated: Liberation is the freedom from the bonds of attachment and so on, due to the arising of the lamp of correct knowledge that is free from the darkness of ignorance, which arises from listening to the sublime teaching and properly reflecting on it.

original: zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /🔽ming dang gzugs ni don dam du //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa / ming dang gzugs ni don dam du //
translated: In response to those who say this, it is said:🔽Name and form🔽are not logical in the ultimate

original: 'khor bar rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'khor bar rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: cycle of existence.

original: 'dus byas yin phyir phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin phyir phyi rol gyi //
translated: Because they are conditioned,

original: sa la sogs pa mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: like external earth and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la ming ni phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ming ni phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: Name refers to the four non-form aggregates.

original: gzugs ni lus dang dbang po zhes bya ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni lus dang dbang po zhes bya ba'i tshogs so //
translated: Form refers to the collection called body and faculties.

original: de ni don dam par na 'khor bar 'byung zhing 'gro ba dang kun du 'gro bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni don dam par na 'khor bar 'byung zhing 'gro ba dang kun du 'gro bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that they arise, go, and transmigrate in the ultimate cycle of existence.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag gis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag gis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because they are manifestly conditioned by causes and conditions.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, external earth and so on are not asserted to be samsara because they are conditioned.

original: de thar pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de thar pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, liberation is untenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ming gzugs don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: ming gzugs don dam nyid du na //
translated: Name-and-form is not liberated

original: ji ltar yang ni thar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar yang ni thar mi 'gyur //
translated: in any way whatsoever ultimately.

original: skye dang ldan phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye dang ldan phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises and disintegrates,

original: phyi rol chu la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: phyi rol chu la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: like external water and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la de'i rgyun thar par brtag gam skad cig ma thar par brtag grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la de'i rgyun thar par brtag gam skad cig ma thar par brtag grang na /
translated: Here, is the continuum of name-and-form conceived to be liberated or is the moment of name-and-form conceived to be liberated?

original: de la re zhig rgyun ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis chu'i rlabs 'byung ba dang 'gag pa bzhin la skad cig ma yang bcings pa ni bcings pa'i dus nyid du zhig pa'i phyir dang / dus phyi mar 'byung ba yang bcings bzhin kho nar 'byung ba'i phyir thar par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rgyun ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis chu'i rlabs 'byung ba dang 'gag pa bzhin la skad cig ma yang bcings pa ni bcings pa'i dus nyid du zhig pa'i phyir dang / dus phyi mar 'byung ba yang bcings bzhin kho nar 'byung ba'i phyir thar par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: First, the continuum does not exist as a substance, just like the arising and cessation of waves in water. Also, the moment of name-and-form is not liberated because that which is bound disintegrates at the time of being bound and that which arises in a later time arises while still being bound.

original: de ltar re zhig ming dang gzugs la bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ming dang gzugs la bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, first, bondage and liberation are untenable for name-and-form.🔽The Vātsīputrīyas assert that the person cycles in samsara and attains liberation, but is neither identical with the aggregates, sense spheres, and constituents nor a different entity from them.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams las gzhan pa'i gang zag 'khor ba dang thar par 'dod pas de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽gang zag yang dag nyid du ni //
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams las gzhan pa'i gang zag 'khor ba dang thar par 'dod pas de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa / gang zag yang dag nyid du ni //
translated: To refute that, it is said:

original: 'khor dang thar bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'khor dang thar bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: The person does not cycle in reality

original: gdags bya yin phyir khang pa bzhin //
analyzed: gdags bya yin phyir khang pa bzhin //
translated: Because it is designated like a house

original: brjod bya yin phyir dri dang 'dra //
analyzed: brjod bya yin phyir dri dang 'dra //
translated: And because it is expressed like a scent.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsva dang shing dang sa dang smyig ma dang rdo ba dang so phag la sogs @79a * //🔽pa dag gis khang par gdags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsva dang shing dang sa dang smyig ma dang rdo ba dang so phag la sogs @79a * // pa dag gis khang par gdags pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a house is designated on the basis of grass, wood, earth, bamboo, stones, bricks, and so on.🔽In the same way, the person is designated on the basis of the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag la brten nas gang zag tu gdags par zad pas de dag med par de bstan dka'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag la brten nas gang zag tu gdags par zad pas de dag med par de bstan dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to teach that the person does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gang zag ni khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dri bzhin du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa med do //🔽yang na gang zag de ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag ni khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dri bzhin du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang thar pa med do // yang na gang zag de ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the person is an imputed object like a house, and since it is an object of expression like a smell, it is neither bound nor liberated.

original: gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, the person does not exist because its characteristics are not observed apart from form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas /
translated: It is like a sky flower.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yang na gang zag gang zag min //
analyzed: yang na gang zag gang zag min //
translated: The person is not a person,

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: because it possesses causes, like a pot.

original: skye dang ldan phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye dang ldan phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it possesses arising, it is perishable,

original: shes bya yin phyir 'ong ba bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'di la gang zag de phung po la sogs pa las gzhan zhig yin nam /
analyzed: shes bya yin phyir 'ong ba bzhin // zhes bya ba ni 'di la gang zag de phung po la sogs pa las gzhan zhig yin nam /
translated: because it is an object of knowledge, it is impermanent.

original: gzhan ma yin pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Here, is the person different from the aggregates and so on, or is it not different?

original: gal te gzhan yin na ni mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin na ni mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not have the characteristics of a person.

original: gzhan ma yin na ni phung po la sogs pa zhig pa na gang zag kyang 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin na ni phung po la sogs pa zhig pa na gang zag kyang 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different, the error would arise that when the aggregates and so on disintegrate, the person would also disintegrate.

original: ci ste gang zag de gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin la //
analyzed: ci ste gang zag de gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin la //
translated: But if you say that the person is not to be described as either the same as or different from the aggregates,

original: rdzas su yang yod par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas su yang yod par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: and that it exists substantially,

original: de lta yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.🔽The person is not established as substantially existent

original: gang zag brjod du med phyir bas //
analyzed: gang zag brjod du med phyir bas //
translated: because it is inexpressible.

translated: The person is not established as substantially existent because it is inexpressible.🔽The person is not established as substantially existent because

original: ci re zhig dri brjod du med kyang rdzas su yod pa bzhin du gang zag kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par 'gyur ram //
analyzed: ci re zhig dri brjod du med kyang rdzas su yod pa bzhin du gang zag kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir rdzas su yod par 'gyur ram //
translated: Is it that, like the inexpressible but substantially existent smell, the person is also inexpressible but substantially existent?

original: 'on te mo gsham gyi bu dkar po dang sngon por brjod du med pa'i phyir rdzas su med pa bzhin du gang zag kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mo gsham gyi bu dkar po dang sngon por brjod du med pa'i phyir rdzas su med pa bzhin du gang zag kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or is it that, like the substantially nonexistent son of a barren woman, the person is also inexpressible and substantially nonexistent?

original: rdzas su med par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de rdzas su yod pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: rdzas su med par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de rdzas su yod pa nyid nyams so //
translated: Since it is not certain, the substantial existence of the person is undermined.

original: de ltar phung po bdag @79b med cing //
analyzed: de ltar phung po bdag @79b med cing //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are selfless,

original: srog med sems can yod min pa //🔽mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
analyzed: srog med sems can yod min pa // mkhas pas gzu bo'i blo dag gis //
translated: lifeless, and sentient beings do not exist.🔽The wise should understand them

original: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
translated: as appropriate with an unbiased mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zag dgag pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zag dgag pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the refutation of the person is similar to that.

original: zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba ni grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las rgyun du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba ni grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las rgyun du 'gro ba'am /
translated: Here, the self is the continuum of the Sāṃkhya and Vaiśeṣika traditions.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyis brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyis brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “self” because it is the object of the notion of “I” and because it is the object of the idea of “mine.”

original: srog ces bya ba ni gcer bu bdag gi gzhung las 'tsho ba'i don gyis srog ce'o //🔽sems can zhes bya ba ni rgol ba thams cad kyi gzhung las yod pa'i dngos po ni sems can no zhe 'am ;
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni gcer bu bdag gi gzhung las 'tsho ba'i don gyis srog ce'o // sems can zhes bya ba ni rgol ba thams cad kyi gzhung las yod pa'i dngos po ni sems can no zhe 'am ;
translated: It is called “life” because it is the support of heat and consciousness, as stated in the texts of the Nirgranthas.🔽It is called “sentient being” because it is the support of sensation, or because it is the support of the world of beings.

original: /'gro ba rnams su sbyor ba ni sems can no zhe'o //🔽gang zag ces bya ba ni gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gi gzhung las yang 'gro ba len pa'i phyir gang zag ce'o //
analyzed: /'gro ba rnams su sbyor ba ni sems can no zhe'o //🔽gang zag ces bya ba ni gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag gi gzhung las yang 'gro ba len pa'i phyir gang zag ce'o //
translated: It is called “person” because it is the support of the aggregates.
